28477133.review:
First of all, it's hard to thumb it down, because some parts are actually pretty fun to play. And it is free.

Fun is mostly the VN part, which has some interesting events and of course the 'possibility' of digging the sexy female crewmembers. BTW, (spoilers) don't expect lots of boobs and such stuff, there is only one scene.
You could just search/ look at all the jpg-Images in the game directory, and you've seen it all.
Don't know how this qualifies for the 'nudity' tag.

Unfortunately, the turn-based combat is more of a joke, simply because you have to mod your units in a very specific way (which you do not know right from the start) and you have to  abuse the AI to beat some scenarios. Alternatively, you can reduce the difficulty setting, taking away most of the turn-based fun you might expect from this game.

This applies to the harder difficulty levels, you can switch it down and up like you please.

On the lower levels, it's ridiculously easy. You get lots of combat rewards, making following fights even more easy.
If you play the more challenging difficulties, it's too easy to get a beating even with perfect strategy.

Example: if the AI would simply fire all guns at you main unit, it would be destroyed. Game over.
Or the AI fires all guns at your escorted unit. It gets destroyed, game over.
Or you line up you units for a perfect elimination, but due to bad RNG you miss most of your shots, while the AI units seem to be more lucky  - game over.
Other examples are AI reinforcements appearing right next to you - another game over - or the usually dumb acting AI decides to make a statement and wipes out important units by poor luck - you already guessed it, game over again.

Higher difficulty levels:
It is true that the scenarions can be beaten with limited forces by abusing AI weaknesses, turning the strategy game into a puzzle, where you try to move in such strange ways that the AI won't kill your critical units.
But I guarantee you: If you would give control over the AI units to a human player, you would have 0 (ZERO) chances to beat a single scenario. It's just too unbalanced and unfair.

So, if you want to have fun, ignore the turn-based part and enjoy the VN.
Or forget it and look for another turn-based strategy game.

28346007.review:
Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius ist eine Visual Novel mit Taktik-RPG-Elementen in einem SciFi-Szenario aus dem Hause Love in Space. Sie wurde zunächst in Kapiteln veröffentlicht, ehe sie komplettiert in einer vollständigen Version zur Verfügung stand, die es seit Juli 2014 auf Steam zum gibt. Veröffentlicht wurde das Ganze von Sekai Project. 
 
In Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius schlüpft man in die Rolle des jungen Kayto Shields aus den neutralen Randsystemen, der sich zum Militärdienst verpflichtet und nach Ausbildung als Kapitän eines brandneuen Sturmträgers, der Sunrider, eingesetzt wird. Seine Feuertaufe kommt jedoch verfrüht, da eine feindliche Invasionsflotte noch vor dem ersten Triebwerkstest einen Angriff auf Shields Heimatkolone Cera beginnt. Machtlos muss er mit ansehen, wie seine Heimatwelt erobert wird und er muss um seine Crew und sich zu retten wiederwillig den Rückzug antreten. Von jeglichem Kontakt zu seiner Heimat abgeschnitten muss er nun versuchen Verbündete zu gewinnen um die drohende Invasion durch die Flotten von PACT zu stoppen. So begibt sich Shields auf die Odyssee quer durch die Galaxie, auf der man ihn und seine Crew begleitet. Die Story dreht sich vollständig um die Versuche die Kampffähigkeit des Schiffes herzustellen und die Invasion des neutralen Randes zu zerschlagen.  
 
Die Visual Novel gehört mit einer Länge von 10 bis 30 Stunden zur Längenkategorie Mittel und die Handlung bewegt sich recht flott voran, ohne verwirrend zu wirken. Die Story ist dabei trotz einer hohen Menge an Entscheidungen, vor die der Leser gestellt wird, recht linear. Die Entscheidungen wirken sich an gewissen Stellen innerhalb der VN aus und auch auf die Story des Nachfolgers. Auch in den Haupt- und Nebenmissionen können sich diese Entscheidungen auswirken. Diese laufen in Form von rundenbasierenden Taktik-Kämpfen ab und sind, zumindest auf normaler Schwierigkeitsstufe, ziemlich fordernd. Häufiges Speichern auf unterschiedlichen Speicherplätzen hilft dabei immens. Jedoch muss man sich als unbegabter Taktiker nicht die Haare raufen und als Meistertaktiker nicht langweilen, da es jede Menge unterschiedlicher Schwierigkeitsstufen für jeden Geschmack gibt. Die Nebenmissionen sind dabei alle Freiwillig, jedoch würde ich anraten sie nach Möglichkeit zu erledigen, da jede Mission wertvolle Finanzmittel generiert, mit denen man das eigene Schiff und die dazu gehörigen Mechs – die sogenannten Ryder  – aufrüsten und verbessern kann. Außerdem sammelt man im Verlauf Kommandopunkte, die man für große Befehle an die ganze Flotte ausgeben kann um unterschiedliche Werte für ein paar Runden zu steigern oder gar das große Hauptgeschütz der Sunrider abzufeuern. 
 
Die Erzählerteile der Visual Novel sind in dritter Person geschrieben und relativ rar gesät. Die meiste Zeit verbringt man damit Dialoge zu lesen. Das macht die Visual Novel weder besonders gut noch besonders schlecht, ist aber eine gewisse Eigenart, die vielleicht nicht jedem Leser liegt. Meistens bleibt die Perspektive auf Kayto fokussiert, jedoch gibt es hin und wieder auch Szenen, in denen andere Charaktere ohne Shields Anwesenheit beleuchtet werden. Die Story an Sich ist eine Space Opera mit der richtigen Menge an unterschiedlichen Eindrücken. Sie bleibt größtenteils ernst, ist jedoch trotz ihrer Tragik nicht all zu düster und wird hin und wieder von sehr leichtherzigen Momenten aufgelockert. Geblödelt wird in der Story nur selten, aber gut getimt, was alles zu einer recht runden Geschichte macht. Alles in Allem ist die Story sehr erwachsen und auch wenn das Intro etwas anderes suggeriert, ist die Visual Novel nicht von zwanghaften Erotik-Szenen überladen. Genauer gesagt, gibt es nur eine Erotik-Szene, die jedoch sehr gut in die Story passt und in ihrer ungekürzten Fassung nur mit Restaurationspatch zur Verfügung ist, den Love in Space auf ihrer Internetseite zum Download anbieten. 
 
In Sachen Optik haben sich die Entwickler Mühe gegeben. Die Charaktere, Schiffe und Mechs haben sehr gute Designs und der Stil ähnelt sehr typischen SciFi-Mech-Animes aus Japan, auch wenn die Entwickler selbst nicht aus Japan kommen. Zwar wirkt der Stil von Hintergründen und Charakteren etwas zu klinisch sauber und die Hintergründe heben sich in ihrem 3D-Stil von den Charakteren selbst ab, dennoch ist das Zusammenspiel an Sich recht stimmig und der Gesamtstil konsistent. Das Ganze zieht sich durch bis hin zu den ordentlich gestalteten Taktik-Schlachten und deren Animationen, auch wenn man hier die Limitierung der Engine des Spiels zu spüren bekommt. 
 
In Sachen Sound haben die Entwickler auch ihr Möglichstes gegeben, was sich vor allen in den Taktik-Kämpfen bemerkbar macht. Synchronisiert ist die Visual Novel zwar nicht, jedoch gibt es für jede verbündete Einheit gesprochene Zeilen auf Englisch für Rückmeldungen in der Schlacht. Der Soundtrack reicht von sehr ordentlich bis meisterlich. Manche Stücke in den Leseszenen sind zweckdienlich, prägen sich aber nicht ein, während andere wiederum richtig mitreißen. Die Songs im Kampf sind zum größten Teil hervorragend und lassen beim Grübeln und betrachten der Kampfanimationen richtiges Anime-Feeling aufkommen. 
 
Technisch hat das Entwicklerteam für ihre beschrankten Mittel viel erreicht. Diese Beschränkungen sind dabei nicht nur finanzieller Natur, sondern liegen auch in der Natur der Engine. Die VN verwendet die recht bekannte RenPy-Engine, die für Visual Novels zwar ausreichend ist, jedoch einige Limitierungen mit sich bringt. Daher kann es gerade in den Taktik-Schlachten häufiger zu Lags kommen und hin und wieder stürzt sie einfach mit Fehlermeldungen ab. Das liegt daran, dass die Engine hierbei für etwas verwendet wird, für das sie nicht gemacht wurde und nur die Entwickler der Engine selbst könnten gewisse Fehler beheben oder alles geschmeidiger machen. Trotzdem läuft die VN selbst auf langsameren Systemen recht ordentlich und da es sich um rundenbasierende Kämpfe handelt, sind keine Reaktionen in Sekundenbruchteilen erfordert. 

In Sachen Bonusinhalte gibt es im Vergleich zu anderen Visual Novels bei Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius leider nicht so viel zu sehen. Zwar wurden alle gelöschten Szenen der auf Kapitel basierenden Versionen zum Nachlesen im Menü verfügbar gemacht, jedoch fehlen für Visual Novels typische Boni, wie zum Beispiel eine CG- oder Musik-Galerie. 
 
Alles in Allem ist die Visual Novel definitiv ein sehr solides Packet und ist jede Lese- und Spielminute wert. Sie hat für eine kostenlose Visual Novel sehr viel zu bieten und ist damit nicht nur ein hervorragender Einstieg ins Sunrider-Universum, sondern auch definitiv für Neulinge, die ins Genre mal reinschnuppern wollen, zu empfehlen.

28109593.review:
I have to admit I mostly looked at this because it was free, but it turned out to be worth my time, and that's a best a pay-title can live up to, as well. 

As for the different parts of the game: 

[b]A)[/b] The Novel: It's actually pretty good; Not that much content in total, but it does something very few games manage to pull off: Actual decisions that actually gave me a bad conscience in one case, even if the measureable result would be a score I can't even see. 
There's characters with believable motivations and a lot of cases of "choosing the lesser evil" that I fondly remember. 
Of course, in the end it still can't quite hide the fact it's also a japanese-inspired dating VN, though if you're reading this you're probably expecting at least that much. 

[b]B)[/b] The Background(story): Well, it's about Mechas in Space, that per se doesn't make a lot of sense. Then you have a lot of "Characters" in situations that, as other reviews have noted, one wouldn't necessarily expect them. 
The background, like the storyline, is well done and internally consistent, but there's the occasional "why?" that you'll just need to be able to handwave to enjoy the novel. 

[b]C)[/b] The Gameplay:  First things first, this is HARD.  On an average difficulty you might very well require several tries to fulfill a mission, and your performance influences the reward. Luckily, the tried and trusted system of ramping up costs for following upgrades and increasing rewards in later missions smoothes the curve out a bit, and a mediocre player won't find himself at a horrible disadvantage in later fights. 
The Combat is generally doable, but also filled with chance mechanics, starting with un-stratified hit percentages and continuing with varable damage, meaning that the most important tool in winning a fight is save scumming.
I'm generally a fan of games that emphasize "risk management" - managing probability and making choices based on what could happen - but the difficulty is brutal and the mechanics simple, making me think regular quicksaves were part of the game design.

Moment of truth, is it worth your time? 
Well, what do I know, but it certainly was worth mine. If you're looking for a Visual Novel with dating elements and some actual gameplay, this "game" is certainly worth the investment to try it out. 

[b]Tl;dr:[/b]
[list]
[*]Solid Gameplay, high difficulty
[*]Good Novel parts, including actual meaningful choices (a few)
[*]OK backstory, requires a bit of suspension of disbelief from the player
[*]Decent visuals for a VN
[*]Savescumming. You'll probably see for yourself why that got it's own bullet point. ;)
[/list]

28045085.review:
本文首发于澄空学园：https://bbs.sumisora.org/read.php?tid=11066164&keyword=sunrider

系统：
SLG部分：S
从早期开发视频和图片可以看出这游戏的战斗系统经过了多次大幅度修改，从最早的“表格式”战斗系统到后来的四边形战棋系统，再到现在已经被修改为六边形战棋系统。
战斗部分的难度可调，在标准难度下游戏整体偏难，不过游戏允许玩家在任何时间变更游戏难度，在最低难度下，玩家将可以轻松随意的完成战斗，这无疑是为了照顾对这类游戏缺乏经验，或只对游戏情节感兴趣的玩家。
没有什么华丽的大招，主角与妹子们也和敌人杂兵一样使用镭射、导弹之类的常规武器，战斗动画显得十分朴实。妹子们各自的能力各不相同，然而在标准难度下，大家都没有那种常见作品中过人一等的战斗力。克敌制胜完全要依靠靠玩家的头脑，纯熟的运用每一位队员的独特能力。

ADV部分：A
如同银河天使队系列，不战斗的时候，玩家可以利用地图在舰内四处移动，找妹子说话，除此之外也可以在实验室进行机体改造升级，或者在舰长室联系商人购买各种武器和升级等。
对话部分是标准的日式ADV系统，比较特别的是玩家用鼠标滚轮回放剧情的时候，甚至可以回到选过的选项来重新选择。标题选项的章节选择选项将允许玩家随时从完成过的章节重新开始。目前游戏没有CG浏览和音乐浏览等选项，不过由于游戏本身是完全开源的，玩家大可以直接打开游戏文件夹随意浏览（虽然我不推荐在通关前这么做）。

剧情：S
本作的情节张弛有度。配合游戏战斗部分本身的难度，战斗中紧张的情节带给玩家的是非同一般的代入感。而战斗结束后的愉悦日常又足够让玩家从结束的战斗中获得放松。
而在愉快的日常逗趣之外，本作的剧情里更多的则是正经的严肃话题，比起现在充斥市场的卖萌作，本作这种正经的战斗冒险故事与严肃话题反而让人眼前一亮。在游戏的故事进行中，将需要玩家多次做出艰难的抉择：是放弃自己的道德准则去换取一些战略优势，还是冒着输掉整场战争的风险来坚守自己的道德制高点？这种对玩家内心的拷问也无疑增加了游戏情节的深度。

画面：B
游戏中的战舰、机体以及场景都是用3D软件渲染的静态图。游戏的角色立绘以及角色CG也许是这游戏唯一的不足，毕竟是由欧美画师绘制的日式风角色，而我们都知道欧美画师在画这类风格的东西时的通常表现如何。然而考虑到这款游戏是完全免费的，所以关于这些瑕疵我们还能说些什么呢？

音乐：S
笔者不是很懂音乐，不知道该怎么形容，不过本作不同于常见的日式GALGAME中轻巧灵动的音乐，典型的欧美风格旋律的确别有一番风味，给笔者带来耳目一新的感觉。
作为一款免费游戏，制作组甚至制作了2首原创日文主题歌，足见其诚意。

总分：90

评论：
本游戏完全免费！很重要所以要说4遍！也许这款游戏比不上市面上的那些大作，但游戏自身的素质已经充分展示了制作组的爱与诚意。对于对这类科幻太空美少女冒险题材感兴趣的玩家来说，本作绝对值得一试。

27746872.review: This is a quality game for the price of free. But it's the art, story, and dialogue that really make this game shine on top of the unique blend of visual novel and tactical RPG backed by an engaging and dynamic soundtrack. Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius is a both an amazing visual novel and a good turn based strategy RPG centered around space battles between mechs.

While being distributed for free on Steam Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius is a game with impressive production value,on the visual novel side of things you'll find gorgeous artstyle,great soundtrack and brilliant writing and the turn based strategy part of the game is engaging enough to stand on it's own merit,lastly the customizable difficulty option will allow you to focus either on the turn based strategy part of the game or on the visual novel one of the game depending on which of the two you prefer.

26253256.review:
[h1] DISCLAIMER [/h1]
 I have played the entire game multiple times. There is a glitch with Steam and it does not record my hours playing the game, but I assure you, I have completed the game multiple times.

[h1] TL;DR [/h1]
This game is pretty good. While the choices don't matter that much until the end and the battles are really slow, everything else about the game is amazing. Please try it out!

Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius is one of the best free-to-play games on Steam. While it has some flaws the game has really good writing that made me wonder what was going to happen next, and the sad parts always brought a tear to my eye. The characters really do feel like characters. Each of them have their unique personality, appearance and funny lines. The story is definently the strongest part of this game.

The game does feature some gameplay though, and a challenging and fun one at that. The gameplay is turn-based with you, controlling multiple ships, ryders and telling them who to attack and where to move. You will be outnumbered sometimes 2-10 which is what makes the game so fun and challenging. You have to carefully plan your attacks so that you will not be punished by the enemy. 

[h1] PROS [/h1]
-Great story
-Great gameplay
-Good writing
-Unique and interesting characters
-Decent replay value
-Long game

[h1] CONS [/h1]
-Battle system is slow 
-Choices don't matter until the end
-Not a lot of Hentai scenes

If you enjoy a challenge and a great story, then this game is definently for you!

26246255.review:
I cannot believe this is a free game.

This is a visual novel/strategy game combined into one.  You go along the story, making choices along the way, and then you have space battles that you need to complete to move on in the story.

If you are looking for a visual novel experience, you can set the difficulty to extremely easy so that all the battles are a joke, so don't let that stop you.  In fact, I had to set the difficulty easier than the 'default' setting myself (while I wouldn't say I'm the best strategy gamer out there, I didn't consider myself a slouch either... until this game.  No shame in lowering the difficulty here!)

With that said, the story was entertaining and interesting!  Definitely enjoyed the visual novel aspect the entire time!  The battles got to be a drag after a while, so eventually I switched the difficulty to make them just get by.  The music is AMAZING.  The length of the game was decently long too!  I definitely would have paid money for this game... if, you know, they didn't offer it for free.

Definitely a must-try!

25985060.review:
TL;NR: годная тактика, апгрейды, меха, анимедевочки, зубодробительная сложность, веселый рандом, децезор, русификатор, халява. Безусловно рекомендую.

В принципе, сия игорь представляет из себя [i]очень[/i] годные пошаговые тактические бои с небольшой примесью визуальной новеллы для подачи сюжета. К слову, очень сложные бои, в которых стиль игры «просто долбить из всех орудий в сторону врага» перестает работать где-то к четвертой миссии. Врага всегда больше, подкрепления приходят к нему с самых неожиданных сторон и он, враг, не стесняется наказывать игрока за любую его ошибку. Впрочем, наш маленький флот тоже не лыком шит, и от уровня к уровню (посредством траты денег на апгейды) огрызается все больнее, становится все живучее и стреляет все чаще (и не столь косо).

Сюжет в игре есть, что хорошо, но особыми изысками он не блещет, что плохо. Хотя справедливости ради отмечу, что парочку [i]неожиданных поворотов[/i] он нам таки приготовил. Модные ныне моральные выборы в рамках «Маски Аркадиуса» оказывают околонулевое влияние на сюжет, но импортируются в [url=store.steampowered.com/app/358750]«День освобождения»[/url], так что кто знает, как именно подпортит вам игру одна неосторожная фраза.

Ну и перед сводкой плюсов и минусов игры пару слов о том, куда же нам предстоит окунуться:
[list]
[*] [b]Что уже есть?[/b] Есть космос, разделенный на сферу влияния демократического Солнечного Альянса, сферу влияния коммунистического ПАКТ и прослойку между ними в виде солянки планет-государств Нейтрального рубежа. Есть большой и злобный ПАКТ, который своими кораблями коммунистических цветов доставляет равенство и наносит братство этому самому Нейтральному рубежу.
[*] [b]Что имеем лично мы?[/b] Мы имеем бравого капитана [strike]Шепарда[/strike] Кайто Шилдса в качестве своего альтер-эго, новый, с иголочки, несущий ударный крейсер Санрайдер и старпома Аву в качестве первого члена капитанского [strike]гарема[/strike] экипажа.
[*] [b]Что мы будем иметь?[/b] Мы будем иметь много проблем, модные моральные выборы, недостаток денег, небольшую эскадрилью райдеров (местное название боевых человекоподобных роботов) и [strike]гарем[/strike] экипаж пилотов этих самых райдеров.
[/list]

Плюсы:
[list] 
[*] Тактические бои, которые не дают заскучать и заставляют напрягать содержимое черепной коробки.
[*] Сложность этих самых тактических боев, из-за которой каждая победа воспринимается не как веха сюжета, а личное достижение.
[*] Замечательная рисовка кораблей и райдеров. К слову, по изображению того или иного вражины можно догадаться, чем именно он собирается ласкать наш любимый Санрайдер.
[*] Безудержно пафосный оркестровый саундтрек. Игра про космос без оркестрового саундтрека — не игра.
[*] Анимедевочки в качестве пилотов машин массовой разрушения и смерти, все как одна со своими заскоками. Ня.
[*] Эти самые машины массового разрушения и смерти.
[/list]

А сейчас настала пора поговорить о минуса, и разговор этот будет с налетом шизофрении:
[list]
[*] Сложность. Игрокам, привыкшим к казуальному геймплею, перед игрой стоит подложить под седалище что-нибудь несгораемое и прикрутить монитор к столу намертво. Игрокам похардкорнее стоит приготовиться к позывам материться во весь голос.
[*] Отдельным минусом стоит записать семимильный провал между стандартной сложностью и пониженной на один пункт. Игра в любом случае будет напоминать избиение младенцев, только в первом случае младенцем будет игрок, а во втором AI.
[*] Честный генератор случайных чисел. Это не сколько минус, сколько особенность геймплея, но 85% шанс попадания в этой игре совсем не означает, что вы попадете. И если в целом ничего плохого в этом нет, то в частности три промаха подряд при 70% попадания вызывают желание что-нибудь разбить.
[*] Анимедевочки и меха. Я искренне не понимаю, зачем анимехейтеры (уж простите за сие слово) играют в визуальную новеллу, но такие есть, так что этот пункт специально для них.
[/list]

Строго рекомендую поиграть всем любителям тактических пошаговых боев.

25956560.review:
Больше всего эта игра напомнила мне серию Sakura wars, если кто помнит такую. Тут примерно тоже самое - между боями базарим с девушками, а между базарами сажаем девушек на мехи и месим толпы врагов. О сюжете говрить много не стоит - он насквозь клиширован и весь состоит из полностью стандартных анимешных поворотов. Как и персонажи - стандартый набор девочек, тут и заучка-старший помощник и застенчиая механик и бравая наемница, которая ругается с правильной девочкой-офицером армии и все такое. Ну и гг - единственный красавец-мужчина на корбале, кторого мы видим в кадре от которого вся эта женская компания без ума. Кстати. В отличии от тех же аниме про школьников, где малохольный очкарик-zадрот пускает слюни на купальники старшекласниц, он все-таки не тупит и ведет себя как норм мужик, адекватны не только реплики, но и выборы в диалогах, что в общем то радует. 
В диалогах нет озвучки, что приятно, потому что я люблю читать, а не слушать. Английский в игре простой, все понятно, читается легко, игра бесплатная, так что каждый может оценить сам. В общем что касается сюжета - все приятно, местами, правда затянуто, но без особых перегибов и фейспалмов. В отличии от того же high school dxd или чего-то в этом роде. Ах да, и почти без панцушотов кстати. Все культурно и прилично. 

Кстати, особенно "радуют" аллюзии на противостояние советского союза и америки. В данном случае северной и южной кореи я думаю. Типа тирания и демократия. Как это сейчас очень модно, ПАКТ изображен как сборище беспринципных yебков, вероломно, без всякого обоснования и смысла, причиняющие вред вселенной, а у доброго альянса в белых мундирах, хоть и все средства хороши, но при этом типа все демократично. В игре присттсвуют лозунги типа долой королей, даешь президентов, мы же за свободу всего чего только можно и все такое. Возможно, к концу все изменится, это все-таки визуальная новелла, но впечатление от пройденной части кампании именно такое. 

О самой игре. Я лично не мастер тактики, но и не новичек, но послушав предупреждения других обзорщиков оставил дефолтный уровень сложности.... В первых миссииях мне чуть не дали pizдюлей, но я их поршел даже без перезагрузок, но дальше больше - уже  к миссии по спасению Асаги игра превратилась в спам сейв-лоад. Выстрелил, помазал, загрузился. Нажал кнопку конец хода, убили кого-то загрузился. Дошел до половины миссии, навалили к врагу 5-7 крузаков подкрепления, начал все сначала. В общем треш. Денег мало, мехов и главшип особо не раскачаешь, враги валят толпами, каждая ошибка или удачное попадание врага приводит к перезагрузке. Вначале были просто мехи и разные боевые корабли, но дальше пошли керриеры - корабли с 1900хп из которых каждый ход спаунятся новые юниты. Но они не были бы проблемой, если бы не сапорты, которых на миссию у врага может быть несколько и они начинают тупо дизэблить игроковую армию через всю карту, что делает борьбу с ними сущим адом. 

Особенно доставляет дисбаланс - в распоряжении игрока всего 1 ремонтный мех, он же  дизэйблит врагов и один снайпер, который может стрелять через всю карту. С варжеской же стороны постоянно выкатывают бесконечные волны врагов так что даже мех с уклонением в 80% ложится за один турн только от того, что они своим количеством пробивают вероятность уклонения. Но самое неприятное  - ракеты. Когда с  дальнего края карты ваваливается несокльо ракеных кораблей и вдалбливают в флагман по залпу на 500-1000хп каждый - хочется посто взять и разбить клавиатуру и монитор .
Также засчет количества дистанция боя врагов гораздо больше чем у игрока. Из 10 мехов 3-4 на 7-8 клеток да попадут. Тогда как огневые ресурсы в ваших руках ограничены флагманом и несколькими мехами, так что на счету каждый выстрел. 
Еще бесит неудачное меню - нажимаем esc там сразу меню сейва, на лоад надо переключить вкладку, постоянно перезагружаясь в горячке боя, легко спутать и запороть сейв, перезаписав его. Еще анимацию попаданий и выстрелов приходится переключать вручную - сидишь и пока враги стреляют спамишь мышкой или пробел. 
Радует одно - игра загружается  и перезагружается моментально, правда после 50го сейвлоада начинает выдавать ошибки. 

В общем попробовать поиграть однозначно стоит, инетресно и читать и сражаться, но лично я, после беспрерывной ировой ночи игры, все-таки решил забить. Начинать на более легкой сложности - не позволяет гордость, а продолжать дальше как есть - нервы дороже.

PRO:

25874408.review:
First of all, I would like to state that I played for Mechs and Visual Novel, not Strategy or Dating Sims.

A praise to the story (Although it didn't end, not even a temporal one). Lots of up and downs, intensity and emotions.
Another big praise to the opening, especially when you play it in the battles when you r turning the odds around.
The arts are amazing. The mechs looks awesome.
Both the story and art brings back the good old memories from Gundam (I'm talking about Amuro era here).

Gameplay is the battles, and it's all strategic (not my type). The battles are really challenging tbh.
The game is not well-optimized, there're times that fps dropped really low, like when it load up animations. But it won't affect the gameplay much. Although it does get kinda annoying when you r in the battles.

There're choices you'll have to make. I'm not sure how much it matters. I'm not even sure if it's for the plot or the dating sims part. But I got to say those choices are hard, it really defines what you are (playing).

I believe this game was suppose to be a dating sims in space hence the in-game title (love in space). So as you can see on the cover that almost all characters are girls (goddess type). 
The characters stories are good, all of them have their special ryders, personalities, back stories, and developments as well. 
The biggest problem I have with this dating sims element is that it felt weird. Basically every characters on the ship are girl except you (there are other crew members ofc, but they never showed their face), it will feel really weird after some point. Almost like everyone is trying to harass you lol.
The game gets you all hype up about 'saving the world', but u sometimes have to deal with those relationship things, which obviously are boring. When you asked for opinion u get love hint instead, and that's just weird, and not quite fit in with the stories. The vacation part was good though.

Why do I still recommend the game? Well it's free. And the arts are worth checking out!
I would've praise the story here again, but they didn't end it, so a warning for u if u hate cliffhanger, or you can buy the sequel.
This game really have a potential to become a great franchise (If they can fix the girls over-crowding issues lol). I believe they have already released 2 more games (which continues where this game left).

6.5/10 time to go watch some Gundam.
It's worth checking out if you are a fan of mechs!

There's uncensored version apparently. You have to download the patch from their website. I just finished the game, so i'm not gonna get it anytime soon, maybe someday.

25852273.review:
Ну и что ждешь? Качай и играй! 

Cиё творение очень и очень добротное. Видно, что авторы проделали огромную работу и к созданию подошли с душой.  Я в визуальные новеллы мало играю, но «Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius» меня затянула, ибо отличается от других представителей данного жанра. В перерывах между повествованием  нам довольно часто приходится возиться с собственным космическим кораблем, развитием райдеров наших подопечных(у каждого из которых есть свой набор вооружения и уловок)  и пошаговыми боями. 

В сюжете нас ждет много увлекательного, интригующего и порой даже забавного. От простых двусмысленностей и неловкостей до сбежавшей принцессы и древних артефактов. Преподносится это все замечательно и читать довольно увлекательно. По насыщенности неожиданными поворотами она даст фору многим другим ВН.

Из минусов можно отметить только один - это баланс на более высоких сложностях игры. От некоторых боев просто хочется разбить клавиатуру. Ну и одно упущение в виде фразы о побочных заданиях, где нам говорится, что выполнить их все мы не успеем и нам придется делать выбор, а в итоге об этом забывают чуть ли не до конца игры. 

И наконец, моё финальное мнение: перед нами отличная космическая опера с японским колоритом, которую стоит опробовать каждому любителю жанра или же визуальных новелл. 

P.S. У игры есть прямое продолжение, которое начинается сразу после концовки MoA - [url=store.steampowered.com/app/358750/] Sunrider: Liberation Day[/url] и определенно заслуживает внимания, ибо визуальную часть сделали лучше, а сюжет продолжает повествование и не уступает первой части.

25803205.review:
FAZIT: Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius ist für Anime Fans ein Muss. Die Story ist interessant und wendungsreich, die Charaktere niedlich und sympatisch und die taktischen Weltraumgefechte sind spielerisch anspruchsvoll!

Auf Steam gibt es viele Virtual Novels und nur wenige zeichnen sich durch eine gute Qualität aus. Manchmal stolpert man über eine unterirdische, visuelle Aufmachung und ein anderes Mal über fehlenden, spielerischen Anreiz. Sunrider ist anders, denn es verbindet das Storytelling einer Virtual Novel, mit den taktischen Weltraumgefechten. Die Geschichte ist dabei außergewöhnlich komplex und auchwendungsreich. Die Welt von Sunrider ist dabei erstaunlich gut ausgearbeitet, auch wenn sie natürlich nichtmit Star Wars oder Mass Effect mithalten kann. Aber diesen Anspruch sollte man an dieser Stelle eh nicht habe. Und trotzdem: mit der Fortsetzung und dem Ableger Sunrider Academy findet man ein insich stimmiges Franchise vor. Die Charactere, Hintergründe und Raumschiffe sind hübsch gezeichnet, leider kommen nur wenige Animationen zum Einsatz. Trotzdem schafft es das Spiel bestimmte Szenen dynamisch zu präsentieren. An vielen Stellen führt man Dialoge oder trifft Entscheidungen, natürlich kommt hier die Romantik nicht zu kurz, allerdings wirkt sie nie unpassend oder deplatziert. Auf Steam sind die erotischen Szenen zensiert, doch man kann über den Hersteller einen "uncensored" Patch herunterladen. Der Schauwert ist natürlich so viel höher ^^ 
Und dann gibt es da noch die Weltraumschlachten und diese sind so viel mehr, als nur schnödes Beiwerk. Selbst auf den niedrigen Schwierigkeitsstufen sind diese taktisch anspruchsvoll und stellenweise wirklich knifflig. Die Lernkurve ist modrat, doch der Schwierigkeitsgrad zieht irgendwann deutlich an. Für all Diejenigen, die sich um die ataktischen Gefechte keinen Kopf machen wollen, gibt es einen entsprechenden Schwierigkeitsgrad (5 an der Zahl), doch hiermit beraubt man sich einem spannenden Aspelt von Sunrider.

25777043.review:
Note: I decided to write this review after Captain mode pissed me off
Sunrider is a visual novel + turn based strategy game seemingly inspired by the Super Robot Wars series.

Main complaint
For the most part, gameplay is fairly strategic and it discourages cheesing the game by farming. However, some weapons often seem redundant and some units unplayable on captain difficulty. This is mostly due to upgrades that matter being astronomically expensive to make viable (energy......) which eventually made a lot of my units underpowered and some weapon types have infinite range, making the uh..... agile melee character useless.

If you want to pick up this game, I recommend swapping between ensign and captain modes cause some stages are just outright unfair with the lack of resources and poorly thought out mechanics. I did enjoy the first few levels because the game focused you on your objective instead of just overpowering your enemies but unfortunately this style of play they were encouraging also punishes you in the long run for not having money for upgrades but instead gives you 'command points' to use the underwhelming abilities of your battleship. 

Overall, the game is decent but poorly thought out.

Nitpicking
I hate the voice acting during battle and it hurts more that I can't skip them. Why? memes and shitty yellow suit person talking.

25399047.review:
(Since I played on Captain difficulty, this review will reflect that.)
That the gameplay is challenging is an understatement, in that it's heavily reliant on RNG.  I was intrigued by the strategy element in that this will test your skills, and you can be punished badly for simple mistakes.  However, that's a lie in that you could still be punished even without making mistakes.  Through the escort mission, getting the Sunrider to the edge of the map, and the Battle of Ongess, I have learned there is only one real strategy of this game.  That is to destroy as many high priority targets as quickly as possible.  In the later levels, the game gets relentless in nitpicking detail, and even then that's not enough, as luck is a huge factor.  So many times I had my lower armored riders taken out by a rocket more times than I can count.  No matter how much cover I provided, it still got through.  It really becomes apparent later that room for error is not allowed in a system where there's plenty of chances for error to happen.  If your hit is not 100%, really everything but lasers which become useless once the enemy is stacking shields, it can and on occasion miss.  I've had hits that were 70% and 80% miss on occasion.  Despite later offering the choice of where to place your units, it's something that can derail you more than it can help you, because the more you progress, the more the game punishes you for not playing a certain way.

Often times, I had to replay a level more than once, because of things I couldn't possibly know the first time.  On the escort mission for example, I thought I could just destroy all the enemies present, while gradually moving forward.  Unfortunately, this game loves to spawn new enemies.  In fact expect a legion of them to appear to tell you that there's a turn limit on this level.  Also, don't expect to move the escort ship in any direction other than a straight line, or else you won't make it.  The window of opportunity is that slim, while add protecting it from the enemies already there.   You can't one-shot anything (except Sola's rifle but only on grunt units) and your movement and attacks have to balance out, because they both use energy points.  The only difficulty in this game is that the AI will continue to churn new enemies at you.   This gets draining and frustrating, because certain units such as battleships will come fully stocked with rockets and missiles, a limited resource you have, that the AI will continuously spam you with.  Also, your defenses decrease after each hit, making things difficult the longer the level goes on.  However, this game is impossible to get through without a Kinetic focused build, adding more accuracy while decreasing the cost and increasing energy points to fire it more than once in a turn.  In the late game, enemies practically spawn every turn and if you focused defensively, your going to have a rough time.  Flak is unreliable as it's a coin toss most of the time.  Evasion is just as unreliable as Icari has the most evasion, but she gets hit often, and being the fragile speedster, every hit usually is deadly.  Defense can be whittled down easily as you get very outnumbered later on.  On top of that, rockets and missles are spammed at you.  I focused on these things and I'm stuck at the Battle of Ongess.  I fear that I have to start the game from scratch in order to put in the right customizations, which I am not motivated to do.  

My biggest issue is that this issue could have been easily avoided, if the cast of characters and by extension your units weren't limited to 7.  The opening would have you believe Cosette the pirate will eventually join you, but she never does.  I believe Love in Space wanted to have it's cake and eat it too.  Some would praise that the game underneath what appeared to be a cliche harem has a deep and serious plot, but it goes both ways.  I see a game with a deep and serious story and strategic gameplay bogged down by it's main focus being on a harem of girls.  What makes the gameplay so difficult is that the enemy has a bunch of resources against your single ship that only has a few Ryders.  That fits the setting, but still, the question becomes why out of all the space exploration, you never meet a plot relevant character that commands another ship and joins your party.  The alliance sends one girl to be apart of your crew, but she doesn't run a ship; she just pilots another Ryder.  There are in-universe reasons to why as she's meant to spy on you, but why does it have to be this way.  Aren't there other people who got away from PACT like the player and have to make ends meet as a mercenary?  Aren't there rebellions in the works?  We couldn't have come across other people who shared our plight?  The Neutral Rim is made up of many worlds.  Instead, the plot wants to mainly focus on the girls and in the end, they are all you have going into battle against multiple more enemies, and limited funds to make them a match for such odds.  You only have one ship and six ryders against Crusiers, Frigaters, Ryders (general, bombers and support), Battleships and Carriers (that can spawn infinite amount of Ryders if nothing is done).  There's a difference between challenging and unbalanced.  Later on, you could buy a Union Frigate or Alliance Cruiser, but why would I want to use already limited funds on a generic unit.  You have very little chances to farm.  Outside main missions, you have 6 side missions; 2 you have to choose between and one is impossible.

The story and characters aren't bad, but as with the gameplay, you're given the illusion of choice with your decisions impacting very little to the main narrative (you can choose to let a bunch of kids die, but still it holds very little impact to the main story), and no matter who you choose to bond with, one girl in particular will have more screentime than others, as she has more plot-related scenes.

The art was tolerable.  It's not anything to write home about, but from an indie game, it's sufficient.  I liked the clever use of the portraits though.  The music in contrast was excellent.  The instrumentals in particular set the mood and atmosphere really well, for each scene they were used for.  The particulars that stood out for me were the piece that plays after the escort mission with Icari officially joining you, and the music during the Battle at Far Post.

Overall, the game was a mixed bag.  I'd only recommend it to casual players to play on lower difficulty just to experience the story.  The recommended difficulty has become too much a hassle to call the experience enjoyable.  The game requires a certain way to play, yet your given this freedom and belief you can play any way you want, only to be disappointed later.  There is only one real strategy and that is take out as many units as you can in a turn.  Don't bother with complex tactics because the battle system is not complicated and relies mostly on force.  If you focus on defense like I did and don't upgrade your kinetics, you're brick-walled near the end.

24986750.review:
A mix of visual novel and turn based strategy that surprised me by being both free and having a quality beyond my low expectations.

The visual novel portion is unexceptional.  It is a functional space opera story with the quality of a popcorn reading.  There is an absence of characters.  The characters you have all follow common archetypes and tropes in anime and are predominately female.  There is no support cast and the development of all the existing characters fall into predictability, due to their tired and reused personalities from other fiction, save for one reveal at the end of the game which was a surprise because I was too dense to follow the foreshadowing.  However, this is a waifu harem vn and decent storytelling is something optional in the genre.

As for the turn based strategy side, there is more to like here.  The fights are long and do get dull over time, but there is enough involved for them to stay interesting.  The difficulty stays on the hard side but there are enough selectors on the slider where you tank the difficulty if things get too hard.  The only real problem I had with the fights was the lack of alternative options during a turn.  A unit should be getting close and shooting kinetics, there are few other choices where their turns and actions can be gainfully used.  Everyone should be in a formation for overlapping shields and flak, but there is no option for split maneuvering.  So, the fights seem like side versus side slug out matches.  Otherwise, I have no real complaint about the strategy.

During down time you get money and spend it on upgrades for your mecha and ships.  The builds make you as involved in the development of your team as in XCom.  This comes with a however, and that however is the power Kinetics, shields, and flak give you for little investment make for single minded builds.  Of course, I may have just found out how to break the system a little early.

This is hardly a perfect game, but the cost of free makes up for any problems I may found and I have no problem telling anyone else they should play it.

24594877.review:
[h1] << Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius - "Капитан, позаботьтесь о нас" >> [/h1]

Первая по выпуску часть игры, повествующая о войне и романтике в космосе. Действия происходят спустя 11 лет (если брать в счёт спин-офф) после окончания академии. Если вы как и я, сначала прочитали spin-off к основновному сюжету, а только потом эту часть, то вас ждёт много отсылок (хотя, если вы сделали наоборот, то вас также ждёт много отсылок). Сам же сюжет Mask of Arcadius завязан на войне за нейтральный рубеж между ПАКТ и Альянсом. Главный герой, благодаря помощи Альянса, борется за освобождение находящейся в нейтральном рубеже планеты Серра, захваченой ПАКТ, попутно собирая команду из райдеров. 

[h1] Далее в деталях: [/h1]

В игре присутствует пошаговый бой, что лично мне было в радость, но к сожалению баланс боевых схваток показался мне "хромающим", ибо уже на 3-ей (из 6-ти существующих) сложности становится практически невозможно играть. Поэтому, если вы всё-таки хотите не только узнать сюжет, но принять участие в более-менее равном бою и при этом не страдать - советую поставить 2-ую сложность.

В отличии от других частей визуальная состовляющая была чуть хуже, но это не так критично (всё-таки Mask of Arcadius вышла в 2014, да ещё и на бесплатной основе).

Музыкальное сопровождение радовало на протяжении всей игры (особенно во время боёв и придавало им динамичности), так что получилось славным.

Сколько же времени займёт игра, пожалуй будет зависеть от сложности которую вы выберете.

Что немаловажно, игре понадобится скачать русификатор, но думаю вам не составит труда найти его в тех же руководствах.

[h1] Итог: [/h1]

В итоге Mask of Arcadius получилась неплохой игрой в плане сюжета, но к сожалению, не графония (лично я не гонюсь за графикой, засим мне почти что всё равно). Также, ещё раз подчеркну, что игра является бесплатной. Так что, однозначная рекомендация к сие творению.
P.S. Да, обзор был переписан из-за некорректного описания. Нельзя же так оставлять, тем более, что это одна из моих любимых новелл :)

24465696.review:
[h1]<<И вот я сыграл в еще одну новеллу. И вот я опять страдаю таким чувством, как датфил.>> с) Снайкер, юнный ценитель видеоигр.[/h1]

 Что же сказать по поводу этой игры? Она - удивительна. Сейчас объясню, почему так.
Самое главное, что меня удивило при прохождении данной новеллы - это жанр - стратегия. Сказать, что я был немало удивлен - ничего не сказать. Я никогда не думал, что два таких разных жанра могут сочетаться, да еще и в таком сеттинге. А нет, возможно. Режим стратегии тут в меру сложный. Если вы "мастак" в этом жанре, то Вы получите не мало удовольствия от прохождения данного режима игры. 
 Что же касается самого сюжета, то он - очень интересный и захватывающий. Очень хорошо были раскрыты персонажи (ну, для двух эпизодов, конечно), интригующая история, которая полна неожиданных поворотов (для еще более неожиданных поворотов советую пройти Sunrider Liberation Day) и философских посылов (например о значении людей в мире, о наших ошибках, о политике, об истории и многом другом).. С помощью этой новеллы, я смог отточить свои знания в политике и начал лучше понимать природу человека. 
Музыкальная состовляющая в данной новелле - божественна. Вы найдете песни и мелодии на любой вкус и цвет. 
Визуальная часть так же пестрит красками, открывая нам более подробную картину происходящего. Не могу поверить, что художники работали за бесплатно (за бесплатно же?).
 Про персонажей говорить не буду, так как могу заспойлерить их ненароком. Скажу одно: они очень хорошо раскрыты и их действия вполне логичны.


[h1]В общем, эту новеллу однозначно советую проходить всем, без исключения! Всем удачи! Общая оценка 9.2/10.[/h1]

[i] P.S. Так же, можете покупать и вторую часть сей новеллы (Sunrider Liberation Day). Там будет столько неожиданных поворотов и захватывающих повествований, что Ваш мозг будет переодически отключаться от нескончаемого потока информации, которая перевернет ваше восприятие мира к черту :D Но жесткий дисбаланс в предпоследнем бою - это не есть хорошо, поэтому жмите shift+p (перед этим включив английскую раскладку).[/i]

24457118.review:
18+ For having a not safe for work and a not safe for mind scenes...
2 installments out of 3 is free. To be honest, I expected much less from this game.
Manage your very limited fund and get through those crazy messes.

My rating: for now, roughly 7/10 - Liked it

[b]Reasons of playing:[/b]
-    Suddenly there's this interesting-looking game with anime chicks harem and cool mechs in a strategy hex ground. I was surprised this is free, so I tried it with curiosity.

[b]My experience:[/b]
-    Completed Mask of Arcadius in Captain difficulty (the way Sunrider is meant to be played). Intending to wait until I can afford Liberation Days, but no intention of increase/decrease in difficulty in the first run. Wishall still in hand and intact. The story ended with a cliffhanger.
-    Making mistake upgrading in this game is lethal. Having insufficien information about what you and your enemies could do is also lethal. Fighting with insufficient strategy... is also lethal. I had to prepare many things for each battles. This game really knows how to make victory a big triumph. Some missions are harder than others; [spoiler]Escort mission[b]s[/b] and wedding crash seems to be the hardest for me[/spoiler].
-    I have to admit... hard missions are just so hard to me, so I have to use a "Save/Load Abuse"

[b]What I like:[/b]
-    This game really is a strategy game, no money grinding, no AI weakness exploiting, no absolute walkthrough (I guess?), though the RNG occasionally hurts me for a spice.
-    While the game is a bit if not very stingy with money, Command point is fairly easy to gain. I have finished the game with over 30k of CPs, even using it a lot every stages.
-    Nice graphics and animations. Mechs and ships are cool.
-    While I still prefer Japanese Voice acting due to being more used to it, I find English Voice acting for this game really good and fit the characters well.
-    Story can be immersed in. Many parts are predictable, but still well-written.
-    World-politics references.

[b]What I don't like:[/b]
-    Selling ship/mechs upgrade worth only 80%. This hurt me a lot when I realized I had been allocating funds poorly right before certain missions.
-    The battle interface sometimes bothers me. I cannot explain very well, but it feels ... laggy? For example, clicking a weapon could end up selecting a weapon my mouse cursor passed prior.
-    No Japanese Voice for selection. I understand the reason, though. I let this pass.

[b]Something else to say:[/b]
- The above review disregard all and any 18+ elements of this game.
- In the end, I still can't believe that this one's free.

24210632.review:
You know, I never thought I'd leave a negative review of a free product, but this game has earned that honor. It's a shame too, because it starts off really well. The plot is decent, the characters are entertaining, they interact with each other, the soundtrack is good and even the first few battles were fun. But then, this game slowly starting to reveal its true nature.

If you download this game I'd highly reccomend playing it in visual novel mode, because the battle system in this game is absolutely atrocious. You see, rather than give you a wide arrange of enemies, fleets and special units to fight, Sunrider instead tries to challenge you by simply piling on the same four enemies a dozen at a time. Just watching their attack animations takes about two minutes. And though they're easy kills most of the time, as soon as you kill one, another four spawn in behind them without any warning.

My breaking point came at an extremely crappy escort mission, where you get a civilian vessel that you're supposed to pilot from the left side of the screen to the right, where the entire enemy fleet is. During my first attempt I decided to take it nice and easy by staying back and shooting down the enemies heavy hitters. It worked pretty well at first, until another three fleets spawned in, one after another. Despite that, I still didn't die, it just got so tedious to watch them go throught their identical attack animations that I decided to try again.

During my second attempt I tried to simply fly my transport around the enemy fleet with one of my units as an escort. That also worked pretty well, I even got within one space of the goal... Until another enemy fleet spawned in directly in front of my transport and took it down in one turn. After that, I quickly realized that this game relies heavily on 'quantity over quality', it doesn't matter how tough your opponent's are, when you're up against a dozen of them they're bound to inflict some damage eventually.

Like I said, if you're only interested in the visual novel and not the gameplay, I'm sure you'll have fun. Just make sure you set the difficulty on low.

24206953.review: I'm usually not fan of Indie games. But I regret not one bit trying this one. I was like "Oh well, it has starships and it is anime like. I will give it a shot". The game is worth the time. It get me hooked up right away. The combat is very good and some missions are quite difficult. The story is decent. Also it is remarkably long for a F2P game. I played for a few hours get hooked up and went and bought the second game in the series (although being on Steam sale may have influenced my decision on that part). In any case - try it. I'm pretty sure you won't regret it

24135712.review:
This is a visual novel and tactical turn-based strategy game. I had originally hoped that it would focus more on the strategy game but as I played it, I realized that the battles were kind of a waste. They seemed only to artificially increase the playtime. In that same vein, they feel necessary due to the way that the story is written. It opens like a Star Wars movie. 

The galaxy is on the brink of war. The Neutral Rim is slowly being taken over by the evil Empire PACT. The Solar Alliance wishes to remain neutral, but that can only be maintained for so long. War will break out, and planets will be massacred... (dun dun dun)

You play Kayto Shields which might be the dumbest name I've ever seen in a visual novel. Though another character is named Kryska Stares so... it's a close battle. You were given the command of a ship called the Sunrider (roll credits). On the day of her field test, you are attacked and your field test has to be cut short as you run away from superior firepower. But before you go, you get to see Alderaan Cera blown up by their Death Star Legion's powerful laser. After that, you can choose to fly the flag of your old military OR become a pirate. If you choose anything other than become a pirate, you probably hate fun. The rest of the game we follow Captain Shields and his quest to take revenge for his planet. 

There's also an ancient civilization that used to rule the galaxy. Everyone knows about them because they still exist today in a drastically weakened state. But the game makes this mistake and I hate when this mistake is made because I can very rarely find a good way to justify it. The mistake is in ancient civilizations having more powerful technology than ours today. Let me be clear, this is not inherently bad. There are people living on Indonesian islands today, which, should they ever join the civilized world and look through history, they'll see that the United States completed an atomic bomb capable of leveling cities in 1945. The current year is 2016. Why is 2016 technology less advanced than 1945 technology? The key difference is the location. We're comparing the technology of two different civilizations. Sunrider doesn't do that. What you have is a civilization that used to rule the galaxy, they had an internal conflict, that got resolved somehow, and in that resolution all of this super fancy technology got lost. It just boggles my mind because I can't come up with too much in the way of plausible justifications. And like in Valkyria Chronicle, I wonder to myself if it would not be more interesting to play in that war, rather than the one today. But who am I kidding, you and I both know that it's just sequel bait. We'll get that ancient technology in the next game (probably).

Also, terrible villains. Colonel Pork Chop was tasked with capturing the a high value target that happens to be on your ship. Pork Chop gets an entire fleet to surround you, there's no way out. There's a bounty on your head, so they tell their men to fire on you. When Pork Chop realizes that the target is on your ship, they tell their men to stop firing. Pork Chop's men secure the target, bringing the target over to their ships, then VACATES THE AREA. WHY DID PORK CHOPS NOT BLOW YOU UP NOW THAT THE TARGET WAS NO LONGER ON YOUR SHIP? Christ, sometimes I wish that I could be the villain. We would get so much villain stuff done because I don't make these retarded mistakes. By leaving you alive, Pork Chops practically assures a rescue mission attempt. Terrible villains. 

I called it a visual novel because it plays out like one, and because I'm pretty sure that was the intent. The very first words you are greeted with as you turn on the game are 'Love in Space'. Which sounds totally dumb yet endearing at the same time. However do not be fooled into thinking you get to pick your waifu. There are no waifus. The game does the thing where you dance around whether or not you'll get a waifu like it's going for the harem ending. Harem endings are very rarely done right because it's really difficult to make everyone happy, both in game and out of it. So I distinctly hope that there is a canon ending, and it's not terribly difficult to guess where it's going but I don't know for sure.

I'm not entirely sure your decisions change much of anything in the battles. I ran decisions back a few times and the only thing that seems to change is the text, not the result. For instance, when I was given a soldier from the Alliance, they were doing sketchy business on my ship. So I chose "Send them to the brig". But battle broke out right after that decision. I reloaded my save, went back, chose "Trust them" or something and the battle still broke out! And I was able to use the soldier in both battles. 

Can we talk about battles now? Let's talk about battles now. Normally I take pride in being moderately competent in games. I always run on the default difficulty or one above the default difficulty because the chances of me playing a game twice are very slim. But this game made me turn down the difficulty. Holy smokes Batman, the battles are just way to hard! Maybe it's because the battles aren't well-tutorialized or something. You're told that energy weapons are less effective against shields and kinetic weapons go straight through them. Simple enough. Energy weapons have longer range. I don't see why they should if we're in space, but go on. Kinetic weapons have horrible accuracy but higher damage. Okay. So that means I should use energy weapons until I close the gap and switch the kinetic weapons? Seems simple enough. ONLY THE GAME SPAM SPAWNS ENEMIES WITH SHIELDS AND THE SHIELDS STACK SO YOU DO NO DAMAGE. 
Due to the shield stacking mechanic, it seems that the game wants to push you to keep your units close together. I've played a lot of Super Robot Wars, so I'm not used to that. I'm used to units that can go out and destroy everything and dodge everything (using proper pilot skills). So this was definitely a jarring change which may explain why I did so poorly. You do have a unit that can shut down shields and I eventually upgraded it to be able to shut down two shields per turn, but that only helps so much when you're running against stacking three shields or more on top of each other. And then it becomes a real PITA when the enemies get units that can shut down YOUR shields and YOUR energy generation. 

It feels like you're punished way too harshly if you don't know the proper way to upgrade your units from the get-go. Once I got a handle on things the normal difficulty was still too hard for me but I managed to bump it up a bit. The combat energy consumption and movements only makes sense for a hexagon map though. So good on the developers for a job well-done there. 

My biggest complaint about the game isn't the combat so much as it is the animations. They feel really clunky in transitioning from map to battle animation and back to map. Every now and again the game would also register my click on something that I did not click resulting in me using attacks that I did not mean to use. I tested this out and it seems like clicking near the borders of the hexagons does this which I guess is due to rectangular bounds for click regions. 

Overall, the game was free so I can't say that it wasn't worth the money, only the time. And I feel bad because I really got involved with the story towards the end (even though I predicted the ending in some manner or another). The game comes with two routes 'First Contact' and 'Mask of Arcadius' but Mark of Arcadius seems to be the second half of the game. I didn't play any battles but I had read all of the text before and the battle was that which I remember doing. After a few battles I stopped because I didn't want to play the game twice. I don't know if the rest of the battles are the same, and I'm not going to check. My guess is that if you select 'First Contact' you play through both scenarios, not just one.

	and

First, I will say that I don't usually do reviews. But I just had to do so on this one.

It's free. You have no risk excepting the download time and the space on your computer that you can clean it out of. If you're on the fence... really? Come on. Now let's get into this.

The art is good ol' anime plain and simple. They don't try to get too fancy, but it looks great.

The story is decent. It's not bad by any means, but there are a couple of cliche' characters. However, those few are balanced out by several other characters that are quite complex. Besides, there's a reasong that cliches are cliches. It does touch on morality and moral decisions, but you can't change anything. Overall, the story was something that would make a good anime show. (If done correctly.)

The combat and gameplay is addictive. It's actually pretty straightforward in my opinion. Someone said that it was too hard. This must be because they played it on a harder level. I played it through on Casual and only had to go back a couple of time. Those were mostly due to my stupid mistakes. There are a couple of times where it gets annoying, but all-in-all, it works.

Now for one more thing about the game. The music. IT... WAS.... EPIC!!!!! If you couldn't tell, I loved the music. I wish Steam would make it where we could download it. (Maybe it is, I just am stupid and can't find it?) The music would be in my player in a flash and played constantly. In my opinion, it made the game. Even if the rest of the game was absolutely terrible, the music would have made it worth it. (Just my opinion though.)

One thing I did find weird about it is the save screen. I accidentally overwrote several saves becuase the overwrite function is the go to while you have to click a different button to load the save. But that was lack of paying attention, not necessarily the games fault.

I really enjoyed it. Try it, you might accidentally love it too.

23597611.review:
[i]ME[/i] with waifus, [i]Valkyria[/i] with choices, [i]Baldr Sky[/i] in space, or whatever it reminds you of, it surely drastically surpasses any expectation for a free game, at least for the story. The music is actually amazing, and the OP (both MoA and LD) reminds me of that of [i]Muv Luv Alternative[/i]. If you take Academy/MoA/LD as trilogy, it also shows some correspondence to extra/unlimted/alternative. And as [i]White Album2[/i] and [i]Muv Luv[/i] teach us, trilogy excels at building [strike] waifu [/strike] characters.

The battle is conplained a lot. Well, this is a general problem for SLG with probabilistic combat. Save scum may be the best strategy to deal with the poor accuracy of many weapons, considering the cost of upgrading to high marks. It may also save your ryder or even the whole fleet from being wiped out in a single turn. But a proper use of order or torpedo, and a wise assignment of research resources may make the battle much easier.

As expected for the simple system, most choices simply have no obvious effect on later game experience. But "relationship" with waifus in MoA do affect some trivial upgrades in Liberation Day, but that's another story.

In short, I strongly recommend this for those who like visual novels. As for space SLG fans, you can have a try, but do not expect a 3A strategic combat experience.

23591266.review:
This is going to be a bit difficult for me since this is a free game and I'd really love to recommend it but I can not in good conscience do so since it would only be for half of its content: The Visual Novel.

While the VN part isnt anything special compared to some others out there, it keeps you entertained and engaged, while offering different choices to make.
As personal preference I decided to disable the English voice acting since I just couldnt stand it.

The reason this fails is the combat and I'd strongly recommend you to stay away from it and its "Difficulty Choices".
I'll go into detail why this is a horrendous battle system design.

Upgrading: Without even understanding how it works and whats useful to get, you might find yourself restarting or reloading a lot. While you can spend some time in the Skirmish section testing combat scenarios and upgrade for free, it will only be a complete waste of your time since the real problems lie further down the road.

The Enemy: Most of the time you'll find yourself vastly outnumbered and them randomly spawning in more enemies during the battle isnt gonna make it better. Dont worry though, they'll have ships spawning more enemies for you later, in case you still didnt feel like jumping out into Space from the air lock.

Taking Turns: First turns are the most crucial of all. You'll want to get rid of some problematic fellows or position yourself in a better way. Once the enemies turn comes up you'll find out that they dont care that missiles and rockets cost money to restock. They'll send them straight to you all across the map, possibly dealing a lot of damage. Dodging and intercepting them? Get lucky.

Buffing, De-buffing, Repairing and Restoring: Absolutely essential and yet it will become impossible and redundant as soon as the enemy deploys its own special units. The enemy overwrites your buffs with de-buffs, you restore de-buffs and the enemy de-buffs you instantly again in their next turn or them lowering your energy so you cant even do anything supportive is only outdone by them outnumbering you.

Randomness: I feel the whole percentage hit chance system is nothing but a lucky draw of the straw. Same goes for the enemies turn. While reloading the same scenario multiple times I had varying outcomes from: total annihilation to passable. 
Since you are already outclassed on so many fronts I dont need Lady Luck to bring more chaos to the battlefield as well.

If you like being outnumbered and subjected to an unfair situation for that special maddening experience that will bring you to your knees, asking if there is a god in this universe and all hope is lost, you found your match right here.

23512396.review:
Full of heart and obviously a labor of love for the developers, Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius will blow you away if you keep in mind the scope of the project. Don't expect AAA levels of optimization, detail, or effects, but what is present is highly polished. The soundtrack is refreshingly quite good, and the visuals manage to do quite well given that the game is built on Ren'Py. The combat system is enjoyable and quite challenging but can be modified with a difficulty slider if you're just wanting to blaze through the story or if you want an additional challenge (and are a masochist) to top off the package.

A hybrid of VN/TBS, anyone who has played games such as Utawarerumono, Tears to Tiara or any of the Sakura Taisen games will recognize the layout quickly. The majority of the game is an ADV style visual novel, with text and sprites on a background to present the events occurring in the game universe with frequent and sometimes quite nuanced decisions presented to the player. Occasionally, the game will drop out to a tactical, turn based grid strategy game reminiscent of Final Fantasy Tactics or any of its many spinoffs in which the titular Sunrider and its complement of giant mecha (all female pilots of course) battle their way through various hazards while attempting to halt the expansion of a despotic interstellar regime.

The characters contain common tropes and the story is based on a pretty common idea, but the devs have managed to make the characters sympathetic and the story deeper than you might think at first glance. Each of the characters have tropes and cliches making up their general personalities, However, that's not all there is to them. They each have life and depth, which, in my opinion, makes it worth fighting through even the toughest battle, just to see what happens with each of them next. 

And believe me, the battles will be tough. Love in Space designed Sunrider to be a very difficult game, in which you always feel as if you're just about to be overwhelmed. There's this one mission where you basically need to escort two diplomats and escape from the map. That mission is so infamous that the dev added some lines to a later optional escort mission where the crew talks about how much they hate that type of mission. I'd say that mission is worse than any other in the game, I had to turn the difficulty all the way down to Visual Novel so that the enemy won't attack as much. The biggest issue is that you have so few options. You only have the Sunrider (main ship), one of the two support ryders and one of the four combat ryders. In later missions you can get enough shields to largely ignore lasers when in a tight formation. You get lots of flaks to shoot down missile attack. And you get enough firepower to take out many threats before they get too close or lanch all their warheads.

Still, there are different difficulty levels, if it's too much for you. I don't mind admiting that I switch to Easy on occasion, myself. However, if you're one of those people that finds "nearly being overwhelmed constantly" too easy, there's always the Hard difficulty, which is sure to blow you out of the proverbial water. There's also Visual Novel difficulty like I mentioned above, which is good for testing out strategies, or just speeding through the game, if you simply can't wait to get back to the story.

If you're not sure about Visual Novels, Strategy RPGs, or both, I'd like to remind you that the game is free, and not going anywhere. You can try it out at any time, for no cost, so just think it over for a while. If you ever get bored and have nothing better to do, Sunrider might be the right thing to pass the time. And who knows; you might just end up liking it and by the end, you'll be shocked at where the story goes.

tl:dr It's free, it's surprisingly good. Get it.

23500497.review:
Dieses Spiel ist ein echter Knaller!

An sich ist es eine space-opera mit rundenbasierten Kämpfen mit Weltraum Mechas. Zwischen den Missionen unterhält man sich mit den Crewmitgliedern (alle weiblich) und treibt so die Story vorran. Die Charakterzeichnungen sind zwar nicht AAA Qualität, reichen aber sehr an diese Qualität heran. Das Spiel benutzt zwar minimalistische Grafikelemente, diese sind aber gut eingesetzt und wissen die Atmospähre zu unterstützen, auf Ebene einer VN eben.
Die Dialoge sind mal witzig, mal feinfühliger und für eine VN manchmal eben ein bischen kitschig.

Zwischen den Kämpfen kann man seine Einheiten alle upgraden und so ihre Werte verbessern. Jedoch liegt immer eine Ressourcen Knappheit vor und man muss sich entscheiden wann man was upgraded.

Die Kämpfe an sich sind mal leichter, mal bocke schwer, also ein richtiges Fest für Strategen. Zum Glück kann man den Schwierigkeitsgrad jederzeit ändern.

Alle Einheiten haben mehrere Waffensysteme (Kinetic, Laser, Raketen, Flakfeuer), die alle eine unterschiedliche Aufgabe haben. Flakfeuer sind für kleine schnelle Einheiten die keine Schilde haben, Laser sind für weit entfernte Ziele, Raketen für große Ziele etc. Oft muss man schauen welche Abwehrsysteme die Ziele haben, Schilde reduzieren den Schaden gegen Laser, Flaktürme halten Raketen auf, Panzerung reduziert den Kinetic Schaden. Ein sehr gutes System, was nur wenig Einarbeitungszeit braucht.

Das einzige was ich ankreide ist das recht unzulängliche Tutorial.
Zum anderen können die Animationen in diesem Teil nicht überspringen und man ist gezwungen sie sich anzuschauen, was das Spiel etwas in die Länge zieht. Dies ist im Nachfolger besser geregelt.

Die Geschichte ist der Knaller, aber man muss eine Vorliebe für Zeitreise Geschichten haben.

Dies ist nur der 1. Teil der Spielreihe. Der 2. Teil führt die Geschichte weiter. Da der 1. Teil aber umsonst ist, kann man ohne Probleme mal reinschnuppern und schauen ob es einem gefällt.

23311685.review:
Sunrider wears it’s inspirations on it’s sleeve – a pinch of Macross, a touch of Gundam and a whole bucket full of Nadesico. Honestly, it’s a great (and ambitious) idea – an overblown space opera visual novel layered over a turn-based starship and mecha strategy game. The game makes it’s goals clear very early on – we have an evil empire, a continent levelling super laser and a bevy of cute, bubblegum haired female pilots, colour coded for your convenience. There’s the Childhood Friend! The borderline retarded Genki girl! The shy one that looks about 12! The mandatory Lil Miss Tsundere! All of your favourite, tired archetypes are wheeled out for another implausible harem scenario - in Spaaaaaace!

The game gets away with it. The story is good, honest good vs evil space opera fluff with some nice art and two-dimensional, but ultimately likeable characters – some clunky writing is easily forgiven due to the obvious passion the developers have for both their own setting and the inspirations it liberally borrows from, as well as some surprisingly high production values. The strategy sections are also solidly designed, if underbaked – Sunrider uses an action point, hex based system, with an excellent selection of mecha (called Ryders here), each with their own weapons and abilities. Lasers are accurate but easily mitigated by shields. Batteries are short range but brutal. Missiles are accurate, powerful but limited in number. The lack of terrain, facings or arcs makes it a bit lightweight in terms of actual decision making, but there’s a decent system here and the lack of complexity works towards it being more accessible.

And that would be fine if it wasn’t for one thing – the game is blisteringly, ball bustingly hard on the default difficulty, and is no slouch even on babby mode. Enemies are numerous, accurate and tough, and sunrider loves throwing in more waves after you’ve barely scraped through the last, and some of the enemies are just ragequit incarnate. Special mention goes to the infinite ryder spawning carriers with a million HP, usually in multiples, and the enemy support ryders. These are usually found at the back of the map shutting down your shields and weapons, and the sheer volume of them can cripple you long before you have any chance to actually engage them. Did I mention that the carriers spawn the support ryders? Fuck off. Oh, and you know how missiles are balanced by their scarcity? Enemies don’t have to deal with that shit. They can blow you away from the other side of the map all day long.

This all adds up to save scumming or dying. There’s no rolling with the punches here – a single turn of typically accurate enemy fire can wipe your whole force off the board, even with multiple overlapping shields and flak batteries. The emptiness of the maps and lack of any way to get a positional advantage (such as flanking) remove any kind of strategy that isn’t turtling while slowly moving into range and hoping your opponent misses with their endless barrages of missiles. Anyone who leaves the shield bubble is mercilessly pounded into space dust. The escort missions encapsulate everything frustrating and anti-fun about these types of missions, and are so utterly unfair that I can’t believe an actual human designed them.

Sadly, there’s an excellent (and expansive) upgrade system for your ships and mecha, but the game is incredibly stingy with cash – it feels like there should be several side missions to help build up cash to help deal with the rocketing difficulty level that were never added. There are trap options here, and since you have absolutely no leeway for experimentation you had best pick the right upgrades in the right order or you can easily find yourself in an unwinnable situation.

It breaks my heart, but unless you are a VERY serious tactical battle fan the game is often simply too hard to be fun. This grinds against the space opera visual novel stuff, which seems designed to appeal to more casual, story focussed gamers. Somewhere in here there’s a beautiful game – and considering it’s entirely free you really have no excuse not to at least give it a try - but dubious design choices mean I can’t honestly recommend it to anyone but the most hardcore.

23283110.review:
Appart for the (relatively) interesting visual novel part - and of course, all the not-so-quite-well-drawed ladies - sunrider is surprisingly a very decent strategy game. But be aware, in what the game considers to be "the difficulty it was meant to be", the game is VERY hard, and quite unforgiving. Lot of RNG, ennemies always outnumbering you at the very least three to one, constant reinforcements and no possibility of grinding whatsoever will garantee you yelling at your computer more than once - and as soon as the early missions. But then of course, you can lower the difficulty - a shame, true, but honnestly the people who managed to finish the game on the normal difficulty at their first run have all my respect.

Now, for some infos:
- If you're in for the ladies, know that the game is censored. that sort of things can be solved quite easily, just check the forums.
- If you're getting mad at the cinematics appearing each time a single unit fires (and you will be), use the tab key to switch to speed mode.
- If I had to pay for the game, I'd say it's worth ten bucks. But now for the excellent news: it's free, totally free, with no in-game transaction or any of that crap whatsoever.

22755031.review:
Quick Rundown:

Pros
+Actually tries to get you invested in characters before bad things happen
+Strategy in offense matters
+Plenty of options for scaling difficulty
+Action point system allows for several actions in a turn
+Aweome Mechs

Cons
-Not enough chances to get upgrade resources with permanent penalties to said resources for exchanging upgrades
-Combat system tends to require clumping
-Has a bad habit of thinking players have a greater mastery of the system than they probably will
-Technical issues so save, save, save.

I had fun wth it, with the strategy elements being more in depth than expected and a more interesting story than I tend to see, but don't be suprised if you have to load a lot of saves (and not just because you just had several rockets shoved up your exhaust port).

It's not a bad game, it's just not a good game. The fights are okay, though a little unfair at times (had a units get wiped out in opening volleys a few times).

Storywise, there were tidbits of backstorys that were interesting, but the characters felt rather generic. BBEG reveal wasn't surprising if you've seen Yugioh Zexal. 

Art looks nice, but I can't see why they go around the ship in schoolgirl outfits...some would blame it on the genre, but given that the previous game revolves around an Academy (which I haven't played) it wouldn't surprise me to learn that they're assets lifted from that. 

While it's an okay time sink, I don't think there was any great benefit of playing it. Something like Long Live the Queen is more frustrating but also satisfying. 

Note for the designer: Consider a pre-rolling system for fights to reduce save scumming to get extra hits/damage.

22615809.review:
Nice little tactical space battle wargame with a story (using the characters from Sunrider Academy!)

You have a carrier onto which you can load piloted battlesuits. The ship and suits have special abilities and can be upgraded as the game progresses. The battle mecanics are clear and as 'logical' as such games can be. There are a nice mix of weapons, with units launching waves of 'battlestar galactica' style torpedoes at each other before closing to use energy/kinetic weapons.

Battles are very unforgiving - if you misuse your units/abilities you will lose.
