Ese juego me atrapó desde el inicio tiene un monton de cosas que me gustan: Es una novela visual con combates por turnos en donde la estrategia es fundamental, una música muy buena para cada momento del juego, personajes entrañables, waifus muy divertidas, un portagonista que puede parecer al inicio simple y sin profundidad (pero que al aanzar podemos encontrarlo peleando con sus proios demonios de culpa y remordimiento), enemigos astutos y convencidos de estar en lo correcto a su manera, piratas espaciales muy desquiciados, pero con razones de sobra para ser lo que son, unos mechas que son un encanto (ALERTA de spoiler: las alas del Black Jack de Sharr me encantan :) FIN de ALERTA)

En el sitio oficial tiene el parche para restituir las partes que quitaron por censura para publicarlo para todas las edades, también tiene una novela que cuenta toda la historia y es interesante.

Es de emncionar que este juego en steam en realidad scuenta con los capítulos 1 y 2 (Primer arrivo y Mascara de Arcadius) hace poco sacaron la tercera parte, pero ya no es gratis, he visto que tuvieron problemas con la tercera parte, pero ya lo resolvieron, esta compañía supo escuchar a sus fanáticos y corregir rápido sus errores, eso me gusta.

Es una pena que no esté traducida, sería un buen proyecto para plantearlo a la compañía como un aporte de la comunidad, después de todo es la primera novela visual de estratégia "opera espacial" que juego :)

22492546.review:
Note: Since it's a free game, there's not much to complain about

Its a pretty decent turn-based tactical game thats actually VERY tough on the difficulty setting that its "supposed" to be played on. theres a bunch of different difficulties, and the only thing that really changes is the damage each units do and the enemy's accuracy. 

Story is pretty nice and rather original, of course with the occasional cliche character development scenes and stuff. Thankfully there's a skipping option for the times the game crashes or you forget to save or something. 

Combat mechanics are solid and reasonable, though it took me about half the game to start paying attention to some of the deeper aspects of it. It's basically exactly as you see in the gameplay trailer above.

Upgrade system is waaaay too big for you to get through even a quarter of it on your first playthrough, and I've only played it once so I don't know if there's a new game plus or something. It's simple enough for you to understand it almost instantly yet massive enough were you actualy have to make some important decisions as to which part to upgrade. 

Artwork is nice, although it took me a bit to get used to

The only real problems I have with this game are the various crashes I experienced at random and the suuuuper cliffhanger ending that can't really be called an ending. Thankfully the game seemed to have autosaved the previous turn before the crash, so that's just fine. But that ending is just horrific, but does its job well since I actually wanna get the sequel.

22310656.review:
I honestly do not understand all of the great reviews that this game is getting. After playing for several hours I thought I was finally enjoying the game, but then I looked to my left and saw the four bottles of beer I had downed in half an hour and realized that I was just drunk. That's right, I could only enjoy this game drunk. It's that bad. 

The game has two gameplay modes: the visual novel sections through which most of the story is told, and the turn-based strategy battles. Let's address the strategy section first. It is awful. It's not deep nor is it complex. On the default difficulty (Captain) you are at the mercy of a crappy AI. There are missions where it is impossible to guarantee that you will survive the AI's first turn. For example, in one escort mission the AI can easily destroy the unit you are escorting on their first turn; there is nothing you can do to stop this. The only reason you win this mission is if the AI makes crappy decisions and doesn't focus on the escorted ship. And the AI is not scripted to make this bad decision. It will (and did for me) focus down the escorted ship on the first turn several times. Scenarios like this make me feel like I did not defeat a competent opponent, but simply got lucky. The player should never feel like they just got lucky in a strategy game. It's poor design, plain and simple. On top of that, this game suffers from the same problem as XCOM. The random number generator can ruin even the best laid plans. Sure, this is realistic and works if everything else is balanced well. Unfortunately, everything else is not balanced. 

Now to the visual novel section. It's also very bad. The characters are 2-dimensional, walking tropes. Nothing about them feels unique or human. You have the (cold)-tsundere, the girl from the countryside with an adowable (read: annoying) accent, the shy girl, the (angry)-tsundere, the Tease, the emotionless quiet girl, the overly loyal service member. It's terrible. Now, nothing is wrong with using tropes, but the tropes should be used to build characters, not define them. Hell, one of the tsundere characters has a line during battle of, "I-I'm not doing this because I like you!" Really? Was the writer even trying to make characters beyond simple tropes? I really hope not. 

As for the story, there was ONE twist that was decent. I won't spoil it. It's predictable, but at least the foreshadowing is handled in a slightly subtle way. The other major twist, at the end of the second chapter is incredibly obvious and I'm not even sure if it should count as a twist. Overall, the story is very bland. The entire first chapter consists of collecting your harem, and the second chapter has the real story, which is mediocre due to predictable twists and bland characters. 

Let's get to the main reason you play visual novels (no, not the for the H-scenes, I'll get to that): Choices! Oh, this game is full of choices! Wonderful choices! That mean nothing. Literally nothing. There is only one choice in the entire game that changes anything beyond the scene in which that choice is made. What's the point? Why have a choice mechanic is all but one choice won't matter. Maybe they matter in the third chapter, but I don't care. Choices should have consequences that ripple out throughout the plot. They shouldn't just magically make the ending change without changing how that ending is arrived at. 

About that H-Scene (yes, H-Scene, singular). I'm not necessarily opposed to them, but they need to make sense withing the narrative of the game. However, this game's H-Scene adds nothing to the story. It's gratuitous and broke my immersion because it made no sense to be there. Throughout the entire game up to this point we had only seen what our main character had seen, then suddenly we see a scene that our main character has no knowledge of, just so that the author could draw a naked girl. It's in poor taste, hurts the game, and makes the game feel even more pandering. 

Last complaint, the main character. He is even more bland than the rest of the cast. It's obvious that very little thought went into his visual design, and his few voice-acted lines are awful. They are exactly what you would expect a basement-dweller trying to sound "cool" to sound like. It's bad. Really, really bad. 

[h1]Pros/[h1]
[list]
     [*]Very Difficult Turn-Based Strategy Combat
     [*]Some of the girls visual designs are well done
[/list]

[h1]Cons[/h1]
[list]
     [*]You are at the mercy of poor AI and a random number generator
     [*]Characters are boring at best, and maddeningly annoying at worst
     [*]The story is generic and predictable 
     [*]Completely unecessary and immersion breaking H-Scene
     [*]Mostly awful voice-action, particularly for the main character
     [*]Your choices don't matter (except for one)
[/list]

[h1]Verdict[/h1]
Do not recommend.

Maybe the story problems are addressed in the third chapter. But I won't ever find out. These first two chapters were so poorly handled that I have no desire to give the third a chance.

21980646.review:
Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius is an combined Game: Its an VN and a round based strategy game. Also the Steamversion "Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius" is an combined version of "Sunrider: First Arrival" and "Mask of Arcadius" so you are playing two parts in one.

Pro:

- good stroy
- excellent soundtrack
- good gameplay
- free to play
- results can be implementet in the next installment

Cons:

- Just a part of an longer series
- graphics seems a bit old
- not every choice matters in the game - it will have an affect in the last installment.

Story:
You are Kayto Shields, captain of the Sunrider the newest and strongest ship in the Cera Space Force. A few moments after you take over the command of your new ship Cear is attacked by PACT. PACT is an enemy force wich is invading the neutral Rim and heading for the other big power in the universe: The alliance. You lose the battle of Cera and have no choice but to flee. You are the only surviver of the battle and have to find new allies to reach the only goal you have: Fight PACT and liberate Cera!

Gameplay:
Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius is an more linear VN wich have strategic fights in its storyline. You can upgrade your ships and buy installments and supplys to get more mighty in your fights. This strategic element is an very great thing. It gives you more action and you have to think more often how your next turn would get you further to victory. All in all it makes very much fun to play. Also the story is fantastic. And its FREE TO PLAY! The Soundtrack supports the game in an awsome way. It fits fantastic. The atmosphere becomes very exiting and epic. 

Conclusion:
The game is just awesome. Its free to play. The Soundtrack is epic like hell. The OP Song fits the game. The strategic fight are challenging and fun, but you can choose the difficulty every time you want. The CGs are very good and the story is epic. All in all its an must have title in your collection!

9/10

21921608.review:
Вообще я думал, что это какую-нибудь ерунда (бесплатная же - нельзя просто так взять и выпустить в стиме хорошую сингловую бесплатную игру), но так как следующая (платная) часть сериала настоятельно рекомендовала ознакомиться с этой, то я, ну, ознакомился.

В первую очередь, меня удивило, что здесь художники явно лучше, чем у многих других визуальных новелл в стиме. Половина персонажей все равно на одно лицо (а выделяются разве что толстяк да адмирал-пенсионер), но это гораздо лучше, чем у многих других.

Сюжет, в принципе, нормальный - космические сопли, размазанные в меньшей степени по диалогам, в большей - по боям. Тактические бои не то, чтоб совсем примитивные, но баланс слабоват. Больше половины прошел на "на этой сложности и надо играть в Sunrider", потом плюнул на все это и снизил, потому что играть в это ради тактики, по-моему, смешно.

ВН - другое дело, хотя ничего оригинального в сценарии найти не удалось: вроде в космосе тусуемся, а все равно - принцессы, артефакты какие-то таинственные, корабли-призраки, сверхлюди и проч., и проч.

В диалогах часто предлагают сделать выбор, который, по-моему, вообще ни на что не влияет. В принципе, через пару диалоговых экранов все уже забудут про твой выбор (даже сценарист забудет) и все пойдет своим - абсолютно линейным - чередом.

Впрочем, учитывая цену этой игры (ноль рублей), учитывая качество других ВН в стиме (за которые просят больше ноля рублей), думаю, первую Sunrider можно советовать тем, кто хочет узнать что вообще такое это "ВН". В конце концов, тут еще и настоящий геймплей есть, и развитие своих подопечных (их летательных аппаратов) и т.п. приятные мелочи.

21897337.review:
If Turn Based Strategy Space Combat + Visual Novel sounds like fun to you, then you'll love this game... with one caveat:

Be prepared to cheat like you've never cheated before.

Seriously, I can usually demolish strategy games of this sort with just a little practice but this thing is nuts.  Even at the lowest difficulties I cheated like crazy and still had to work for it in the later levels (unless you use the "I win" button in the debug console, but I didn't take things that far).

The difficulty ramp on this game is absurd and there's no way to "grind" for more resources (which is the primary thing most people seem to cheat for).  Now some of you may be saying "Yeah, but you probably just suck." to which I say "fair enough", but you'll probably be fine if that's your outlook.  To everyone else: go find the debug/developer console (there's a guide for setting it up in the community guides) and have it at the ready for when the game starts to get insane (right around the first escort mission things start getting out of hand, but I made it a few levels beyond that before I had to open the console).

A few console commands I found handy:

BM.money = #### (#### = amount of money to set as your new value)
BM.command = #### (#### = Number of command points to give yourself)
sunrider.rockets = 2 (in combat: reload your rockets)
BM.order_used = False (in combat: Allow yourself to give another command order this turn)

战旗+GAL类型的游戏。
流程大概10来小时。

战斗模式上，移动和攻击都消耗能量（每回合初恢复满），而非“移动+行动”类的。（其实这两种都算常见啦）
因为引擎的问题，战斗的操作上不是太舒服，但还可以接受。
战斗胜利了可以用钱升级等等。
普通难度略难，不SL基本感觉过不了。（而且个人怀疑概率不是真实概率，虽然可能也是我脸黑）推荐没有同类型游戏经验的玩家直接简单或者电子小说难度走起了。
故事还是比较主流的，主角为了祖国奋斗抗击外敌的故事。几个剧情的关键点处理得也不错。而且有影响故事（及续作）的分支剧情和强制二选一（也可以都不选）的支线任务，其中某些分歧项着实拷问玩家的良心。音乐搭配得也可以。
画面嘛，一旦习惯了西方人的萌系画风还不算差。单讲场面的场景BG还是蛮不错的。
总体说来，可以算是佳作了。特别是作为free game来讲。
建议没有体验过的玩家尝试一下，毕竟免费买不到吃亏上当。

I'm going to rate this positively for one reason: I got more than my money's worth out of it, because it was free.

On Captain mode (what they describe as "Normal") it got so painfully hard that I was forced to save scum every combat round, and I still couldn't succeed without lowering it to Ensign. 21632345.review:
I can't believe how good this game is for being free.

One part visual novel, one part tactical RPG. And both parts are pretty good.

On the VN side of things, Sunrider takes place in a universe that is surprisingly well fleshed out, and you can tell a lot of love went into making it. All of your crew members (who are all female, because Visual Novel) read like a check list of anime clichés. Somehow, this is done well enough to the point where I found myself barely even noticing. Without spoiling anything, this is helped by all of them being more than just the obvious clichés. The only major cons of the VN side is that your choices don't seem to have too much lasting impact beyond a few sentences afterwards. This might change in latter "chapters", but for now its a minor complaint. 

As far as the tactical RPG side of things, holy fuck this game gets hard. You're started out on a medium difficulty, and there is zero shame in lowering it because of how hard this game can get. Presumably, the highest difficulty consists of the developers kicking in your door and beating you with lead pipes every time there is a battle. By comparison, medium difficulty only has them beating you with their bare hands. Combat itself is really, really fun though.

I love this game so much that I got the alternate universe dating sim (Sola is best waifu) without blinking and I'm grabbing the third chapter as soon as I can.

21631630.review:
Sunrider: Mask Of Arcadius is my first experience with a modern digital novel and it is and has been a great one. Each play session feels like a chapter from a very enjoyable book and you really get the feel for the characters as well and the pleasant quirkiness and liberated attitude with regard to some mature topics often found in the JRPG genre. They can take topics that might make some feel a bit prudish and uncomfortable and somehow have you laughing and enjoying the experience without alienating you.

This game is no different and it starts with a bang, getting the major plot devices in motion as you encounter and evade the nemesis in the first chapter. From there you're learning the game's concepts and expanding your team in chapter sized adventures that introduce new gameplay elements in bite sized doses. By the time you've put your team together you've acquired all the gameplay skills needed to handle running your ship.

The most important part of any book and novel are the characters and if you don't feel something for them chances are you won't be able to identify with the story. In Suriders the characters are each well defined each possessing their own nuances and differences without playing too much on cliche. Some are so quirky and funny you'll be saving often just so you can try all the different branches of dialog to see what happens. All and all it has been an enjoyable experience so far.

Each chapter plays out in such a way that you can do an adventure and return later. The game itself is well designed in that aspect as each chapter is like an episode in the overall mission and goal.

The artwork is awesome Japanime at its best which plays out like the panels in a comic book or graphic novel. The soundtrack as well gets you pumped for the gameplay elements which play out on 2D grid and resemble a strategic board game where you command your forces against the enemy with a variety of mission goals as well.

If anything it's games like these that will introduce a generation to the wonders and joys of reading and perhaps as more authors embrace the world of the digital medium we'll see more mixed medium content like this making its way into storytelling and gameplay experience. It's power as a medium for language instruction are immense as it is for learning reading.

Highly recommended

21625643.review:
Um, so you end up captaining a military space ship, actually a "space aircraft carrier" except that your aircraft had been replaced by mechas which, had I still had my chuunibyou would actually be pretty badass. Well it might be badass regardless... -.-
I don't know about you, but I can't even begin to imagine being a captain of such a majestic steed if not for all the mecha pilots (and my first officer) being young girls that would make up a fabulous harem for my humble self. Luckily this is exactly the case in Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius.
Moving on, some unfortunate events (Maray... π.π) that unfold right after you arrive on board your new ship leave you holding a completely reasonable grudge against a rising space empire and knowing no better pastime in between your romantic rendezvous you decide to singlehandedly wipe them out.
Thus starts unfolding a visual novel styled story filled to brim with cliché developments as well as crude jokes. The story writing is awkward at times and rough around the edges and character art could use some more work also, but all in and out the jokes save the day and the characters are well made and you’ll grow to like them in no time. Not to mention the male lead (that is you actually) has some good lines from time to time. Just to tell you, I usually get very mad at the main characters of visual novels for doing stupid things over and over and me (being presumably in control) not being able to do anything against it. But, I didn’t hate Kayto Shields as much as the rest of them! Must be magic! o.o
That aside. Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius features apart from the game title itself not short of a dozen chuunibyou and cliché features that will make you love it! Just kidding. What I meant to say is that apart from the visual novel part the game also features spacecraft battles in a turn-based strategy format. This aspect of the game is actually very well made and quite challenging too, undoubtedly even for experienced veterans among gamers. That is unless you go with easy difficulty that is there for people who only want to experience the harem story.
Right, about time to end my useless blabbering. Gentlemen try this game. It is far better than the free to play tag makes it seem.

TLDR version: Try the game and see for yourself.

21618625.review:
[h1]Sunrider : Mask of Arcadius[/h1]

Mélange d’histoire visuelle et de petit jeu de stratégie tour par tour où l’on se retrouve dans la peau de Kayto Shields capitaine encore inexpérimenté du Sunrider un vaisseau spatial. Suite à l’attaque et destruction de sa nation, le capitaine shields va se lancer dans un combat contre les asseyants et devoir se constituer un équipage.  

J’avais un petit peu d’appréhension concernant ce jeu, car même si je suis amateur de jeu de stratégie c’est une histoire visuelle que je recherchais ici et j’avais peur de tomber sur un jeu de stratégie saupoudré de quelques dialogues.  Mais étant gratuit je me suis tout de même lancé et j’avoue avoir été agréablement surpris !

Même si on n’est pas dans la performance littéraire, on se laisse vraiment séduire par l’histoire et prendre dans l’aventure ! Les personnages ne sont pas dénués d’intérêts et sont même plutôt particulièrement attachants, chacun ayant sa propre personnalité et histoire. Visuellement rien à reprocher c’est plutôt agréable à regarder et les musiques collent bien avec l’univers du jeu. 
Le seul petit point négatif est l’absence de romance possible avec les différentes filles de l’équipage mais possible que le 3ème volet de la série réponde à cette attente. 

Le gameplay est également une très belle réussite, en plus des nombreux choix et interactions avec les personnages on a également un jeu de stratégie très bien réalisé et pas évident du tout. J’ai fait une première fois le jeu en mode facile puis me suis étonné à m’amuser à le refaire avec un mode plus difficile  et là les choix de développement des différents vaisseaux mais aussi les placements, déplacements et choix en combats deviennent vitaux. 
Par contre il manque à mon sens une petite option pour sauter complètement les combats car si on veut tester un peu différentes combinaisons d’interactions et voir si çà influe sur le déroulement çà oblige à se retaper les combats.  

[h1]En conclusion :[/h1]
Sunrider : Mask of Arcadius est un jeu étonnement polyvalent qui pourra à la fois satisfaire les amateurs d’histoire visuelle grâce au mode facile, comme satisfaire les amateurs de tactical-rpg mais qui comblera surtout ceux qui comme moi apprécient les 2.  Le jeu étant en plus gratuit je ne peux que vivement le recommander et j’investirais très certainement dans le 3ème épisode qui sera cette fois payant mais  c’est amplement justifié.

[b]Bilan : 8/10[/b]

21486296.review:
"It's free, and you can finish it in an afternoon," a friend tried to convince me.

When you've been around the VN scene long enough, you sort of know what to expect going into these things: small team, kickstarted, an artist with a bland-ish "I haven't found my own style yet" look, and a story that (on the surface at least) seems so generic it made me audibly groan.

[h1]Screw that "Book by its cover..." sh!t.[/h1]

Sunrider is clearly the product of someone invested in their work, and if you get past the initial blandness of it all, there's a good VN underneath.

The writing won't win a Pulitzer, but it makes its delivery and the skill of the writer clearly improved over the course of creating this work.
The game, while meaty and challenging enough, is not revolutionary. If you prefer, there is even an option to essentially skip it, though I advise against it.
The story has bite to it. Much like the writing, the narrative starts slow and stiff, but hits its stride early on and doesn't stop until the end.

Some reviewers talk about how much they would/would not spend. When I was first asked to play Sunrider, I was ready to throw it away and write it off before even booting it up. After finishing it, I donated 100$US to Love in Space to thank them for their work. Two days later, I still don't regret the decision.

21240967.review:
This game excels as a visual novel, but fails as a strategy game.

The battle portions of the game are clunky. Numbers are so small they're impossible to read. Clicking on an attack icon (on the left side of the screen) sometimes causes units to move to the right, for no apparent reason. Other times, after failing to make an attack due to being out of range, suddenly no units would be able to move. They had enough energy to move, and I was clicking on an allowed space, but the game would be unresponsive. Attacks would still work, as would clicking on other units to switch focus to them, but no units would move. On top of that, every single attack seems to lead to a cutscreen, which thankfully can be skipped through with skip mode, but sometimes dialogue appears during battles. And when there's dialogue, unless you've read it before, you have to manually click through it, which brings you out of skip mode, so the next time you make an attack, there's another cutscreen. It's unbearable. If the battle portions weren't so frustrating to deal with, they'd probably be a lot of fun.

Because of the difficulties I was having with combat, I was hesitant to keep playing. I wasn't sure I was going to like this game. But the story part (which is the majority of the game, thankfully) more than makes up for its awful combat portions. I kept playing, and I didn't regret it. The next thing I knew, it was nearly 2 AM and I was crying.

It's too bad there's a "no battles whatsoever" difficulty level, because as it stands, I'm not going to be replaying the game to see what making different choices leads to. I refuse to put up with that combat system again. And honestly, that's a real shame, because I really liked the story and the characters.

That being said, since the game is free, I have to reccommend it. But I'd never pay money for this.

20943866.review:
Pure fun. Amazing story, coupled with excellent gameplay and amazing feel. I went in expecting another boring dating sim (only really tried the game for the giant robits) and was far more than pleasantly surprised. From firing the Sunrider's "Vanguard Cannon" (A axial superlaser the just wreaks absolute havoc on enemy lines), to cackling as enemy missiles and torpedoes are shot out of the sky by my heavy flak, the gameplay just feels spot on. It's like if we actually got a Gundam tactics game that told it's own story instead of either rehashing the usual plotlines or copying one of the shows scene for scene.

The storytelling absolutely blew me away. This game includes parts one and two of the series, with part 3 "Liberation Day" well on the way. And boy oh boy, am I excited for that to land, because of - Well, I'm not going to spoil it for you! Suffice to say, the game's story can stand among the giants of space opera and hold it's own, which says a lot for it. Some scenes will make you cry, others will tear you apart. When this game gets dark and gritty, ho boy get ready, you're in for an emotional rollercoaster ride of sadness and depression, and some loathing of humanity, Even the social commentary common to many Sci-Fi series makes several appearances.

Gameplay is smooth and difficulty ranges from sailing through the wreckage of your opponents on a casual stroll through the plot to tearing your hair out and cursing at your screen as half your team gets wiped in one turn. Whatever your difficulty preference, Sunrider has it, including a game mode the dev team admits may not even be winnable (this is noted prominently on the mode selection).

Oh and the soundtrack. Absolutely stunning main themes, along with wonderful battle music that fits the feel of the setting. While i'm on the subject of the audio, the sound effects are nice and very anime-inspired, and the voiceovers are AMAZING. From Icari yelling at enemies for scratching the paint on her robit, to Asaga declaring "I'ma Firin' Mah Lazer!" the voiceover work is charming and amusing.

But why are you reading this when you could be PLAYING?? It's FREE!! Download Sunrider now and see what all the fuss is about!

20737294.review:
If you're going to play this game, you're either really into visual novels, or really into tactical rpg's, and the game actually handles both competently. There are plenty of flaws here that would break a commercial game, but for a free game, it's strengths outweigh it's frustrations. Yes, it's a freeware game, by the way. No tricks. 

So what have we got in the VN side? A harem story that paints it's characters in broad strokes, doesn't branch out much in terms of individual heroines, has pretty generic and partially unfinished looking visuals (some of the menu's repurpose the concept art scetches) and that really doesn't stray far from the tropes of a regular "band of misfits rises up against evil" story. However, the story does do a good job of keeping you invested enough in the battles, does a very good job of tying the gameplay and story together, and all of the cliches and tropes are executed well enough to be entertaining. The story borrows heavily from a dozen space and mecha shows, but doesn't dumb down it's narrative, and generally understands whaty makes these kinds of stories interesting. The game also doesn't force it's exposition down your throat when you don't want to read it, and generally proceeds at a good pace. So storywise, there's nothing too bad here, but nothing you haven't seen before.

The tactical combat is... ande interesting mixed bag. The game uses a hex-based grid in which you command your units, ships and mechas ("Ryders", in this game) around the board, trying to choose the right unit and weapon for each enemy target. On one hand, it's really badly done at a technical level, with janky, very basic still animations that require you to actually click to advance the animation, and take forever to play out. I actually managed to crash the game in the first mission, by accidentally queing up an action while another battle-animation was playing. However, the combat system itself is very fun, forcing you to try to min-max your squad use, and find the correct weapons to wipe out as much as you can each turn. The combat system itself is reasonably strong, but the way it's used holds it back at times. For one, the game is very unforgiving on the default difficulty. On one mission, I was forced to pilot a squad of three units, one of them a support, against an entire army of stronger units spawning from the mission's objective. Another time, a mission objective that couldn't be moved was surrounded by enemy units, that could destroy it on turn one. Compared to some other games in the genre, there is a ridiculous ammount of trial and error involved with this game, and I don't blame anyone for starting on one of the lower settings. at one point, I had to play an hour of gameplay again to re-upgrade my ship, so I could deal with a particular mission. Incidentally, the upgrade system is  pretty simple, menu based one, mostly just providing stat-upgrades. It gives a lot of choices in upgrading, though, so I like it.

"Competent" is the word I would use to describe this game. The next game in the series is going to be commercial, and I expect the developers to take the lessons from this game and apply them to deliver something that is worth paying for. Cleaner menu's and backrounds, more flowing gameplay, spit, polish and bugfixing.

20526373.review:
About the developer: 
This is not the first game I have played from this developer. I actually played Homeward a while back (which is my favorite visual novel ever). However I did not directly notice that this game was from the same developer, although the art style was recognizable. After this game I also played Sunrider Academy which is a spin off from this game. Each and every of these games had there own fun Experian's with a mutual feeling of joy and care that the developer has put into them. Because of this I can say that Love in Space is absolutely one of my favorite developers. 
 
The Game: 
Story: 
The story is about a young space captain who loses his home and family to a powerful enemy. He then travels space with his crew in his ship the Sunrider in order to find new allies so he can defeat this dangerous enemy. However along the way he finds friends, enemy, and even love... 
 
Gameplay: 
The game has both visual novel and rpg elements with a fun and challenging combat system. There are different choices to make along the game and several difficulty levels for the combat. 
 
A must play from a very generous developer!

[h1]Справедливость и отвага[/h1]

Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius одна из тех пошаговых стратегий которую я не забуду.
Сразу скажу что Академия Санрайдер и Маска Аркадиуса две совсем разные игры(Даже игры нам говорят что сюжеты происходят в разных реальностях). Тут вы не будете покорять девушек,а будете покорять просторы Нейтральных Миров.

Пристегнулись?3...2...1. Запустить маршевые двигатели!
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=598951490

[b]Сюжет[/b]:
Нам суждено воевать против революционного фронта ПАКТ который в свое время сверг Новую Империю и решил прибрать к себе все возможное, в том числе и Альянс - объединение демократических планет. Если кто-то пытается отказаться от присоединения, то ответ очевиден.
Заправляет этим балаганом Аркадиус - таинственная личность о которой слагают легенды.
Мы же управляем одним из самых новых и мощнейших кораблей в галактике - "Санрайдером"
Не по своей воле ввязавшись в этот конфликт мы должны положить конец этой тирании.

[b]Персонажи[/b]:
Нашу комманду можно назвать самой разношерстной, и самой упоротой(наверно).

[u]Кайто[/u]: Капитан "Санрайдера" и наш главный герой. Так гнался за мечтой своего друга детства что сам пошел в космофлот. Для него все на корабле теперь одна большая семья которую он поклялся защищать.

[u]Ава[/u]: Старпом на корабле и друг детства. Как и в школе характер у неё является строгим. Не терпит когда кто-то не соблюдает субординацию на "Санрайдере". Похоже таскает с собой карманный устав.

[u]Асага[/u]: После одного инцидента стала вольной наёмницей и подружилась с Чигарой. До встречи охраняла шахтёрскую колонию от обнаглевших в конец пиратов.

[u]Чигара[/u]: Еле успела унести ноги с родной планеты пока та не взорвалась. А все так хорошо начиналось, новый проект должен был принести успех но ohh shii~. Потом её нашла Асага. До встречи работала в свой мастерской-пекарне на орбите шахтёрской колонии.

[u]Икари[/u]: У неё свои счеты с ПАКТом. Наёмница, надеялась что убийствами сможет утолись свою жажду мести, увы нет. Немного дерзкая, со второй половины игры то и дело перепирается с Криской.

[u]Сола[/u]: Является Рювийской принцессой которую, как настала война - отправили в бой на одном из самых смертоносных кораблей. Её нашли в поле обломков спустя 2000 лет в стазисе после её последнего сражения.

[u]Клод[/u]: Была врачом, пока не отобрали лицензию за весьма странные способы "лечения". Извращенка с головы до ног, похоть так и прёт...

[u]Криска[/u]: Молодой лейтенант, поставлена лично адмиралом Греем для службы на "Санрайдере" и защиты капитана. Обладает весьма похожим характером что и Ава, но не так строга. Продолжительное время будет спорить с Икари.

[b]Корабли и райдеры[/b]:
Думали будете управлять только одной махиной? А кто-же её прикрывать в бою будет? Конечно же райдеры!
Райдеры представляют собой мехов неплохого размера.
Позже по сюжету можно будет покупать фрегаты поддержки, которые важны в бою.

[b]Диалоги и нравственный выбор[/b]:
Далеко не на последнем месте тут диалоги и ваши действия. От ваших поступков у разных людей будет разное отношение. Далеко не раз вам нужно будет чем-то жервовать, всё таки война, а война - страшная штука. В одном моменте меня аж подташнивало...
Спешу обрадовать, в конце, та кому вы уделяли больше всего внимания или распологали своими решениями к ней будет названа победительницей в своеобразном конкурсе.

[b]Музыка[/b]:
Музыка в баталиях превосходная, чувствуешь что это зверь, который устрашает противника. В большенстве исполнена на электрогитаре, чему я рад. Немногие группы могут этим похватстаться. Так-же в бой всупает голос вокалистки Риты(RITA).

[b]Геймплей[/b]:
Тут от других пошаговых стратегий он далеко не отошел, так же распологаем свой флот, запрашиваем поддержку в виде фрегатов Шахтёрского Объединения или крейсеров Альянса. В первую очередь конечно же победа будет зависить от правильного использования юнитов и тактики.

Поскольку пройдя и первую и вторую части вы поймёте что это далеко не конец, авторы нас порадовали известием что продолжение во всю делается. Имя ему Sunrider: Liberation Day и он продолжит сюжетную линию примерно с того же места где закончилась оригинальная игра. Обещают английскую и японскую озвучку, в этот же пучок входят английский и японский перевод. Уже представленны некоторые концепт-арты и моменты сюжета. Опенинг будет так же исполнять Рита, зваться песня будет SORA NO KODOU. Ждем и надеемся.

[h1]Вердикт[/h1]

Игра застуженно получает 10 баллов из 10 за сюжет, персонажей и музыку.

20474492.review:
As a rule, I do not like Virtual Novels. There have been a couple that were more than just animated garbage wrapped in a pretty package. This is one of them.

The story is decent, moving you from one point to the next, without being too over the top like I've seen in a number of games similar to this one. The music is excellent and I never found myself wanting to turn it off and put on my own tunes. I was pretty surprised by this, especially with the pricetag on it. The combat is rather interesting, even though it seems badly out of balance in favor of the AI. I may just be inexperienced with the system though, so I'll have to mess around and experiement a little more to see if this is true or just me being bad at the game. Be careful when choosing your difficulty, you can go from romping all over the enemies to getting slaughtered in a heartbeat.

Overall, definately a game you should check out and try for yourself. I give it a 7/10. Much better than average, and much better than some of the garbage I've seen floating around Steam looking at you with googly eyes and large busts. Definately something I'd be willing to pay for once it's complete. They have Part 3 coming out sometime, and I'll be picking it up as soon as it comes out.

20380590.review:
Não recomendo de maneira alguma rapazeada.

Evitem-no! Motivo?

Em si é bom, conforme vai indo se torna mais legal, as batalhas são justas ( esperem lá ) e tudo mais que uma plataforma tem a oferecer esta proporciona, antes do ultimo desafio.

Realmente antes do fim, pois o mesmo é impossível de passar, não é que eu esteja chateado com ele, e sim, que o jogo em sí tornou impossível de se zerar.

Spoiler: A ultima missão você enfrenta uma quantidade de naves, só que nenhum dos ataques nessas funciona, nenhum mesmo. Fortes, fracos ou médios... nada! E a todo momento surgem novas, o mapa todo com inimigos e sua tropa lá, com todas as opções acarretando em "miss". Fiz várias tentativas, optei em utilizar estratégias diferentes, sendo que todo "round" apareciam mais rivais, chegando a vir 10 de uma só vez.


Não recomendo em ipótese alguma, pois lhe faz ficar alucinado e depois testa sua paciência, por um final mal feito.

Se anseiam em tentar ou pensam que dão conta, tudo bem, só que jogos servem para diversão, entreterimento e lazer, não para dar raiva e estresse.

Boa sorte para quem ignorar meu aviso. Os que leram este comentário e mudaram de idéia, saibam que se livraram de uma dor de cabeça, pois é sim, viciante e irão ficar repetindo o problema, mas só irão se decepcionar, perder a linha e retirá-lo. Evitem isto...deixem de lado o desapontamento, já que é um bom, só que o esforço não é recompensado.

20311670.review: Наебали, в общем. Вначале говорили, что кредиты фармятся за миссии, которые надо брать, возможность выбора между побочными миссиями, где одну выбираешь, а вторая исчезает. А в итоге: абсолютная линейность, тебе просто показывают сюжетеую линию, ты читаешь, как твой персонаж принимает миссию, идешь драться. Побочек, естественно, нет вообще. Негде фармить кредиты и очки командования. Ты просто нажимаешь на портреты персонажей, говоришь, тебе суют заготовленный бой, с одинаковыми расстановкой и количеством войском, тебе дают определенное количество кредитов и очков командования... Все. Вся нелинейность заключается в том, на что эти кредиты потратить. А для визуальной новеллы сюжет не то, что слабый, а, скорее, неинтересный. Нет драмы, кульминации, необычных поворотов сюжета, романтики, нарисованных сисек, в общем всего того, что делает японские новеллы интересными. Понимаю, что это бесплатная игра, не требующая много места и системных характеристик. Но зачем тогда расписывать несуществуе возможности в начале игры, если можно удалить ее после получаса игры тем, кому она не понравится, а не ждать, как долбаеб : "вот сейчас вот рпг появится... сейчас миссии полетят... нафармлю кредитов...буду принимать решения, которые повлияют на судьбу персонажей и концовку".

20136669.review:
Sorry, but I just can't give this one a positive review.

After trying to get past the first "escort" mission for several hours with anything short of the "combat is a joke" difficulty, and failing no matter which combination of "turtle", "slug it out", or "run like hell" is picked, *and* each of the three paths into the combat, up to and including "save after every successful hit" (the epitome of save-scumming)... I realized something:

The only reason you're in that fight in the first place is because the character is a freaking moron.

The developer commentary in the forums basically says "one guy against a galaxy, of course it is hard" -- well, one guy against a galaxy is about like one guy on the beaches of Noirmandy, only a whole lot less likely to survive. Which is why any captain that had two brain cells to rub together wouldn't approach the problem the way this one does. Especially when the storyline immediately prior to that point makes it abundantly clear that he's being played for a sucker on multiple levels.

So it fails as an interesting turn-based tactical, but much more damning, it fails to establish anything resembling an interesting story, either. Yeah, I could crank it down the last notch, or even just break out the console cheats... or for that matter, probably just edit the game source, if I felt like it. But why bother?

我该从哪开始讲啊……
从玩了45小时的sunrider academy过来，然后花了25小时玩了这个本篇

一句话来讲，主角作为Sunrider战舰舰长一边满宇宙收集同(hou)伴(gong)一边准备跟某个打算征服全宇宙的邪恶势力开战
[strike]听起来超耳熟啊喂这不就是Commander Shepard跟Normandy吗[/strike]

系统：
可以从截图里看出是类似战棋形式的战略部分以及视觉小说的部分
似乎是Renpy引擎的作品（然而我并没有用过
画面很简单……基本就是简单的静态图
战略部分有难度调节，一般难度下灭个好几次团也是很正常的，然而Academy里操控概率的S/L大法依旧可用（我直到最后一关才意识到可以在战斗中全程SL
主角需要通过战斗击毁敌方单位或是使之投降才能获取经费，然后花钱升级己方单位或是购买配件来提升战斗力。然而游戏本身的战斗次数是固定的也就是说并没有无限次的战斗让你刷钱，相比之下可以升级的部分却有一大把，所以决定把钱花在升级哪部分还是购买友军单位也成了需要考虑的要素。
顺带一提战斗部分是有语音的，虽然只是几句台词仍然非常到位

剧情：
视觉小说的部分主体是太空歌剧的格调，剧情氛围的烘托十分到位（宏大的欧美风BGM作用不少
选择分支上出现了像质量效应系列一样会影响到后续剧情的道德抉择，之所以放在这里讲是因为做这类选择的感觉实在太熟悉了，剧透注意：[spoiler]对于像我这样有选择困难症的人群这种一个决定死上万人的抉择纠结到了极点，讲真最后那个选项之后真让我倒吸了口凉气[/spoiler]
而且根据制作组一二部的选项还会继承到第三部里对剧情（以及攻略妹子）产生影响，[strike]这真的不是质量效应吗……[/strike]
游戏分为两个章节，从开篇到第一场大战的First Arrival以及从沙滩剧(fu)情(li)直到结局的Mask of Arcadius
然后第三章就是正在制作的Liberation Day
剧情本身是个很良心的故事，无论是宏大程度还是剧情展开上都令人惊喜，充满了感染力和代入感的故事和台词很容易触动人，不知为何这点比很多日产的日呆游戏好的多（难道是因为语言是英语？）
相比下外传性质的Academy那边完全就是小打小闹……


人设：
船上的船员妹子们也算是性格多样[strike]（满足各种口味）[/strike]，而且各个都背景复杂各具萌点，因为只有两章许多人物的背景还没得到进一步展开，然而每个人物的故事都并不简单
画风上明显是一股欧美人画日漫风的感觉而且并不成熟，这一点硬伤在一些次要人物身上体现明显，从BETA看第三章对这点改善不少
有关那啥补丁方面并没有比重特别大的HSCENE[strike]（毕竟本职是要去打仗啊又不像Academy那样上个学没事就啪啪啪）[/strike]
并没有几张CG……感情线上因为没有到结局除了回忆部分之外并没有和妹子们有很大的进展[strike]（说白了不就是还没推嘛……废话战争时期啊[/strike]

总之推荐给英语基础好而且对科幻尤其是太空歌剧感兴趣的绅士
重要的是这是款免费游戏，[strike]只要零元买不了吃亏买不了上当啊（[/strike]
从第三部进展来看这个欧美社团做起来也是挺拼的……
而且ED挺好听的……

BTW,[spoiler]Sola is the best girl.[/spoiler]

19702384.review:
[h1]"This story takes place as we live today, in a universe reminiscent but vastly different from our own..."[/h1]

Quando [b]Sunrider[/b] foi apresentado em um projeto no Kickstarter, a idéia era de apenas um jogo, chamado Sunrider, mas por diversos motivos acabou se tornando uma trilogia, três jogos ou três capítulos como eu gosto de chamar.

Aqui na Steam nós temos o Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius que contem dois capítulos, o primeiro capitulo nomeado como First Arrival e o segundo que é como esta sendo apresentado o jogo, o Mask of Arcadius.
Os dois capítulos aqui representados por Mask of Arcadius estão completamente de graça enquanto o terceiro capítulo que é o Liberation Day é pago e precisa ser adquirido separadamente. Essa analise é exclusivamente dos dois primeiros capítulos.

Bom, você é Kayto Shields, capitão de uma nave de guerra em que você é o único homem aparentemente ¯\_(ツ)_/¯.
Eu não vou falar da história, saibam que é muito boa e vale a pena que vocês acompanhem por vocês mesmos, vou falar mais de como a história é apresentada. O jogo conta a história como uma visual novel, mas ele tem uma pegada de RPG, batalhas por turno e tudo mais... Se você é um fã de VN's e quer acompanhar somente a história, ele te deixa por em uma dificuldade onde é impossível perder as batalhas e te permite curtir a história, ou você pode sofrer como todo mundo nas batalhas que são bem difíceis!

O jogo te apresenta diversas decisões morais ao longo da história, imagina que você esta em um corredor e chega a uma bifurcação,  você pode seguir reto, pegar a diagonal direita ou diagonal esquerda, seja lá qual for sua opção, você vai ver um desenrolar especifico para aquele caminho, só que um pouco mais frente os três caminhos se juntam no mesmo corredor de novo.
Então as decisões elas levam ao mesmo destino não importa qual você escolha, mas o desenrolar delas são diferentes entre si.

O Liberation Day, leva em conta todas as suas decisões anteriores, no final do Mask of Arcadius ele te pergunta se você quer fazer um save para levar para o próximo jogo quando sair, bem no estilo Mass Effect.

Sunrider tem uma história genial, uma trilha sonora que consegue fazer diferença, você se pega imerso sem perceber, como ele pega bem pesado no lado RPG, as batalhas às vezes são longas e tem vários momentos que você tem que ficar voltando SAVE para mudar algum movimento, a trilha sonora parece que não deixa quebrar o ritmo, não te deixa desanimar.

O jogo pode durar por volta de 20 horas fora da dificuldade em que você acompanha apenas a história, e vale completamente à pena, esta de graça, aproveitem.

19643581.review:
The greatest flaw with this game is that the soundtrack is too epic for the game......even if it is production-music (Mark Teichert among others) i must make this comment. It's suitable during gameplay segments but during dialogue it is too good for a game using static non-cinematic images and dialogue-segments. Frequent but effectively used short animations and different static-images would have made the epic orchestral score more suitable but also more dramatic as it would have lifted up the presentation and made it better and more dramatic in my opinion. The dignities between the score and VN-segments does not match imo, and little does it help when everything else is usually quiet without any voice-acting other than during gameplay segments. -_-  It put me in a lukewarm, damped enclosed atmosphere. A box.

Another thing is the lack of achievements wich strips the game from giving me any rewarding feeling after executing an effective battle and being a commander. The last flaw, wich i found a little bit embarrassing was that the galaxy-map is clearly a wannabe and copycat of Bioware's Mass Effect galaxy-map. Come on man......

Other than that, thrilling story and medium anime-visuals.

CURRENT SCORE: 6,8/10

Poorly balanced even on low difficulties, in addition to often punishingly low chance to hit (compared to how many enemies there are to fire at you), means after the first couple missions, which ease you in, but mission 3 it becomes a frustrating affair. 

Much as it could be enjoyable, even with buffs on your allies to aid hit rate, and overwhelming enemy numbers/shots, leads you to be spending more time loading and restarting scenarios than the rest of the game and conversation combined.

Just to note, I'm not new to tactical games, and usually play them on Harcore when the option is there (Fire Emblem is a good example, where you lose units permanently should they fall in combat), but where other games are a beautiful dance with death, this one has the troubled issue of scenarios leading to few options, and you are relying entirely on randoms rolls crossing fingers that you hit, they miss, and barring that, you then hit re-load. 
After 5 hours or so and generally enjoying the game for what it is (tropes and cliches aside), it comes down to wasting too much of my time reloading.

19431697.review:
Well I finally finished it, I actually had to cheese the difficulty down to casual to get through 2 of the missions, cleared most of it on Ensign and Captain, but those PACT fleets get pretty brutal towards the end.

A solid hex based tactical space combat sim with a decent story behind it, standard difficulty is set to hard (Captain) but you're supposed to be up against overwhelming odds, so that makes sense, the higher difficulty enemies are pretty brutal even on Ensign (normal), but casual almost feels like god mode after playing on captain.

The ship and ryder upgrades are nice but you won't get super far into the upgrades unless you're playing on a lower dificulty or focusing soley on one ship to upgrade (bad idea bro, don't do that)

The VN portion was nicely animated for the most part and the voice acting was pretty good.

TL:DR nicely drawn space waifu collecter simulator with a brutal turn based strategy game attached to it, and it's free!  8.5/10

19421056.review:
Como falar desse jogo?
Cara, esse jogo é sensacional. Não só isso, além de ter uma ótima história, tem uma jogabilidade totalmente diferente!

Quer um jogo no qual você pode, além de organizar um exército de espaçonaves, conhecer histórias de personagens totalmente involventes, e ainda, de graça? Este é o jogo perfeito.

Agora, indo mais afundo (TL;DR)
O jogo, feito pela empresa Love In Space, tem uma história impressionante de braveza dos personagens, com um grande teor de curiosidade. Nele, você conhece a história do personagem principal, Kayto Shields, um cara que perdeu a família inteira e que seu planeta foi conquistado por forças inimigas, o qual na sua aventura conhece várias personagens, cada uma com sua história, todas igualmente bem desenvolvidas.
Com cada que personagem que se é encontrado no jogo, seu exército é aumentado, sendo que se tem uma jogabilidade refinada que mistura certo tipo de jogo de estratégia por round com uma temática sci-fi com robôs. ROBÔS, CARA.
E, além disso, para se conhecer toda a história, é necessário se jogar todas as fases (tem, sim, como deixá-las fáceis, e até pulá-las com uma simples alteração no código), porém é totalmente worth.

Agora, quanto à pontuação:
O jogo tem alguns defeitos, sim, mesmo sendo um jogo espetacular.
Principalmente, o fato de ter sido feito em Ren'py, o jogo pode ser muito pesado em alguns computadores, porém não completamente. E também, falta muito a jogabilidade entre múltiplos jogadores, o que faria uma grande diferença nesse jogo.
Ainda assim, amo esse jogo de coração, e estou esperando muito ansioso pelo futuro lançamento dos criadores, continuação do mesmo.

Nota: 9,5/10

19336075.review:
First: This game is free thanks to fans which baked on kickstarter and still do on patreon. No catch aligned!

Second: The story is designed for many chapters (three at least). Included are chapter one "First arrival" and two "Mask of Arcadius". The next chapter is in development, private-beta is limited to baker on kickstarter/patreon. There seams to be quite some work to be done, so no TBA (sadly, can't wait!). It is announced NOT as a free update.

Third: The game is a mix of visual novel and roundbased strategic fights.

The story is quite well written even though many cliché's are used. Every character of your group has more to her than the cliché she is based on. "her" and "she" because: Every significant person on your ship (bar yourself) is female. Most unlogical, but apparently in this universe there are only female freelancer-ryder-pilots.

The gameplay:
The VN part just works fine. Nothing special to say about, with the exception: You can fully backroll the current scene, and thus you can also undo your choices. Not that this would matter too much, only few decisions have some influence on the next fight, and the way it looks only one choice near the end has some influence on the story afterwards (if i didn't miss anything).
The battle-part... Let's just say it is NOT easy. The description of the difficulties is exactly right: The default mode "Captain" is a challenge and I did play on the "Ensign" as I dont like to redo every battle many times. There are only two difficulties above "Captain", and the highest is not guarenteed as being winable. When you're not interested in the battles or are extremely bad (like me in my youth), the easiest difficulty "Visual Novel mode" is made for you.
The battles take place on a a hex-based grid, per turn every ship has some amount of energy, which is used for every action of it. Because of the story you start with only your ship and get more units under your command over the story, and as missile-coverage and shields cover adjacent cells too, the positioning gets more important over time, also increasing the fun I got out of it.

Overall I had much fun with this game and strongly recommend it. And as it's free, you can just start downloading without needing to wait for payment. Just hit "Play"!

19254153.review:
[u]О Дэ Су[/u]: [i]Смейся, и весь мир будет смеяться вместе с тобой. Плачь - и ты будешь плакать в одиночестве.[/i] ([b]"올드보이"[/b])

Cто шестьдесят лет прошло с тех пор, как американский коммодор М. К. Перри [url=www.bakumatsu.ru/lib/Nosov_USA-Japan.pdf]покончил[/url] с японским изоляционизмом раз и навсегда, создав прецедент для других великих держав. В наши дни команды их потомков, вооружённые [url=steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=202638470&searchtext=sunrider]моральным[/url] и [url=www.kickstarter.com/projects/1500482054/sunrider/description]материальным[/url] доверием потребителей, повторяют неоднозначные подвиги славных предков: активно выпускают на занятый японскими студиями рынок рёнаев собственные произведения... как правило, способные конкурировать исключительно между собой.

[u][b]LOL, ANIME[/b][/u]
В душе возникло глухое ощущение предвзятости со стороны вашего автора? Скрывать не буду - достоинств игре не занимать. Несмотря на спорный дизайн, отличное качество спрайтов сполна искупает серость отрендеренных задников. Блестящий саундтрек, в который вошли приятная электроника ([i][url=epicsoulfactory.bandcamp.com/track/tokyo-lights]"Tokyo Lights"[/url][/i]), пробирающий до мурашек хор ([i][url=www.jamendo.com/track/898547/the-bladed-druid]"The Bladed Druid"[/url][/i]) и неплохой [b]j-pop[/b] группы [url=soundcloud.com/iced-blade][b]Iced Blade[/b][/url] ([i][url=soundcloud.com/iced-blade/firn-ft-lily-an-maya-1]"Firn"[/url][/i]), мало того, что без особого труда заткнёт за пояс многих своих собратьев из коммерческой среды, так ещё и располагается в подпапке [i]Steam\steamapps\common\Sunrider\game\Music[/i]. Я уж не заикаюсь про игровой процесс, представленный не только в виде визуального романа (объёмного, в котором выбор обусловлен сюжетом, а не процессом), но и тактической стратегии с возможностью развития собственного флота, напоминающей [url=haruhi.wikia.com/wiki/The_Day_of_Sagittarius_III_(fictional_game)]"THE DAY OF SAGITTARIUS III"[/url], даром что яркой и зрелищной. Кажется, что даже добавленная по остаточному принципу озвучка не может испортить впечатление от уже оплаченного за нас бэйкерами [b]freeware-великолепия[/b]...

Саботаж в калифорнийской студии [b]Love in Space[/b] - дело рук сценариста. Уже не имеет значения, насколько сюжетная шалопутность отвечала первоначальной идее: просто вспомните свои ощущения от первых полутора минут мультфильма [url=www.imdb.com/title/tt0169858/]"The End of Evangelion"[/url], и если сцена уединения Синдзи в палате с находящейся в бессознательном состоянии Аской не вызвала в вас умиления от фансервисного угара, то смело проходите мимо игры.

Даже предположив, что оригинальная концепция подразумевала развитие событий в пародийном ключе, в голове всё равно не укладываются тонны пошлого, плоского и фансервисного юмора, направленного прежде всего на тех, кто в японской анимации видит гламурный тренд, а в творчестве [url=ru.typemoon.wikia.com/wiki/Уробути_Гэн]Гэна Уробути[/url] - пропаганду педофилии. Гражданам, приравнивающим это недоразумение к работам [b]BioWare[/b], со всей ответственностью заявляю, что тот же [url=masseffect.bioware.com/downloads/citadel/]"Mass Effect 3: Citadel"[/url] находится на недосягаемой для [b]Love in Space[/b] высоте.

Проблема не в том, что здесь, как и в [url=www.world-art.ru/animation/animation.php?id=6656]"Macross Frontier"[/url], рассыпанные повсюду отсылки в лучшем случае вызывают недоумение (так милую [url=gunbuster.wikia.com/wiki/Nono]Ноно[/url] низвели до путаны; строгую, но женственную [url=macross.wikia.com/wiki/Misa_Hayase]Мису Хаясэ[/url] превратили в обезличенную цундере; а как они изуродовали [url=gundam.wikia.com/wiki/Char_Aznable]Чара[/url]...), но в отсутствии чувства юмора и меры у авторов. Хуже всего, что [url=steamcommunity.com/app/313730/discussions/0/38596748344073324/]неплохо переведённая на русский язык[/url] история героических приключений [i]капитана Шилдса[/i] и его гарема, оказавшегося в центре конфликта двух галактических держав к третьей четверти выкидывает неожиданный трюк, способный уложить на лопатки сюжет какой-нибудь [url=store.steampowered.com/app/50300/]"Spec Ops: The Line"[/url]... Ради того, чтобы остаток игры напоминать нам о комедийной направленности и травить нас совсем уж унылыми "школьными" эпизодами.

Комедия и драма уже улетели в отбойник. Дайте волю негативным эмоциям и выяснится, что сложность тактических боёв обусловлена "мясом", коим вас заваливает компьютер, а наличие выбора в режиме новеллы никого не спасёт от финального клиффхэнгера. Жаль, что итоговая высокая оценка суть результат полного убожества даже [url=www.dreamloregames.com/cosmos/]коммерческих[/url] конкурентов.

[u][b]Sunrider Frontier[/b][/u]
Быть может, в альтернативной реальности именно [b]Love in Space[/b] заменит почившую в бозе [b]Kojima Productions[/b] в качестве разработчика следующей номерной части "Metal Gear Solid"... Поскольку, к сожалению, в нашей ей однозначно светит судьба "Macross Frontier" - вспышка на пути к забвению.

19206378.review:
This JRPG is a doujin (non-japanese made) which made me skeptical at first, but since it was free i ended up trying it.
I've really enjoyed the game, especially the gameplay. The story seems childish at the start, however precisely ecause of that it really shows how hard things are for the MC (main Character) as you progress through the story. The gameplay could be considered a formality due to how the story is => they included a "visual novel mode" difficulty for those who are only interested in story - impossible to lose and also impossible difficulties for masochists

Story - 7/10 strong first few hours eased my way into the story. Too many cliches throughout the story for my liking tho and a very strong story towards the end. However it is definatly parts 1 and 2 out of 3 in this trilogy. It has set up a really good stage for the 3rd part which could be amazing. honestly the only shortcoming from my point of view was that at times the MC seemed slightly dumb. Though i think it wouldnt bother most people.

Characters 8/10 Some of the characters are carbon copies of what you'd expect, there is a "tsudere-chan" and so on. At first it bothered me, but later on in the story when things got more complicated some brilliant characters made appearances. especially the pirates are executed brilliantly. all in all i have to say the mental arc was exellent thanks for that!

Gameplay 9/10 I loved the gameplay. Partly because i felt nostalgic since it resembled other games i've played. It is a turn-based strategy game which punishes you mercilessly (if you make the difficulty sadistic). Its been a long time since i've had to go all out, planing, save-scumming, researching intelligently, dying repeatedly and so on. Normally doing this too much would turn most people off, to counter this they made the difficulties changable whenever you want => when your fed up you lower it and rofl stomp te baddies. Truly a great game considering its in a VN.

CGs / Music 6/10 honestly i think this is the weakest link in the game. Which makes the VN feel alive. It made it really feel like a small group of people fed their soul into this, rather than their money. as a result the gameplay is amaing the story is solid and the characters have a lot of thought put into them and when the devs are focused on that (IMO more important stuff) the time consuming boring stuff gets neglected. As a result the Visuals are a bit lacking (but a few of the CGs are really nice!). Most painful for me though was the music. A lot of the time it felt like it was a try hard which was a shame. I would love to see the music improved in the next game! (For the Devs: during the last few hours it would have been great to get my heart pounding to the great story and the sound of music, don't be afraid to be extravagent on the music! In other words the highs and lows dont differ enough in the music for my taste)

Over all i can only recommend this game, its not a full blown Visual Novel with all of the oddities that go with them. Therefor it felt like a great game for people new to Visual Novels and a nice change of pace for the veterans. Its Free so try it!

Who's it for: 
poeple who ponder about "what is War? why do we have Wars?"
Young gamers new to Visual Novels
Gamers looking for a challenging Tur-based strategy game

Who's it going to turn off:
people who dislike chlichés
those who think the world is pink
people who go looking for romance (i hope that i can remove this with the release of the 3rd part)

19187759.review:
A+ writing makes Sunrider: First Contact/Mask of Arcadius a GREAT visual novel game that chronicles the first two chapters of your journey as the captain of the starship Sunrider. 

No dating per se, but your choices do influence reactions from the girls. Decision making is more about your path as a captain--this is interstellar war after all--and you are fighting for the lives of billions of people and the freedom of hundreds of planets.

Characters are well drawn, have unique personalities, and are each likeable. Game play is a solid mix of tactical combat and vehicle leveling; voice acting is outstanding; a good soundtrack and sound effects round it out. Advice: enemies become over-powered as the story unfolds, so save your game and save your command points for later battles. 

LoveInSpace creates quality stories that stick with you. 
I am very much looking forward to Sunrider: Liberation Day

19110864.review:
Down to the letter, this was by far the most worthwhile $0.00 I ever spent! it was an incredibly fun joyride, filled with loveable anime characters and awesome giant battle robots! I am a huge fan of anime and stuff, but this was taking it to a whole new level....still, for the sake of this review, I shall maintain enough professionalism to make a Pro-Con bit. ok, here goes.

Pros: 
Amazing ships an' guns an'stuff. LOTSA DAKKA DAKKA!!!!
Realistic-yet-dreamable cast. they all have as much depth and background as you care to look into.
The main protagonist is so relatable, it felt like I was in his position, saying and doing almost everything he did in his place.
The story was very well-done.
It has challenge, which, in my opinion, is a Pro. I enjoy fair tests of my strategic skill.
It has choices, which I adore the ability to fine-tune the path that the story takes.
It is NOT pay-to-win. hell, there IS NO microtransaction system at all! it's JUST a game, no strings attached! 
It's free to play, free to download, and runs well.

Cons:
The animations sucked. the characters and ryders/ships were all 2-d drawings that had limited motion and low depth. to be fair, it doesn't really matter so much, but as a part-time animator, It nags at me.
They tried to over-adulterise certain parts. I don't mind a little bit of spice now and then, especially considering that it's an anime thing, so you kinda expect that, but there is one instance of nudity, as well as a scene on the beach where.....I'll let the imagination do the talking on that one. it's not THAT bad, except for that one instance of unnecessary nudity. 
For some people, this would be a con, but personally I don't mind the limited voice-acting. The fact that they have limited voice acting leaves more for the imagination to do, which is an easily-accomplished boon for me at least.
Almost no sidequests. NEEDS MORE!!!
Needs to be longer. I beat this game after about 12 hrs. still, I have yet to try the high-difficulty levels. I personally would've loved to see a longer story however.
Lil' bit laggy in combat for some reason. doesn't matter, considering that it's a TBS, but still. it could be annoying for some people.

End statement:
I freakin' LOVED this game. I can't wait for them to make the next one in the series. (Also, I'm totally in favour of Claude! <3 ) erm....*ahem* anyways, 'twas a great game, I hope the reader of this review enjoys it as much as I have, and I hope that "Love in Space" finishes the next installment in the series soon!

PS: have a nice day, dear reader. :3


-Anihilatitron-

19107590.review:
Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius is a surprisingly good game (even more so considering the price). It is primarily a visual novel but there are also turn-based battles littered throughout the story, and a bit of resource management thrown in.

The main story is well written and the characters are adequately developed (story-wise). The art is not the worst. There are some morally questionable decisions and I like the fact the "villain" is relatable as well as the protagonist (and his crew), they all have their own reasons for fighting. It kept me hooked right up to the end.

Not much to say about the battles, it takes place on a hex grid and you have to achieve the objective to proceed (destroy all enemy units, last x turns). The music adds to the atmosphere, and the crew members are voiced when they are selected and opening fire, which was a nice touch. However I was more interested in the story and played on the lowest difficulty to quickly win the battle and carry on, I wish there was an option to skip battles entirely.

Since it is free, everyone should give Sunrider a try. It certainly got me eagerly anticipating the sequel Liberation Day.

18965223.review:
Gameplay
The gameplay is okay, but suffers from some glaring problems. There is no way to get more detailed breakdown on the enemy ships that I could find. The shield system seems to be buggy - a unit sitting in the middle of two shields takes about 1/3 the damage, at best, that it should from lasers. The flak system is never explained. It shoots down missles, but it's unclear how exactly this calculation works so you just have to guess if the relatively expensive flak upgrades are worth it. Worse yet, later stages feature units that spam missles at you and your flak gets less effective as it shoots missiles down, and one missle volley can half kill (or worse) your lighter units. 

Balance
The balance needs some serious work in this game. Short-range weapons are largely useless, and this makes Phoenix garbage. The Phoenix has two weapons - Assault, and Melee. Assault and Pulse weapons have horrible accuracy beyond just a couple hexes, and are unable to damage anything with armor, shields, or speed: this is everything in the game. Melee is useless in most situations because being near ANY enemies on their turn means you die. The Phoenix has twice the evasion of any other unit, but even it can't reliably dodge things at its own engagement range. Kinetic has similar accuracy issues - it's almost impossible to hit anything beyond a few hexes, especially fast units - but at least it can do a lot of damage to armored units. Lasers are great until you get to later stages where half the enemy units have shields 1-2 hexes wide. As previously mentioned, overlapping shields are far more effective than math accounts for...for enemies. You do not get the same benefit.  Missiles are great, assuming you can overcome the enemy's flak, but are extremely limited in use so they're not a viable main weapon. Enemies don't suffer from this problem as they seem to carry up to 6 missiles each, and have much higher flak resistance.

Upgrade System
I'm giving this its own category because it's honestly the root of all the issues in the game. You are given extremely limited funds to upgrade your units with no way to get more outside of the 5 side missions (you can only do 4 of them). The upgrades get expensive very quick, and while you can sell upgrades you lose money in the process. Thanks to the strict funding limit and the increasingly inefficient upgrades you are completely shut out of a number of strategies. Turtling isn't viable after the first few stages due to the overwhelming enemy numbers, the prevalence of missiles and high cost of flak upgrades, and certain mission requirements. You can't focus on evasion because it costs more than you can get to get high enough evasion to survive. So you're forced into an offensive strategy where the upgrades are - for the most part - relatively cheap. Missiles aren't an option because you cannot possible get enough of them to win a stage. So you're forced to level Lasers on the two units that get them (Sunrider and Blackjack) and Kinetics on the rest. You'll also have to raise HP on your units eventually.

Sound
The voice acting is actually done quite well, which was a pleasant surprise. The music is nice, but gets repetitive after a while. Overall very impressive for a small developer.

Graphics
The women are pretty, the ships and ryders are well designed, and the backdrops are well done. No complaints here.

Story
The story is a strange beast. It has all the right elements, but it never drew me in and didn't really satisfy. Perhaps it relied too much on tropes, perhaps it's going to work better when it's complete - I can't really say what the issue here is. 

Intimacy & H-Factor
There is a sad lack of intimant scenes in this VN. There are some very cute ones, don't get me wrong, but most of them fall short of satisfying because they're largely explained instead of shown. You almost never get to see the captain - an attractive, relatively fleshed out main character for a VN - interact with any of the crew. It's a huge missed opportunity. As such there is only one H scene in the entire game - a shower scene. The woman in this scene is very pretty but it's a single still frame and feels very out of place. It would almost have been better to not include it.

Overall
It's a good first attempt, but the game needs to deliver on its own promises. This review would have a completely different tone if the promised numerous side missions and lost technology existed in the game, or even if there was a way to engage in random battles to get money for upgrades. A strategy game should allow any strategy one can come up with, not shoehorn you into a single option. One need only look to Super Robot Wars to see how a game like this can work - SRW has limited missions and thus limited income, but it's balanced well enough that there is no useless attack, stat, or unit. Sunrider could learn a thing or two from the SRW series.

18854079.review:
Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius is one of those games where you can definitely feel the love and care that went into its creation. The game's studio, Love In Space, have worked on a few titles all revolving around the same universe (same people different situation) but this is my first taste of their work. I have not finished the game but I can say I am very impressed.

The game is similiar to other hexagonal grid turn-based RPGs but with a visual novel twist. It's not quite a dating simulator and not quite a "choose your own adventure". 

You play as Kayto Shields, recently promoted to command of your very own advanced warship named the Sunrider. The galaxy finds itself at war with the evil space communists and it's up to you, the good guys, to stop their evil plans! ok, so the plot is a lot more complex than that but to avoid spoilers I'll just leave it at that.

The game handles combat in a fairly traditional way. It's not a technical marvel by any stretch of the imagination with effects simply being layered over the image onscreen. What it lacks in flashiness it makes up for in character....characters.... The game takes your standard grid combat system and has you spend action points to move and shoot your enemies to oblivion with certain units having special attack and support abilities. The heart of your strength is the Sunrider itself but you also get a fleet of space mechs that you deploy at the start of every combat into whatever formation you desire. This is where the previously mentioned "character(s)" comes into play. 

On your journey you manage to build up what many familiar with anime and dating sims will immediately recognize as your "space harem". These lovely ladies accompany you on your journey and lend their aid as fighters, medics, support craft, etc, and greatly benefit you when it comes to dealing out the whoopass. Thier personalities range from shy, goofy, stoic, serious, etc. Now while this is probably sounding a lot like a dating sim with some combat sprinkled in I will report, to either your delight or annoyance, that this game does not turn into one big tail chase. There are romances that develope over the course of the story but everything plays forth in a fairly straightforward manner. You do encounter several big decisions to make in your travels but since I have only gone through certain choices I cannot say if they redically alter the story or the crew's feelings for you. 

After combat you receive funds based on the enemies destyroyed and how much damage you have taken. You then spend this currency at your R&R depertment upgrading shields and weapons. You can also stock up on special components and powerful limited-use weapons from a special shop. Overall the system works really well and you really feel a sense of progression as you see your meager fighting force become something to think twice about. Not that the enemy is going to do much second guessing as some stages turn brutal really fast. One moment you're mopping up the floor with enemy fighters and the next they're warping in space carriers and battleships. These guys don't mess around either. Positioning is everything and enemies can quickly overwhelm you. Multiple saves are a must as one bad decision can lead to death fast. Thankfully the game features multiple difficulty levels and you can even play on a mode so easy you just have to go through the motions and victory is assured.

The amount of work that went into this game shows and like I mentioned earlier this really is a labor of love. The game features an opening straight out of a game from Japan (with authentic Japanese vocals from an eroge singer) and very pleasant artwork. The characters are fully voiced during combat and this is really where the character shines through. While the voice acting is decent the lines the characters say during a fight are really charming and reflect the personality types well. Want to hear a quirky anime girl shout, "Imma firing my lazers!!!"? Play Sunrider.

I really have to mention the soundtrack which is very well done. It fits the tone of the game very well and even after multiple battles I still have yet to tire of it. The music that plays when you issue your super laser command especially gets my blood pumping.

To wrap this review up I have to mention the price. If you havne't noticed already the game is FREE. FREEEEE. You really don't even need to read this review. If you think it looks cool from the images and the description sounds cool then download it. The game loads super fast and is easy to pick up and play. 

Before I end I will mention this game is only PART 1. The next part is releasing soon (as far as I know. Check their website) and should be available on Steam. It sounds like you will have to pay for the next game but this first part alone is about 20 hours of gameplay alone so have fun! I enjoyed it so much I downloaded their full-on dating sim spinoff game Sunrider Academy. Definitely a recomendation if you like the characters and want to see them all in a HS setting......and naked......if you're into that sort of thing. Both games have a restoration patch from the Love In Space website to restore censored content (not sure what was cut from Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius since it's pretty tame so far).

18833609.review:
This is a very good game considering that it is free.  For that, we have all of the kickstarter backers to thank for brining this game to life.  Thanks kickstarter backers!  I just sunk 5 hours of my life into the game that I will never get back but I don't regret a minute of it.

Negatives
The games tone is very uneven.  It touches on some very real themes but tries to balance it with some light waifu comedy which didn't really gel for me.  
The difficulty levels weren't very well graded for me.  I started on a higher level and wound it back to visual novel level because it just got way too hard for me.  
The upgrades were a good feature but how they worked weren't so clear to me.  There's a mode where you can test your upgrades but it was a bit too time consuming for me.
Finally, the interface is not so great.  It's difficult to skip some of the cut action scenes, It took me a while to figure out how to undo one of my decisions.

Positives
The story is actually very good.  Some of the characters are more fleshed out than others but overall it's a very good effort.  
The game play is very fun and there wasn't really any down time where you were trying to figure out what to do next.  There was a nice balance of side missions with main plot points.

Overall - I would highly recommend this game if you are into strategy or into anime or a cheapo that doesn't want to buy any games.  It's very fun and I don't think you will regret it! 

Enjoy!
