18721072.review:
Note: I review both Sunrider: First Arrival and Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius as one game.

Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius. I started playing it just for fun and because the user reviews were relatively high (>90% were positive by the time I started playing). Also, it's free so I didnt have anything to lose except some free time. Well, you could say that my expectations were more than fullfilled but that would be understating. The story, while starting a bit slow in my opinion but later on more than compensated for that and much deeper and intense than I would have ever imagined, is – as you might have already foreseen – in my opinion one of the better ones of the games I played and the VN's I read so far.
Now, a review shouldn't just praise the story but also tell you something about the characters that appear in the game. On the first look they were all stereotypical animegirls (you know: the overactive one, the shy one, the perv and so on) and, sadly, some didn't really have a big character development. The other ones had some development, some more, some less. (I won't write here which ones because of reasons).
Some of the negative points are that you have for an example only girls as Ryder pilots or that you never see the rest of the crew. Well, to be honest I didn't really have a problem with that but other people may think different about this. 
Also, it seems that some people had some performance issues running this game. I am no exception, but it was never unplayable. When it lagged I just restarted the game and my problems were gone (did not happen very often).

tl;dr: If you like anime and turn-based tactical combat, then try it. It's free. Also, it has space whales. (No, not really, but it would be great, wouldn't it?)

In short:

Cons:
- only girls as Ryder pilots
- the characters appear to be stereotypical and for some, that doesn't change throughout the game
- some minor performance issues here and there

Pros:
+ deep and later on intense story
+ well outworked universe
+ fancy illustrations
+ nice ship designs
+ it's free
+ space whales

Conclusion: I fully recommend this game to people who like anime (or Visual Novels) and turn-based strategic combat.
P.S: Don't get too fat or else space whales will try to mate with you. Speed > Armor.

18668882.review:
This is s story based Japan anime game with tactical strategy in between. Now for sombody who hate story based games (for example, those made by bioware), I am surprised to see that I actually like the story in this game. I am still trying to figure out why. As for the tactical strategy of the game, it is relatively interesting. Each rider has various kind of weapons and abilities which allow various combinations and strategies.

Now, for the bad side, first the interface, there are numbers so small on the screen that I cannot see them. I plugged my lap top on a television and it became worse, could not even see the hit percentages. The other faling aspect is that it is hard to predict the effectiveness of your attack. They are many different weapons and counter measure, that it's hard to understand and plan ahead their interaction. You can even have situation where a weapon that does 200 points of damage does more than 200 points. So the computations are hard to anticipate, more explanations would have helped. The AI is OK, I just find it very annoying when they target always the same rider, especially the pheonix.

There are a lot of powerup and upgrades, a bit too much, sometimes you can have two way to get the same results. For example, you could increase your rider's energy, but also reduce the energy cost of weapons. Which is 2 ways to do the same thing. As for the story engine, I am surprised how they managed to have a strong story based game with few art, interesting for low budget games. Everything is basically written in the text, sometimes a few additional picture would have helped to know what is going on. Semi manga style drawing would have been cool even if only black and white, but I understand that artwork is expansive. 

There is still 1 quick fix that could be done, show the face of the talking character (above or under the name). It sometimes becomes very confusing who is talking to who. Having a framed picture change after each line of dialog would help, and would not require additional art.

Finally, the game is pretty much linear, in the early game, you had a choice between 3 missions, I would have hoped to get those choices more often in the game. Also the story choices lead to the same results most of the time. I am not asking for something like mass effects, but at least get different results and rewards from your choices.

If you like turn based strategy games and you are a fan of Japanese animation and culture, I strongly recommend this game.

Enjoy and have fun!

18583464.review:
不得不说这个游戏还是比较良心的。虽然画面差了点，但作为免费游戏也没有什么好苛求。希望第三部分的剧情能在前两部分的基础上有所超越。

P.S 关于战斗
1.游戏有个BUG，就是蓝色机的雷射炮能量消耗减到后面会变成负的，无限回能量，需要修正一下。当然游戏不影响，因为不作弊的话不可能有那么多钱给你升到很高的等级。

2.游戏前期可以打出一个能卖10000块的东西，那个是用来换命令点的，果断卖掉，中期会好打的多。不过那一关真的非常难，打之前会询问是否继续前进（这是游戏里唯一一次询问）。第二回合会出来四台3200血，100盾，100扫射，20护甲，50闪避的梦魇，护盾和扫射还是两格的。千万别让他们聚在一起，不然就只能靠地图炮了（当时还没有粉毛的位移技能）。

3.最高难度有几关从理论上就无法通过，实际上到后期也属于自虐。最后第二个难度也不建议尝试，很容易死，三颗核弹直接带走，需要不断SL。推荐默认难度，比较适中。

4.粉毛的技能可以移动敌方机体的位置，配合母舰的地图炮使用，效果拔群。地图炮2500命令点，还不消耗母舰本身的行动点，非常便宜，千万别吝啬。前几回合敌人数量多，一炮五六个很正常。

5.战术部署的时候切记全队往前顶。千万别怂，怂就是死路一条。后期的敌方母舰会不断制造小飞机，输出不够只会越打越多。往前顶可以有效发挥地图炮的效果，明显加速游戏进程。如果你一定要问靠的太前高难度被一轮集火秒掉了怎么办，我也没办法。

6.消灭顺序：首先是看起来比较笨重的机体以及小型舰船。一方面血少容易秒，另一方面这些单位一般自带一发单发高爆高抗扫射的核弹，被炸到非常伤。第二顺位是能加buff的敌机，闪避高，还有450血，最好的办法是母舰地图炮击杀以及狙击手加过buff之后一回合一个，虽然看起来浪费伤害，但绝对划算。

Never really got into a VN before, but it proved to be interesting.  While the same anime types as expected show, they're pretty well-written and if you get into it it reaches the all-important "I care about X" moment.  Unfortunately [spoiler]There's no relationship end, as that was apparently meant for a sequel.  Seriously guys, at least give some kind of notice how we're doing towards the end?[/spoiler].  The story gets serious and pulls about as many punches as a Kubrick film.

Combat was ok, with the standard array of attack types pretty well balanced with each other.  The animations are cool, but long.  After a while it gets old, with a small selection of quotes and animations (Think like how FF VII summon animations started to wear, and you get the idea), but requiring a click to finish the animation regardless keeps you from simply grabbing a drink and waiting it out.  Unless you're playing on the easiest settings it's not a good idea to speed-click through the enemy's turn.

But for all that, it's free, it's generally very involving and interesting, and it's otherwise worth your time.  Get the De-censor patch for added content (Yes, there's story in the patch too).  Save extremely often, as you don't know when big decisions are coming up.

18417930.review:
It's unbelievable that this is a free game. It's extremely well done. It's a mix between a VN and a battle strategy game, and is incredibly enjoyable. The emotional side of it is exceptionally strong, as it deals heavily with themes of philosophy, politics, the horrors of war, etc. The interactions with the heroines are fairly well done, although currently there just aren't enough of those interactions. The game is being added to though, so hopefully we'll be able to progress our relationships with the heroines more as new content is added. 

As far as the strategic battle element of the game is concerned, it's pretty solid, but there are a couple major flaws. Before I played the game, I had seen other reviews warning that anything other than the lowest difficulty (casual) is a nightmare. I didn't quite believe it, but after playing, I can say that the warnings were absolutely true. The first 3-4 battles are okay on some of the difficulty levels, but after that the battles turn into unenjoyable messes that take 3-4 hours to complete, as you have an absurd number of enemy ships flung at you. That's the one really big mistake this game makes. They need to reduce the number of enemy ships by about 50-75 percent and instead make the remaining ones stronger. As it is, fighting wave after wave of high-powered enemies isn't very fun, and battles become more like a chore than entertainment after the first few.

Overall though, I absolutely reccomend this game. In it's current form, it's probably worth at least 10-15 bucks, and as more content is added the value of the game will increase. So the fact that it's currently free is amazing, and if you're at all interested in any of the genres present in this game you should definitely give it a try.

18318075.review:
Just finished Mask of Arcadius.  Dislike it because the text is so small, and often imposed over terrible backgrounds, which make them a pain to read.  You have to manually click to continue through most phases of battle, which makes it pretty ridicious and annoying, especially with the mass amount of units in chapter 2, while the autoskip function is iffy and skips too much.  All those "actions" also eats up the memory and causes the game to crash.   The settings menu is extremely awkward.  Pressing escape enters the menu but doesn't close it.  The only cancel button being the right-mouse-click is not user friendly.  There isn't even any help page or hints to tell you how to do most of these things.  Basically, the game has poor transitions(control wise).

The combat stinks.  It's mildly enjoyable, flooded with lots of annoying.  You're given upgrade options with no idea the way combat will turn out and what new units you're going to get.  For example, if you were to upgrade lasers, they make the game a little easier early game and have potential in mid game, but you will struggle immensely in late game because every battle is shield paradise.  The reason I even upgraded lasers in the first place was because the early game was so misleading, I thought that it'd be really difficult to get into range and actually hit things without getting destroyed.  Furthermore, you lose more cash the worse the battle becomes, so you just enter a sink hole.  And the only way to avoid this is to play through the game at least once and know what to expect.  #$lla stupid.  The game is VERY misleading with the huge pricetags on future upgrade prices, which lead you to believe that you will eventually have lots of cash to be able to afford at least a few of those mark 13+.  You can't.  In fact, you earn very little cash, which makes the choices for a new player even more difficult than they ought to be.

The very small voicesets of the characters also makes it really, really annoying when they repeat the same line over and over while attacking or being attacked by enemies.

Navigation inside of the ship is also pretty bad.  There is a useless star map that is just there to look good, and to do the rare side quests that will appear at very specific instances, and that you may possibly miss if you're not paying attention.  Progressing through the story revolves around you chatting with people until you've found the option that lets you move foward.  And then you have to look for the play button that will pop-up in any of the locations.  When I first started, this took me 20 minutes to find because I missed a dialogue option with Asaga.  It's a neat method of progression, but this game needs to HINT more on where to go next.  Actually, I'd rather there's just a single menu with the main and side missions so I don't have to deal with this dumb and useless looking around and chance of missing things.

The story is nice, and I know there must be different endings in the very last chapter, but there's needs to be IMPACT on THE chapter you're playing on between choices instead of just 2 different dialogues.  I'm hoping that since this is beta, that that's subject to change.

18273844.review:
Una visual novel futurista que incluye combate estrategico de naves espaciales. Además no está hecha por desarrolladores japoneses.

Ya de por si todo esto hace que suene interesante pero la analizaré más a fondo.
Esta VN trata una historia bastante compleja, aunque en si parezca sencilla, al fin y al cabo es una guerra y las desgracias consecuentes de ello, pero es al verlo desde el punto de vista de cada uno de los personajes (protagonistas y antagonistas) que gana más complicación el asunto.

Por la parte de visual novel el juego es genial. Los personajes son interesantes y bastante distintos entre unos y otros. Por supuesto como es tipico, y casi mandatorio; el único hombre es el protagonista, si no tenemos en cuenta a los antagonistas. Se trata obviamente de una visual novel de amor con su buena parte de harem, aunque no está tan cargada de fanservice como lo pueden estar (eso si, estad preparados para monos ajustados y algun que otro desnudo). La historia nos dará la opción de elegir muy a menudo, algunas de estas decisiones pueden significar la vida y la muerte para algunas personas, así que avanzad con pies de plomo si decidís jugarla. Uno de los mejores puntos en mi opinión es lo mucho que puedes cambiar el desarrollo de la historia, aunque esta no parezca tener todavía un final. Por ejemplo una decisión en concreto (no mencionare cual para no hacer spoiler) puede suponer la diferencia entre enfrentarnos a un sencillo combate de huida, o una complicada y demasiado dificil batalla de escolta.
Por supuesto tratandose de una VN y siendo el amor una pieza central, nuestras decisiones afectarán a como nos relacionamos con nuestras protagonistas.

Ahora vamos con el sistema de combate.
Aqui es donde el juego patina un poco. El sistema de combate consiste en una maya hexagonal en que veremos a nuestras unidades y las enemigas. El desarrollo consiste en dar ordenes a nuestras unidades, que estarán limitadas por la energía de la que disponen en cada turno, y lo mismo para el enemigo. El metodo no es especialmente innovador pero no es ese su problema. El problema es que carece de animaciones en general y la mayoría de las veces veremos a las naves inmobiles abriendo fuego a base de efectos especiales, por no mencionar la "animación" del ataque cuerpo a cuerpo de los mechas.
Por otra parte sería injusto dar una mala calificación por esto, ya que ante todo, Sunrider; es una Visual Novel, y el modo de combate nos sirve para relajarnos un poco de la lectura continua haciendola más llevadera para aquellas personas que no pueden pasarse la tarde leyendo sin descanso.
Tambien he de decir a su favor que las batallas son tremendamente dificiles y todas ellas suponen un gran reto, especialmente al principio del juego cuando apenas tenemos mechas o mejoras en la nave. Afortunadamente el juego incluye una dificultad que hace el combate imposible de perder y te da la opcion de cambiar a ella en cualquier momento, incluso durante el mismo. Tambien incluye un modo de dificultad máxima que no recomiendo jugar bajo ningún concepto, y si lo haces, grábalo.

En conclusión:
Recomiendo este juego, sobretodo para aquellas personas que disfruten leyendo y les guste la ciencia ficción, las historias de amor y los mechas. El juego tiene un humor relajado con algunos momentos de tensión y una buena parte de desafio mental si tenemos en cuenta las batallas dificiles.

Como nota adicional, el juego es gratuito. Esta disponible solo en inglés.
Este analisis ha sido escrito durante su segundo capitulo (Mask of Arcadius) pero a los que no lo sepan el juego esta incompleto pero sus desarrolladores ya están trabajando en su ultimo capitulo y este será descargado automaticamente en cuanto sea lanzado, igual que ocurrió con el segundo.

Without much expectation this was a surprisingly good game.

Pros
- Free Game!
- Weapon/system upgrading is compelling
- Hard moral choices
- Combat is surprisingly complex for a simple game
- Main characters are interesting
- Good use of story telling with clever use of the simple effects available

Cons
- Repedative sound bites and animations in combat
- Skip mode in combat needs map overlays
- A few crashes when skipping animations and saving/loading to fast
- Very limited customizations (you are limited to upgrading what you start with, no other choices)
- Minor balance issues
- No real variance in map types (basically just kill everything every time)
- Anmiation transition skipping is very choppy

But because the game is free and fun, it's easy to see past these issues.  Overall a good experience.

18120483.review:
Eine gelungene Mischung aus Robotech, Anime und Rundenbasierender Strategie. Die Story fesselt und man möchte definitiv Wissen wie es weiter geht. Die Grafik ist Zweckmäßig, aber absolut passend für dieses Spiel, welches man schon fast als interaktives, animiertes Buch sehen kann. 


+ Eine sehr gut inszinierte und packende Story
+ Entscheidungsfreiheit
+ Rundenbasiertes Kampfsystem mit Fähigkeiten
+ zum Teil herrlich abgedrehte Charaktere die unterschiedlicher nicht sein könnten
+ ein leicht zu erlernendes Kampfsystem mit Spezialfähigkeiten
+ Titten (ja, Titten)
+ Hohe Spielzeit (Stand 18.09.2015: c.a. 12 Stunden für einen Durchgang auf dem niedrigsten Schwierigkeitsgrad)
+ Läuft auf jedem besseren Taschenrechner
+ Upgradesystem
+ Guter und passender Soundtrack


- Für Frauen wohl eher uninteressant
- Die Grafik wird nicht jedem gefallen (da zähle ich mich NICHT mit zu)
- Die Ökonomie ist nicht wirklich gut gebalanced (Anfangs sind die Upgrades günstig, später VIEL zu teuer)
- Cheaten mit Artmoney nicht möglich
- Keine vertonte Story, nur die Kämpfe

Fazit: 

Ich persönlich mag dieses Spiel, und freue mich schon wie ein Schneekönig auf die nächste Episode. Schade nur das die Story nicht vertont ist, aber es ist schon wahnsinn was die Entwickler mit etwas mehr als 40000$ Budget auf die Beine gestellt haben. 
Wer auf Robotech, Anime, SciFi und der Momentan (leider) scheintoten Rundenstrategie steht bekommt mit Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius einen wunderschönen interaktiven Roman serviert.  
Von mir eine Klare Kaufempfehlung 9/10

In short:

Pros:
+ free
+ moderately complex tactical hex game
+ charming presentation
+ some interesting characters
+ some good dialog
+ choices aren't black and white

Cons:
- creatively bankrupt writing and design - pretty much everything is either a direct ripoff from popular anime and sf games, or a manifest cliché
- forced melodrama (the children, won't anyone think of the children?)
- choices don't seem to have much effect
- poor balancing: usefulness of some weapons changes drastically towards the end of the game and respeccing is unfeasibly punishing
- widely RNG-based

Fazit: On paper it sounds like a bad game, but they really win most of the lost points back on presentation. 
For a free game, it's actually pretty amazing and I can definitely recommend it. 
Chigara a best.

17636488.review:
Excellent game. I thought it was going to be silly waifu simulator #43576, but I figured it's free and has giant robots, so why not. 

This game is amazing. The graphics and animation seem underwhelming at first, but that's quickly made up for by the interesting characters and fantastic, surprisingly dark story. This game is a fusion of a visual novel and a strategy game, and it does well in both aspects; the combat is actually pretty difficult and it feels like every choice you make could change the fate of the galaxy. 

The story starts off with you, Kayto Shields, being assigned to your new ship, the flashy, state-of-the-art battleship called Sunrider. Before you even get to test the damn thing, PACT, effectively the main enemy faction of the story, attacks your homeworld and forces the brand-new, green ship to flee while your homeworld gets  conquered. From there, you set off on your journey as a lone ship, getting revenge on PACT and slowly gaining new teamates along the way. 

It's the classic Earth Federation vs. Principality of Zeon story, but it's done extremely well. 

Also, Sola is the best girl. 

Overall, 11/10. Has robots, strategy, anime girls, comedy, a great story, and above all, it's FREE so you have no reason not to try it out.

17543273.review:
Call it: Battlestar Galactica with Manga Harem

I recommend it primarily based on price (it was free to me), and because it's a moderately interesting attempt to combine two different genres. If I had to pay any more than 5 bucks, it would be a thumbs down.

If Captain Kirk (even better, Captain Adama!) was a 14-year old manga fan with an anime sexual fetish, then this game would be one of his dreams. 

If you are easily stimulated by stereotypical anime women and a fan of teen romance stories, this is for you. 

If you're a Women's Studies major looking for ammunition for your seminar paper on the ways that video games portray women, then this game is for you. You could probably get a dissertation out of the outfits alone.

If you're not one of these three types of people, you may find it all a little tedious.

The overall premise is very promising: assemble a ragtag bunch of pilots with very different personalities, deal with complex personnel issues on board your ship, navigate some complicated interstellar politics, and complete various military missions as an underdog trying to find his way home. I would be very willing to pay good money for just such a game if it improved on this one.

I found myself rapidly clicking through dialogue as fast as I could to get to something interesting, namely space battles or command decisions. The interpersonal machinations of junior high school girls did not hold my interest, no matter how much the game (un)dresses them up in pseudo-porn situations. The dialogue is frequently like dialogue from a low-budget porn movie, without any of the...um...potentially redeeming features of porn. I have no problem with a game incorporating sexually suggestive elements. I just prefer those elements weren't so clumsy or juvenile. Pornlike dialogue, without fully explicit features, is just the worst of two worlds.

As for the tactical space battle parts, I didn't mind the turn-based, hex-based format. Others may find it somewhat clunky and repetitive, but I'm from the olden days of cardboard chits on cardboard maps, so hex-based turn-based combat is a little refreshing in a way. Just don't expect extremely sophisticated tactical decision-making.

I admit I'm not very familiar with the Japanese aesthetic in video games, nor with visual novel types. I can only imagine there are better versions of both out there, and most certainly better combinations out there.

17529507.review:
A pretty enjoyable game!

In particular, I was pleasantly surprised by the tactical strategy gameplay, which, at times, was brutally difficult. One of the battles took me roughly 3 or 4 tries (several hours) to beat, but for those who aren't as masochistic or more interested in the story, the game does offer a wide range of difficulty levels.

The story itself has some good, some bad. I was less than impressed by the harem/waifu conceit of the game (the only male character on the Sunrider is the captain), but the game is by no means an eroge. The nudity & fan-service is minimal and the one sex scene is tastefully done. In fact, the real strength of the story is its frank depiction of war. Most of your decisions in the game will be between what is necessary for victory and what would, in other circumstances, be obviously morally incorrect. A good phrase for this conundrum would be "logical insanity": is it worth destroying a billion innocent civilians if that is the only way to ensure victory and thereby (likely) spare so many more billions of lives? You decide.

Best of all - it's FREE. Or at least the first two parts are. The conclusion - currently being created - is not, but if the premise sounds interesting and you like Visual Novels, you should definitely give it a whirl.

17397825.review:
(This is a combined review for both Sunrider: First Arrival and Mask of Arcadius.)

From my experience, Sunrider is an amazing visual novel/strategy game with an immersive, emotional story, world, and characters. The gameplay is a lovely grid-based strategy format, with a command points system for special attacks and abilities as well as a decent variety of special abilities and weapons per unit. Additionally, each unit can be upgraded quite a bit through the Sunrider's R&D section. On the standard difficulty, the combat isn't too difficult once you grasp the concepts of the game, however, there is a mode to essentially make each battle impossible to lose if you just want to experience the story.

On that note, the story is where this game truly shines. It has all the corny, cheesy scenes you might expect from a typical slice-of-life visual novel or anime, while doing so in such a way that it doesn't ruin the atmosphere that the game builds. Alongside those, there are rather intense, dramatic scenes and character development that serve only to add to the Sunrider experience. While there are no defined routes in this game (Only a positive/negative karma system depending on how much you care about your crew), the story and subtle romance vibes are still incredible. The voice acting is also amazingly good considering the size of the company that made Sunrider.

Most of the music, although well-planned and suitable for each scene, is standard royalty-free music you will likely have heard somewhere else. (One notable example being a royalty-free track used as the one of the space themes in Kerbal Space Program.) The next game is expected to have a completely original soundtrack.

Did I mention that Sunrider: First Arrival and Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius are both free? I would highly recommend this game/visual novel to anybody that enjoys both a good visual novel and strategy game.

As a side note, the next title in the core Sunrider series is now available on Steam; Sunrider: Liberation Day.

17384556.review:
At first glance, Sunrider looks a lot like your average Waifu simulator in space.

Please, PLEASE find it in yourself to look past that first glance and take a closer look. You'll be glad you did. Coming from someone who is completely ambivalent towards the waifu aspect of the game, I have found this to be one of the most inspiring gaming experiences of recent months. 

You play as Captain Kayto Shields, first-time commander of the newest, most hi-tech Assault Carrier in the Cera Space Force, the Sunrider. Unfortunately, disaster strikes and your home planet is overthrown by an evil expansive space empire known as PACT, casting you and your crew into the middle of a Galactic Civil War! Beginning with just your own ship to command, your hangar bay will fill gradually with mechs known as 'Ryders', whose female pilots you will meet at regular intervals as you journey to liberate your homeland from these foreign invaders!

Now... given that this game is free, you get a lot for your money. The combat system is very concise, straight-forward and user-friendly. Each ship and ryder in your fleet will have different abilities and be stronger against certain enemies than others. There are also RPG aspects as you can pay to upgrade the stats of both the Sunrider and any Ryders in her compliment, while black market traders offer you various bonus upgrades like high-end boosters or ammunition upgrades for your cannons. In addition to the gameplay being top notch, there is an interesting and exciting overarching plot which, while occassionally bogged down with things like bikini parties on the beach (because muh fanservice), is often driven by a very strong cast of both main and supporting characters facing the very serious moral and ethical dilemmas of war and intergalactic politics.

The downsides are few. The game tends to lag a bit in combat, which is annoying but not to the point of unplayability. Also if you are incredibly averse to either animé or the concept of waifu harem games, this very may well not be the game for you. But if you can look past it's faults, Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius will probably be one of the best free games you ever play.

This review will be mainly comparing the game with its spin-off Sunrider Academy. I first bought that game and noticed all the in-game references to this game (but also missed a lot). Anyway, I got interested and downloaded. This game is so good that it wiped out my disappointment with Sunrider Academy. I even didn’t pay full price for that one. But if it pays the salary of the devs so they can make games like this, I totally can live with it.
The characters were clearly made for this novel. They  felt out of place in Academy. I think that’s because  in Academy they are children who act like adults and here they are adults who (sometimes) act like children. That also explains why they are funny from the start where in academy they could be annoying (Chigara’s bakery, Ava’s uptightness though well explained, Sola’s solitude) You also should check out in the bonus the reaction of the ladies to the polls. Very funny 
The main choice in the game is a classic big one. Does the goal justify the means. Kudos for not making it an easy one. It kept me pondering for a while over some what ifs in history (20th century of course).
The battle parts are challenging and not in my mind repetitive like the managing in Academy (Although I accepted that as part of the high school experience).
Now I’m hooked and I even haven’t finished the game once.

17095565.review:
As a person not expecting much out of the game, I was surprisingly captivated by what it contained. Though, I'm not sure how much I plan to play in the future, it is an interesting game. The game as a whole has definitely flaws and short comings, but it's not Triple A title. 

As you play the commander of a ship, you make decisions on how to battle in a 2D strategy arena against various other characters. they range from a mysterious warmongering group, another warmongering pirate group,  and yet some more warmongers. The good kind though. As you defeat your enemies you get better stats to boost your ships power in future battle.

However, being the visual novel-esque game that it is, you play a the cliche man figure, with no face and a liking to the mainly female crew that accompany you. Though, one can only say what could happen later in the game because I never made it that far. I assume you get into a relationship, but nothing to close to a full Japanese adult visual novel...Hentai game if you will (even though it isn't even close to being Japanese). While doing "research", however, I found that this game does in fact have two who do the tango under (or I guess without) the sheets. It seems that my initial inclination is wrong. So if your in to all of the super eroge kind of thing, then by all means. If your not one of those people, I think you can skip it if you really want to play this.

Now it gets in to all of the flow chart stuff, and the who do you want, do this and this and this. Which is some of the fun of the game. Hardcore visual novelist might really enjoy this game, but the people unfamiliar get ready to be overwhelmed by choice. Strangely, it doesn't seem that overwhelming, or have you wait three hours to choose once (thanks Fate/Stay Night!). Between the battles it focuses on the crew (the girls) rather than the war impending right outside the ship. It's a balance to have both the choosing and the strategy aspect int he game. It's a bit much. It is pretty stark the difference in the moods of either side, breaking the game into part...which is never a good thing. Unless your in the mood to do battle or in the mood...well, which do you prefer in continuum to the story. A good hentai romance seems trite when you take away from the hentai romance mood/part of the story.

All in all, it's a game I liked, but can on good conscience give the game to much credit. If your looking for an hour or two to kill, try checking this game out, otherwise, you can just past it up since it's free and pretty low budget. Give it a try if your on the fence, it's pretty decent. Although, the 18+ crowd only.

16958243.review:
I'll focus my review on gameplay and story because I believe by now everyone know that it's free.

Don't look at my hours played, I played it off steam and just finished it in the highest difficulty (space whale), it took me a little more than 50 hours to finish it.

I'll start by the negative, that's what made me drop the game when it was released.

[h1] Negative points [/h1]

[list]
    [*]First the game is laggy, the visual novel phases are working fine but when you're in battle it's a total mess, menus sometimes take a while to appear, there's a short freeze every time you try to do something, oh and DON'T try to cancel attack animations or it's all over. It's also quite buggy (loading while in battle sometimes crash the game and I once lost the save I was loading upon a crash)
    [*]Second the menu aren't really intuitive (you can't close it by pressing "Escape" !) and they're sometimes laggy as well.
    [*]Third, I won't blame the game for this because it is free but I'll still mention that the dialogs aren't voiced at all, which was really hard on me
[/list]

Okay with this done, let's see why I still think that it is a good game.

[h1] Positive points [/h1]

[list]
    [*]Let's start with the story ([b] I won't spoil anything here [/b]), it might seem a bit cliché and there are some part I disliked because of that, but overall this is rather well written, funny at times, serious at times, sometimes sad and touching and hell even heroic at times, there's definitely a "Japanese touch" (or whatever you call this) to it too
    [*]About the characters and their development now, you'll have plenty of occasions to talk to them and I must admit that the character cast is quite likeable, it's rare for me to not have some characters I dislike in a visual novel. 

At first the characters seem quite simple but you'll learn more about them by playing and in my opinion they're all quite interesting, have their secrets, had their hardships and all have their reasons to help you fight the PACT. (The protagonist is also totally amazing, Kayto forever)
    [*]Music is a really important point for me and it's totally good in Sunrider, which helped me holding against the fact that the dialogs weren't voiced.
    [*]Art might seem a little cheap during the first hours but then I became used to it and ended up liking it actually, sure it's not like all these Japanese visual novels but again the game is free.
    [*]And I'll end by something I really enjoyed, the fights (not even the lags and bugs stopped me from enjoying it !). I'm a big fan of tactical RPG and played an awful lot of them and still I found the fighting in this game really interesting, I played in the highest difficulty and had to die and retry TONS of times (and I have around 2000 saves too). 

You'll see how it is by yourself if you play the game, I'll just describe what I found really great. 

There's a lot of customization, you can upgrade tons of things on your different ships but everything cost money and you have only very little of it, just as I like it you'll need to carefully examine this and choose precisely how to upgrade your ships, you won't be able to upgrade everything at all and there's even a shop when you can buy one-time use items that might save your ass but costs money too ... So you better spend it well !

Then there's the fact that the gameplay is continually becoming deeper, for a good part of the game every three fights or so you'll unlock something that will make you change your strategy and things will keep getting spicy with more powerful enemies and worst situations every time.

Finally I think that the difficulty is very well balanced, there are multiple levels of difficulty that will allow you to only play for the story or to also play for the fights (or you could even select this "Space whale" difficulty that will please all M guys like me that enjoys to suffer eternally).
[/list]

Of course I’ll advise you to play for the fights too with the captain or hard difficulty since the fighting is great and a huge part of the plot revolve about you being a captain and thus leading fights … ([b]and man that feeling when you beat the shit out of them ![/b])

I'll also confirm that the "Space whale" difficulty is beatable without cheating (because it is said that it wasn't tested by the dev when you select it)

Lastly, I can't really comment on the length of the game since I spent 95% of my time reloading saves to hit that ship with 5% percent chance ...

16857216.review:
* Note: This game includes both episode 1 (First Arrival) and episode 2 (Mask of Arcadius) and both episodes are free to play. This review is for both episodes. *

Most visual novels are either novel in a visual form (usually with voice acting) or present very basic player interaction (such as games developed by Telltale, and Dontnod's "Life is Strange"). Sunrider, while a visual novel, is also a game.

Many people who recommended this game to me have called Sunrider the Dark Souls of turn-based strategy games and they are absolutely right. Simple missteps in combat could cost you the battle and forcing you to return to a previous save point. The traditional leveling progression is replaced with a stat management system for all of your characters outside of battle. Unfortunately, you have limited resources to upgrade your characters, forcing you to make tough, long-term decisions on how you wish to build your party.

Sunrider's story and characters are definitely the highlight of this game. The universe is well developed and leaves enough areas for growth in future installments. Battles that our characters engage have an effect on the universe and every death feels heavy. Love in Space tries to avoid most character tropes that plague anime and JRPGs and for the most part succeeds; giving each character a personality and having them develop over the course of the game. There are a few cliché moments, but those are by far in the minority.

Sunrider is everything you want in a visual novel: likable characters, a believable setting, and a plot that you just can't get enough of. Sunrider is a Kickstater done right.


My summary of Episode One: First Arrival and Episode Two: Mask of Arcadius:
Pros:
- A well-developed universe with lots of potential for growth in future installments
- A captivating story filled with political intrigue
- Decisions that have you question whether you made the right choice (though not leading to a branching narrative, though this may change in Sunrider's sequel/next episode)
- Likeable characters
- A relatable protagonist (VERY RARE FOR A VISUAL NOVEL!!)
- Complex stat management
- Fun tactical turn-based combat
- A decent soundtrack
- Good artwork, character models, and CGI backgrounds
- Dialogue and decisions can be rewinded using the mouse wheel (no need for multiple saves to see what consequences your choices will have)
- FREE :D

Cons:
- Anything higher than "Easy Mode Difficulty" is extremely difficult
- Difficulty scales by having the AI throwing more enemy units on the field rather than introducing greater enemy variety
- Game would have benefited from having a voice cast as characters in this game are also present throughout the Sunrider universe (which includes Sunrider Academy and the upcoming Sunrider Liberation Day)
- One very frustrating escort mission that occurs mid-way through the first episode

Well, i was all ready to cry "anime bullshit!" and delete this game but surprisingly, the combat really isn't bad. back to the combat, there's a good variety of weapons with different strengths and weaknesses (which you WILL need to note to kill your enemies) there's a nice upgrade system, and most importantly there's spaceships with huge cannons, lasers and missiles, with space-mechs for supporting fire.

16254352.review:
80% strategy, 20% 'visual novel' (hardly any big choices in the novel part.)

Beat the game in under 15 hours on "Captain" difficulty.

Lots and lots of reloads required. 

The mechanics in this game are unbalanced. You get four types of attacks. Kinetics (low accuracy high damage), Lasers (medium accuracy medium damage), Missiles (high accuracy medium-low damage, extremely limited), and melee (generally suicidal)

For defense you get Armor, which does a flat subtract of damage from attacks, and shields which lower damage done by laser weapons only. You also get Flak that destroys a % of incoming missles that pass through surrounding hexes of the unit.

Lasers are fucking worthless in this game. Half the units are designed to use lasers as primary weapons. They are never good. Shields literally make Lasers (and their pulse laser cousins) useless as nearly every fight in the game enemies have several units that clump together and generate AOE shields easily stacking above 100% damage prevention. Early on before you can upgrade units and face units with shields they help you get some hits in.

Missles are also mostly useless. Occasionally you can use them to snipe reinforcements that do not come with the main pack, provided you use support units to disable flak. Occasionally you can use them to kill enemies that are super weak. Ammo is extremely limited per unit and missles never severely damage high armored targets.

Mech units get melee and they can only melee other mechs. Melee leaves your units open to attacks of opportunity on approach and leaves your extremely weak melee units all alone on the front lines ready to be gibbed by the much more powerful enemies at close range. There is a unit designed around melee. They are mostly useless.

Kinetics start off weak due to low accuracy but quickly become the only real weapons one can use to kill the huge clumps of enemies. They bypass shields and lower armor with each hit. There are machine-gun like weapons that nearly all units get that are great at finishing units weakened by kinetics.

I would have loved an aoe Shield dampening skill, or some way to make lasers penetrate shields (and maybe ignore armor?) Sucks having all of these weapon types and having to ignore one entire category because everybody has immunity to that one type- which isn't even the highest damage weapon anyway.


Despite the balance gripes I have about the game... it's fun. I got into and enjoyed the story. I can't wait to see how the sequel finishes the story.

After all, it is pretty good for a free game.

About the tactic part, I chose the normal mode. I found that the difficulties of the game sometimes suddenly raised. Sometimes I can win a bunch of battles at a time, but sometimes I get stuck in one battle for more than 20 times...I think the reason is that the upgrade system for the ship is a little bit complicated for me, which could explain the sudden rise of difficulties: since my battle tactics are not bad, the mistake should be the upgrading part. It leads to the enlargement of differences between the expectation of the game and my real level of power. 

In addition, there are also some bugs in battle that the risk of misopperation would raise dramatically while one clicks in a fast speed.


SUM:

good
-moe girls
-good background setting
-not bad a story
-good battle system

bad
-no multiple endings (which is heart-breaking for gal fans
-sudden rise of difficulties
-bugs of misopperation

RANK: 6.5/10

I am looking forward for the next episode. It is said that it would have multiple endings. If that is true, I would +1 for any price udder $15.

============================================

总体来说，作为免费游戏，质量已经相当可喜。

剧情虽然没有大作的水准，可能还有些老套，但是也不会让人感觉无聊。背景设定脑洞够大，妹子们的设定都不错，刻画也还可以。这些都让平凡的剧情突然吸引人了。

战略方面我选的普通难度，感觉难度会忽然增加，有时候能连破几关，然后会突然卡在某一关上，重读20遍都过不了...可能是由于强化系统做得太过复杂的原因，这也能解释为什么难度会突然提升：我认为我临场的战术没有问题，应该是加点错误导致游戏预测和我真实的水平突然拉开距离。

另外就是有一些小bug，主要是战斗时在点击速度太快的情况下很容易出现误操作（套buff结果变成了跑路什么的）。


总结：

优点
-萌妹子
-优质背景设定
-过得去的剧情
-优质的战斗系统

缺点
-没有分支剧情（不能推妹的战棋不是好gal
-陡然增加的难度
-偶尔出现的bug

评分：6.5/10

期待下一作，据说可以推妹了，如果是真的，在15刀以内都会考虑入手。

16110692.review:
TL;DR for those who don't want to read. 6.4/10 Good game for being free. Would piss you off to pay for it.
After playing through this game I can say one thing. It is definitely very challenging. I found myself reducing the difficulty a few times because of constantly being run up against the issue of not connecting hits. So as far as combat I would have to give it a 6.5/10
As for story line I am going to have to break this up into two parts: dialogue and plot.
The dialogue can be interesting and funny but doesn't feel quite as fulfilling as it may. If anything it reminds me of a Bioware system of dialogue. Two options, neither one are particularly good. Really it was surprisingly weak given that this is half of the game. (half being a generous given that they don't provide much dialogue to begin with) this is basically a tactics game with some side plot you can partially control. I would have to give it a 4/10
The plot, on the other hand, is fundamentally solid. Characters are given decent backstory and there is ample room for growth as far as mystery goes. They find ways to just brush the idea of reality and control over time without making any statements directly on what they plan on doing with it. The only thing that bugged me was how the main protagonist basically goes from doing just fine to suddenly needing to drink and cry because feelings. Overall plot is about 8/10
Animation is rudimentary. Clearly indie because of constant reuse of certain poses and animations and the lack of variety in movement but I won't hold it against them. Having tried to do so myself it can be a downright pain. So I won't give a rating.
Voice acting is the same way. Only used for certain lines in combat and nowhere else, which is dissapointing but also understandable. 7.5/10
Music is okay. Not great, nothing I'd listen to for when I need to concentrate but not offensive or annoying. 6/10

16102371.review:
I picked this up mainly because I love a decent strategy game and you can't beat a price of free. So much clicking though, I feel like I haven't clicked so much since Cookie Clicker was popular. I was prepared to click through all the dialouge. That made sense and is pretty common. What I wasn't prepared for was the battles.

Want to know the status of your units you are going to have to click on it, no  hover tooltips for you.
Want to know what an atack does sometimes you have to right click to get those description to pop up.
Time to attack an enemy better click you unit, click the enemy , click to scroll through the attack animation, click through the damage animation, and finally click again to dismiss the damage window. It is the same with the eneies turn you cna't just sit back and watfch what they do. Everytime they attack you need to click through attack, damage and dismissal animations. Got five enemies which, is pretty common, thats 15 clicks just to get back to your turn.
Oh and be careful you don't click too much because it can autimatically select a new unit and clicking can move them without any way to undo the action.

Honestly it doesn't seem like it should be much worse then a normal tactics game but honestly every time I trie to open up this game all the clicking drives me nuts. There is a skip button that pops up but no mention of how to exit skip mode which skipnot only the dialgoue but the damage displayed when attacking so the only way to know what happened during an enemy turn is with a history box which if toggled on takes up halft the screen. Opening the main menu to save, or toggle the history log, is oddly enough the one action that is not acomplished by clicking, being the only action to use the keyboard.

Overall it seems like it should be a nice game but it is full of little annoying usability flaws that make playing the game feel awful to play.

16071417.review:
After just an hour of gameplay I'm forced to wonder why this game is free.
Sure it doesn't have flashy animations or "includes lap dance" but it’s great, a real find.

Sunrider has both a Visual Novel and strategy aspect which are seamless (they flow into one another).
I play a lot of visual novels and most of the time its just a click and read-fest, I decide if they were good by their story alone but Sunrider breaks up the monotony by giving us the ability to control ships and Mechs in battle, anime style.

The story so far is great, it makes me feel like this is my problem, that I am involved and if I don't do something then something bad is going to happen. I'm sort of a sucker for stories that throw you into a bad situation that you have to crawl out of.

The drawing design of the characters is something that is been growing on me (it’s not my favorite but it’s not bad ether). The actual essence of the characters is great. They have a variety of interesting backstories and how they meet you as the main character and very different personalities.  
Talking about music in games isn’t my strong suit because 90% of the time I mute the music but I’d have to say that it’s not too bad in Sunrider. The score chose is pretty on spot with epic battle music when your facing danger and soft mellow when you’re in your capt’n quarters

This game does have its dips though but really its just nit-pick stuff like:
Over used battle dialogue, honestly there is only so many times I would want to hear “Haul is still holding” or “Here I go” before I want to choke a bitch but then I remind myself “at least they say something”. Honestly that’s the only bad thing I have to say about it. Of course because of its type it’s not going to be for everyone, its scope is no doubt Anime lovers and armchair starship captains. I can’t tell you how many times I’ve yelled “fire trinities” at my computer. 

All in All 10/10 will fire main vanguard cannons again.

16030710.review:
I really wanted to like this game. Robots, TBS, Galactic politics? what's not to like, right?

Well, you'd be wrong.

This game falls flat on every point.

The story is bland, the gameplay is poorly balanced, and it leads to a frustrating conclusion that your wasting your time.

On the subject of the story, You have your home planet attacked by rampaging space stalin trying to take over the universe.

Rampaging space stalin is given less characterization then most extras, and can simply be "that guy in the funny mask." All the main characters co-stars are pretty obviously cliches to the point I knew each ones character and twists just by seeing how they were encountered. The game really lacks surprise to it's twists, and it's design feels... shoddy. 

Many of the models look like they weren't rendered as metallic surfaces, making it look like a future of plastic toys. Actually, all models, sans the actual characters, who are oddly enough, stylized anime style characters, are rendered poorly. It detracts from the overall experience in a somewhat dated way, making the game seem like it's from far in the past. I feel that personally, the aesthetic would of been better if they had utilized a more stylized look as opposed to a half-assed realistic approach.

On the mechanics: The game is balanced around being able to do different types of damage, and different viability. However, this is pretty much worthless, as all but your first two units are cripplingly overspecialized, to the point of being only useful in certain, specific roles. Furthermore, the game not only hampers you by forcing you to use these silly, overspecialized vehicles, but it also pits you against rediculously one sided match ups that are more frustrating then fun, only playable at all via abuse of tactics the AI is too stupid to counter. Your ships move frustratingly slowly across the map, and on many of them, reinforcements continually spill in, usually from the side your trying to go to. Since your movement points are the same as your action points, this can get into a situation where your not able to move forward or else you'll die, but you can't destroy the enemy, because then they'd just keep spawning in.

And on the subject of processor power, this game is kludgy, and will eat 3 gigs of ram easy.

As for Plus and cons:
- one of the greates plus is autosave - which is realy often so even thou the game crashes from time to time - especialy in very long combats I never had to redo the entire turn. Or if you make fatal mistake in placing of your units etc... you can get back quite easily.
-Combat is fun. Fair Rock-paper-sizzors system (Rock being Big *** battleships vulnerable to big guns, Paper being frigates with low armor but fairly high dmg, and Sizzors being mechs with high evasion but relatievly low dmg - but if you soften enemy armor with some heavy hitts they can be realy bad*** :-)
-Story line is cool for the first time, for replayability there is skip option which helps reduce the game time from 12-14 hours to just 4-5
-Upgrades system one of the best I'v seen in Rpg tactical combat game. 
-Skirmish - you can try your fleet agains enemy of your choise.

Cons:
-relatievely long turns and animations - I would prefere if you can entirely disable em (was fun for 20 shots - not after that and pressing/holding space like crazy just to skip that - I'd like to have option to disable it completly.
-qotes of heroes - some of em are realy anoing :-) (Especialy Phoenix related)
-higher difficulities reduce your dmg done greatly and thus you are entire time on defensive - I miss the pointbreaker where you and the enemy would be equal (On captain you have +30% dmg while on higher difficulity you deal about 80%

I realy recomend this game. For most of the time had fun (except for one or two nerdrages when I had no idea about the game mechanics and got wiped after 40 minits battle just because I ignored the enemy support units :-) (realy not good idea to do so)

15889373.review:
И почему эту игру не продают? Нет, серьёзно, я понимаю что она ещё не законченна и новые главы в процессе. Но ёк-макарёк, то, что тут есть уже стоит денег. Такой халявы давно не видывал.

"Отбиваешься от крейсеров чайной ложкой" - я запомнил это выражение, и это лучшее краткое описание.
Собственно это не новелла, как мне изначально показалось, а вполне себе полноценная игра. С боёвкой, улучшением юнитов, сайд-квестами, картой и отличным сюжетом. Конечно элементы визуальной новеллы тут есть, но только элементы.

Сразу же хочу акцентировать внимание на сложности. Никогда, ни при каких условиях не выставляйте уровень сложности выше дефолтного. Это было моей главной ошибкой за всю игру - выбрать предпоследнюю сложность. То что происходило в боях и что со мной там делали... В общем - лучше не надо. (￣︿￣)

Ну а теперь про остальное. Сюжет в игре отличный. Завязка такова: в галактике ведёт агрессивную экспансию PACT, местная империя зла, каждый день захватываются новые и новые системы. Альянс, другая империя в этой галактике, ведёт нейтральную политику и ни как не препятствует захвату нейтральных систем.
Кейто, наш ГГ, уроженец из нейтральных миров с планеты Цера, принимает командование на новом корабле - Санрайдере. Однако при тестировании корабельных систем, PACT совершает налёт. Вслед за авангардом прилетает вундервафля - супер-дредноут - который тут же из главного орудия равняет с землёй крупный город на Цере, родину ГГ. Кейто удирает от противника, после чего наступает главный вопрос: а что делать? Родной мир оккупирован, родина испепелена, миллионы убиты. Ангары пусты, пилотов нет, помощи ждать не от кого.
Ввиду незаконченности игры не могу судить, влияют ли выборы на что-либо или нет. Выборов с долгоиграющими последствиями пока не обнаружил. Но есть несколько штук, которые влияют на развитие событий чуть ли не сразу.

Очень понравилась боевая составляющая. У каждого юнита есть 4 характеристики: зенитная защиты, энергетические щиты, броня и манёвренность. Щиты и зенитки у противников вообще жестокая штука: каждый крупный корабль с щитами генерирует вокруг себя защитное поля. 2-3 крейсера находящихся рядом создают почти не пробиваемую, для лазеров и ракет, защиту.
Вооружения не много, но при этом различие между ними существенное. Пулемёты и импульсные пушки отлично выкашивают на коротких дистанциях, но пулемёты бесполезны против бронированных целей, а импульсные пушки поглощаются щитами. Главные орудия имеют очень низкую точность, но при этом наносят зверский урон и пробивают броню. Лазеры супер-точные, со средним уроном и хорошо прожигают броню, но опять же поглощаются щитами. Ракеты имеют ограниченный боезапас, наносят массу урона, если бы не одно "но" - зенитные орудия.
Санрайдер оснащён всем и сразу, а вот мехи в большинстве своём узко-специализированы.
Сами бои жестоки и беспощадны, натурально показывают, как это - воевать с целой империей. Противников много. Враги не скупятся на ракеты, дебаффы, обстрелы по отделившимся юнитам. После появления несущих кораблей становится сложно, после появления саппоротов становится невыносимо. Думать заставляют, иначе не пройти, по крайней мере на харде.

Персонажи тут хоть и типичны, типа штампы кругом, при этом неплохо проработаны. Есть и колоритные личности, к примеру Козетта, которая как оказалась не так проста. Или адмирал Грэй. Да и сам Кейто - хоть и выглядит смазливым пареньком, ведёт себя как настоящий командир, без сопливых сантиментов и прочего.

Графика хороша, персонажи выглядят приятно, а детализация юнитов доставляет. Если у корабля есть пулемёты - стрелять он будет ими именно из них, если есть ракетные гнёзда - ракеты будут влетать из них, в общем шикарно выглядит. 
Ещё можно взять патч-анцензор и появится не много обнажёнки. (￣ω￣)

Саундтреки годные, отлично подобраны, в нужные моменты нагнетают атмосферу безысходности. Есть даже одна  приятная песенка, которую вполне можно слушать вне игры.
Озвучки нет в диалогах, но есть в бою. Блин, обалденная озвучка, хоть и английская. Больше всех радует Асага с её "I'm firing my laser!" - просто залип на эту её фразу.

Личные заметки - одна из лучших бесплатных игр. Игра хоть и не закончена, но у неё огромный потенциал, при этом она уже играбельна. Открытого мира нет, но это пока что. Нужен полноценный релиз.
Кто прошёл на последней сложности - снимаю шляпу.
И почему эту игру не продают?..

15881982.review:
I kickstarted this game on an impulse, without realizing quite what it was in addition to being a strategy game because I'm not all that bright. Regardless, I can still recommend it solely on its tactical merits.

With a high cost to movement and very low accuracy on most weapons at range, positioning is extremely important. This is further combined with defense types that are more than simple numerical values (damage taken from kinetic weapons is increased the greater the damage already dealt to the target, missiles can be intercepted by any vessel interposed between the source and the target, lasers can tear through small targets but are easily blocked if those ships are within the shield range of a larger, better defended vessel). The developers have achieved the truly remarkable feat of making every turn interesting by ensuring you're always jockeying to improve your defensive position, and expose weaknesses in your enemy's. Even little things like how aggro works feel noticeably unique and different compared to the rest of the genre. Plus firing the Vanguard Cannon makes me giddy, every time. 

A lot of this probably comes from Love In Space being a small, young studio, which unfortunately does cause some problems. Glitches are a rare but factual part of the play experience. The larger issue however is optimization. For what's on screen, the game has no excuse to run as slow as it does. It's noticeable throughout on a laptop but only becomes a severe problem in the last two missions, when the increased number of allies and enemies causes actual gameplay to slow to a crawl between loading miniature cutscenes and reloading the battle map.

With well-implemented difficulty scaling, fresh ideas and stylish presentation, I strongly recommend Sunrider to any tactical combat or sci-fi fans who can tolerate or enjoy its occasional nsfw elements, which at the moment cannot be disabled as far as I know.

15787377.review:
Interesting game!  Many things I liked about it, very few things I didn't.  It is a nice game that allows you to break away from other games for a short time.  The combat system I liked as it was quick and challenging (depending on what level you play).  And the storyline was good.  The girls are a bit on the "teeny" age side, but not overzealous of it.  Is it a game I would pay for?  And if so, how much do I think its worth?

So here is a list of pro's/con's...

Pro's
Good storyline.  Keeps you going and wondering what will happen next.
Good character development.  Each character in the story has that feeling of "getting to know them."
Graphics are pretty good for its style.
Upgrades of each unit is pretty easy to understand.
Gives you some choices when having conversations...
Allows you to exit the game from ANYTIME and continue exactly where you left off.  Kind of like that aspect...
There is a pause anytime you need it.  (Just don't do anything and the game stays still.)
Combat is relatively fun.  If it was long and dragged out, it could be a bad thing too.  But they didn't do that...
They show some "adult" material.  But doesn't seem focused on it.

Con's
Your character isn't your character.  You are someone else that is predesined.   Ie:  you are Kayto Shields.
Combat system gets relatively easy once the "Orders" option comes available.
Replay value diminishes fast after your first playthrough as there isn't much that can change.
Your decisions in conversations have very limited effect.
All storyline and "convo's" are in text.  Not altogether a bad thing, but could use a tad more...
The ending seems to lead to a great amount of hanging questions.  Can't stand this in video games, but understand the importance of it.  
The game could have been made with a lot more material.  Seemed kind of short...
"Relationships" don't get that developed.  It would be better if they allowed you to go through will all the girls seeing that "breaking their cherry" doesn't happen.  It tends to be more on the childish side in conversations for relationships...  But that might be a good thing too as this game is more like a break from others...So different it probably better.  

Would I buy this game?  How much?
Yes, but for a small amount.  I feel the value to be $5.00 US.  More would be unrealistic and tailored for the die-hard fans.  

Do I want them to come out with sequels?
Definitely!  But at no more than $5.  And not any shorter....

Would I recommend this game?
Depends on the friend.  If they are pvp orientated, then no.  If they are not story driven, then no.  If they like books, pve, and playing solo on at least occasionally, then absolutely.

15770432.review:
So it's a visual novel/turn based battle thing. Basically a sort-of X-Com with anime girls. Huh.

I had serious misgivings about installing this one, even though it was a free game. First impressions made it look like the sort of bad waifu VN I would feel ashamed playing, but it was a free game with high reviews. At least if it sucked I wouldn't have had to spend any money. So I decided to try it.

Turns out... it's actually quite good.

Yes it does have a number of immature anime things, and even playing the regular (censored) version of this there were more than a few suggestive moments and some very brief nudity. And yet all of this is set against a rather dark and serious backdrop: galactic warfare and all the horrible things that come with that. It gets particularly psychological and tense later on as your character ends up with nightmares about stuff that happens in the plot that comes back to haunt him in a PTSD sort of way. I'm not going to say more than that because spoilers, but all you really need to know is that the story kept me interested. And, during several moments, coming away fairly impressed by what these indie devs had done. 

In short... don't judge this by its cover. There is much more here than a bunch of silly anime girls.

As for the characters, it's pretty good with a few bad eggs. It's pretty much a full roster of all the anime girl archetypes you can think of: the overserious workaholic (Ava), the genki girl (Asaga), the shy genius (Chigara), the tsundere (Icari), the [b]massive[/b] pervert (Claude), the kuudere/Rei clone (Sola), and the trusty idealistic soldier (Kryska). But all of them stand out in their own ways, even if not all of those ways are positive (Claude is basically a pervert fanservice doctor and nothing else). There is a sizeable male cast, believe it or not, and some of them are actually interesting (Admiral Grey, Fontana) even if others (Arcadius) just seem like stereotypes. 

Gameplay makes this a mix of VN decision-making (some of which are rather difficult and made me take some time to think about), tactical battles, and some management stuff as you upgrade equipment or do side-missions. The battles can be tough, sometimes absurdly so, but there's nothing technically wrong with them. There was one moment that annoyed me a bit concerning a story mission where I [i]knew[/i] exactly what the enemy was planning, and yet I was not able to act on that knowledge because the story needed to convince me that this particular enemy was smart or something when, if this had been a strategy game, I would have torn him apart. At least the hair-raising scene after that battle ("Let me show you [i]war[/i]") was worth it, and led to probably my most morally questionable decision I made in my playthrough. 

Truthfully I found myself more interested in the story than the battles, and kinda wished I could skip them a few times because other things were going on that I was more interested in. At least in Key/Visual Arts' VN Little Busters! you got an option to skip the Baseball and Battle Ranking minigames if you wanted (but why would you? The Battle Ranking stuff was great! XD).

At time of writing, this game isn't finished. There's still more story being written so I can't really make an absolute recommendation on this because of that. But based on what I have seen so far, this game has real promise. :D

15752400.review:
Having only just finished my first playthrough, I wonder if I'm quite worthy of writing a review yet, but here goes!

A few months back I decided to really get into the VN scene on steam, and this one was chosen admittedly for its price. Nothing aids a shopping spree quite like the word FREE, and along with a few other Sekai Project works, this one found its way into my library and I started it just a few weeks back.

Let me tell you, having just finished the second episode, I am bouncing around the room with excitement!

At first, the sprite-based artwork didn't appeal to me much, but after some time they begin to grow on you. This also applies to the characters. At first it seemed like each was just fulfilling their role as a walking anime stereotype, with examples including the hyperactive girl, the quiet genius, the tsundere, the stickler for the rules and some others. But soon enough I was joining in with all their little speeches in-combat and was genuinely interested in how their character would grow. This game also breaks from the traditional in that it really feels like your mission is the liberation of the galaxy, rather than just choosing the options that will lead you to your desired girl of choice. The game doubles up genres and gives you a turn-based strategy as well, which came as a welcome treat for me.

The music in this game was solid from the start. Each tune perfectly matches the surroundings and really immerses you in what's going on at the time. I remember the first time I used the Vanguard Cannon ability, and the change in music was nothing short of overwhelming. You can imagine members of your crew cheering with every victory gained.

The moral side of the choice-making is very clear. Generally it's between the right thing to do and fulfilling the mission, which always leads to debates about who you are as a person, but thank goodness for multiple save files! You can try any and every possible option and still feel like you haven't quite lost your humanity.

In terms of cons, the only noticeable one is that sometimes in combat missions the game will crash and force you to quit, but other than quickly restarting, this doesn't set you back very far as the saving system is usually on the ball.

Overall, I give a 9/10 for amazing music, brilliant last-minute plot twists, the strategy elements, and of course, the Vanguard cannon.
Damn, I love that cannon

15696017.review:
[b]Quicky Review[/b]
Great game (Part dating sim, part space opera, part tactical combat), strong story (Part BSG, Part Mass Effect), The voice acting is used sparingly, so you'll need to be prepared to read a lot of the story and dialogue. Turn-based tactical combat is a fun challenge akin to XCOM. The difficulty ranges from story-mode to impossible with several difficulties in between to suit your preference. There are many hours of gameplay in the story, and enough replay value to have you coming back again. 

[b]Summary[/b]
The game puts you in the role of a starship captain who must gather allies from across the galaxy (akin to Mass Effect) to defeat a tyrant. Between the combat scenes you'll interract with your crew, and upgrade your ship's combat suite to suit your play style. Your crew is made up of attractive female anime tropes, most of whom find you irresistable to some degree. You can choose to get to know them and pursue a romance. 

[b]Sound[/b]
The soundtrack of Sunrider has several tracks to set the tone of the scenes in the story. Some are short loops while others are full length Japanese pop songs that feel perfectly suited to mech combat in space. The game's sound effects are good quality and appropriate, but you are going to hear the same combat sounds over and over again. The female voices are well-suited to their characters. It's too bad that their isn't more voice acting. They only talk during combat, you'll have to read their lines during the story bits. The male voice acting isn't as strong. 

[b]Visuals[/b]
The background visuals look great, as do the spaceships, and mechs. The art style is along the lines of most anime. If you liked Gundam you should feel right at home. The characters are well designed, each with different physical traits. Each character gets a few different costumes for the different settings they visit. The character animations are simple and leave a lot to the imagination. The combat animations look great, but don't have a lot of variety so after seeing them for the hundredth time it will start to get repetitive. 

[b]Gameplay[/b]
The difficulty of the game is managable at first, but ramps up to infuriating frustrating levels by the end of the game (I played on Captain Difficulty). I had to restart my first playthrough after about 6 hours into the game because my ship builds couldn't keep up with the difficulty of the game. During the battles you'll either spend a lot of time listening to combat dialogue and watching the animations play out, or you'll be hammering the spacebar to skip through them. Watching some 20+ ships shooting at your ships one at a time, turn after turn gets old really fast, especially if you lost a battle and need to start it over. The worst part of the game is the enemy debuff units that can weaken your units and effectively make them unable to act on your turn. They're hard to kill, and can bring combat to a griding halt. Additionally, Sunrider suffers from a counterintuitive save system. Don't trust the autosave feature. The story portions of the game have good pacing, and mix humor, drama, and romance well so that you shouldn't be bored. You can choose to talk to some of your crew or each of them between battles and get to know them better. You'll also be given moral choices which will effect how your crew views you. Surprisingly, some choices felt weighty, and there were moments that made me laugh, cring, and genuinely feel for the characters.

15544036.review:
Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius - игра типа visual novel с элементами пошаговой стратегии.

Сначала я бы хотел выделить игровую часть данного творения:

В игре присутствует несколько уровней сложности, но так как в игре дикий дисбаланс, то даже на рекомендованой (Не говоря уже о более сложных уровней) сложности получить удовольствие от битв сможет только заядлый любитель тактики. Если же играть на лёгком уровне сложности, то битвы, несмотря на то, что вскоре становятся однотипными, затягивают с каждым разом. В игре так же присутствует некий элемент RPG - возможность улучшать корабль и боевых роботов своего экипажа. Но тут любителям улучшений нет радости - возможность прокачать какую-то одну ветку кораблся, не говоря уже о самом корабле (Про весь флот в целом вовсе не стоит заикаться) возможности не предоставится, т.к., как я понял, конца улучшениям нет, да и денег не хватит.

Ну и самое сладенькое на последок - сюжет:

Сюжет тут, однако, на любителя. Вы - командующий флотом, состоящий полностью из очаровательных дам. Один Герой на десяток девиц. А одна лучше другой. И это первое что бросается в глаза. У каждого персонажа есть своя история, свой характер. Каждый действует по своим амбициям. Но так или иначе целиком и полностью преданы главному герою. И это делает их в некой степени однотипными и предсказуемыми. А сюжет построен на том, что Вы должны освободить свою родную планету от аннексии одной недобросовестной империи. Игра бросает вас с одной ситуации в другую, из огня да в полымя, да наполнена множеством поворотов событий. Для меня сюжет, хоть ничего принципиально инновационного я в нём не заметил, был тяжёлый. Тяжёлый для осмысления. Поэтому просто расслабиться за спокойным прочтением миленькой VN Вам, скорей всего, не удастся. Но именно из-за этого я и влюбился в эту замечательную игру. Замечательную историю.

И если вы таки спросите меня - "А стоит всё таки в неё играть?", то я однозначано вам отвечу - "Да, стоит!".

15534991.review:
A surpringly well crafted game that is much more in line with Mass Effect than a space opera visual novel.  Dialog is all well written with many (somewhat cliched) unique characters and interactions.  Main character is not a lout, which is a plus, and while nearly every other character is a girl, only a few are actively throwing themselves at you, and for the most part the main character is too involved in the main plot of them game (which follows a Battlestar Galactica-type story but less grim yet still compelling).

Art is good enough to not be distracting, and the non-dialog driven gameplay is pleasant enough. It is a hex-based strategy game but far less complicated than a Final Fantasy Tactics and generally focuses on shorter battles.  I find it not at all frustrating, but I'm playing one of the easier of the five (!) available difficulties.

And it's free!  (Well, it was Kickstarted.) Who can argue with that?  Though the quality of this game has encouraged me to purchase the less-free Sunrider Academy, so as an advertising campaign it is also quite successful.  Give it a try!  If you like Mass Effect you owe yourself a go with Sunrider.

15471258.review:
Sunrider is a visual novel/tactics hybrid that happens to have a lot of potential in the latter category. The difficulty curve spikes wildly and it's very easy to make the game unwinnable without dropping difficulty levels, since there are very few battles to gain money and too many ways to spend it for such a short game. I'm not sure that the upcoming final part will improve on this, but even so the tactical aspects are quite fun to play.

So why don't I recommend it? To put it bluntly, even by VN standards the writing for this game is truly awful. The plot is composed of every cliche the writers could think of, characters in their late twenties still don't seem more mature that middle schoolers, and the technical writing is also poor. There's a lot of potential here if a quality writer could get a look at it, but as is I can't recommend it, let alone the dating sim that, from the PV, is just as poorly written but without the interesting gameplay.

15394590.review: At about 10 hours into the game, I can safely say that its the best free game Ive ever played. The game is single-player and there is no in-game shop that asks for money, which is rare even in full priced, AAA games these days. The gameplay is essentially a visual novel for the story elements, with tactical turn-based RPG combat and RPG stat mechanics. The combat in this game really shines. The combat scenarios have a variety of different objectives, Ranging from "kill all the dudes" to being required to escort a civilian ship with no defenses to the other side of the map, to being required to take out particular enemy units and escape before reinforcements arrive. Each objective presents their own unique challenges, and require very different playstyles. Sometimes you want to move slowly and focus on defense while methodically taking out the opponent, while other times, you may want to move quickly while trying to prevent as much damage as you can, to get out before reinforcements arrive. All of your various unit types have different roles in combat and are useful in nearly any situation, if you know what to do with them. Each of your units has their own set of stat upgrades. They have a variety of defenses and damage types, so you do have to balance all of them and know their purpose. The only criticism I have of the RPG mechanics is that thus far, I have not had the opportunity to purchase any truly new abilities for my units. Each character has a set of abilities that, at least to this point, cannot be added to or modified outside of buffs from support characters or command abilities. In a pure RPG, this would usually be a bit of a deal breaker, but honestly, the set of abilities you have is deep and complex enough that, along with the well designed combat, you can continuously be learning new uses for things even after playing with them for hours. As far as the story, music, and art style goes, I really enjoy it. The writing is witty and charming, and every character has a unique personality that goes beyond typical tropes. Characteristics of certain archetypes are present, but no character really fits any one stereotype perfectly, and that is a great thing. The art style of the game is great as well. While the character designs and mechs are very clearly anime inspired, they do a good job of having their own bit of style and not falling into the trap of looking like theyre trying to be anime, looking too cliche. The space backrounds are simple but suitable, and the ship designs remind me very much of more western sci-fi, particularly Mass Effect and Star Wars. The soundtrack is good as well, especially for a free game. The intro song is addicting and epic, I watch the intro scene everytime I load the game because of that, and the combat music is very good as well. This is the first visual novel Ive really put any time into, but so far, its amazing and Im not even done with the first chapter, and currently there is a second chapter, as well as a third one in progress.
