15345236.review:
Definitely a real gem here.

First let's get the major point out of the way. It's free. So you've got nothing to lose by trying it! But be warned, it's still not "complete" as there's still one more chapter to come out. Think of it as the A New Hope and the Empire Strikes Back.

But onto the actual meat and potatoes now...

If I had to describe Sunrider, I'd say that it'd be what you get if Valkyria Chronicles, FTL, X-COM and Ah! My Goddess got SUPER drunk one night and did some things they will probably never speak of to each other. Well, their loss is our gain. Sunrider is an epic space opera about you Kayto "Captain" Shields trying to defeat an evil empire that has been blasting people up for no good reason. You're given a newly commissioned sweet ass battlestar called the Sunrider (which is pretty much an expy for the Space Battleship Yamato) which you can take into combat and a bunch of insanely giant mecha that you gradually fill up your hangar with. Of course, this being a visual novel in the best anime style all the mecha pilots are waifus. You could pretty much list off exactly who you'll be getting, the hyper-kinetic one, the quiet one, the shy one, the cold badass that is sensitive on the inside and the one you have history with. While this could have been used as a set up for simply some massive amounts of T&A (and there is some) the devs actually put together a great story with these characters. By the end of it, you'll have saved a few planets, gone to a creepy alien graveyard, helped out some local miners, crashed a wedding and (of course) gone on shore leave which fans of anime will immediately recognize as "The Beach Episode". Sure some of this might seems like TVTropes fodder, but they manage to stich it together into a great narrative, complete with drama, romance and a helpful smacking of comedy. But in addition to the cutesy covering, this game explores some fairly dark themes like collateral damage, betrayal and slavery. All of these are explored in the Visual Novel side of the gameplay where you can wander around your ship and talk to your crew. 

While the visual novel style of gameplay is satisfying, the meat of the game is in the combat. Here, the turn based style of X-COM is fully utilized. You get a hex grid with the baddies on one side and your forces on the other. Each unit has a set number of "Energy" that is used up when it does things like activate special abilities, move and fire weapons. The Sunrider is often the anchor of the formation and has an array of extremely powerful weapons like lasers (weak but accurate), kinetic cannons (powerful but inaccurate) and missiles (powerful and accurate but limited salvoes and can be shot down). There are also a couple of special abilities that you can use like the wave motion gun, resurrection of an ally and so forth. Backing you up are the numerous Ryders that are essentially fighter jets to your carrier. But, as this is anime, no one wants to see boring old space fighters, and the Ryders are all special mecha. Each Ryder (piloted by one of the aforementioned waifus) has a specific role, strengths and weaknesses. The Black Jack, for example, is a general purpose combat unit designed to soak up and dish out damage while the Seraphim is delicate but can wreck enemy units from long range with a sniper cannon and the Paladin is a mighty glacier. As you can imagine, it takes all your forces working together in order to pull out a victory as you are usually outnumbered. It's elegant and fun, especially those times when you pull off that one low percentage shot to save your girls. Fortunately, even if you mess up a bit, anyone that gets to zero HP (besides YOU of course) pulls back to the carrier and will be available for the next battle. The only annoying bits are some of the combat exclamations which get a little tedious after a while.

In another nod towards the X-COM and Valkyria Chronicles style, the spoils of victory give you resources which you can use to upgrade your forces such as by increasing their amount of energy, reducing the cost of abilities, making your weapons more powerful and even purchasing some backup. You'll quickly find that there's no way that you'll be able to afford all the upgrades so it becomes a careful balancing act as to where you'll spend your money especially as there's no way to "farm" resources. I would have appreciated a way to get some additionaly cash as currently there is no way to get more than partially up the tech tree for any one unit without nerfing everyone else. Still, if you're wise about your choices and concentrate on each Ryder's strengths, you'll get a formidable fighting machine in the end.

All in all, Sunrider is a great game and needs to get a sequel pronto. I'm dying to know how all this madness ends. Love In Space is yet to release the final chapter of the game but you can bet that I'm going to be first in line to get my hands on it!

15275297.review:
[h1]Что из себя представляет Sunrider?[/h1]
Это смесь визуальной новеллы и пошаговой стратегии, и как по мне обе части очень даже хороши. Игра обладает большим рядом плюсов в плане самого геймплея, но к сожалению есть проблемы с оптимизацией. Вообще её легче разделить на разные части и описать их по отдельности.

[i]Визуальная новелла[/i]
Эта часть игры составляет примерно 40% от всей игры, здесь нам толкают сюжет и заставляют делать выборы. Вообщем то от других новелл отличий тут нет - скажу только, что выборы очень сложные, сюжет интересный, персонажи разнообразные и ничего не надоедает.

[i]Пошаговая стратегия[/i]
Ну собственно главное отличие игры от остальных новелл, это боевка. Ничего особо отличающегося от других стратегий тут нам опять же не представят, однако на нормальной сложности эта часть игры становится ну ооочень сложной, особенно последние 3-4 миссии (я их так и не прошел без читов). Но при этом скучно в бою не бывает, плюс все неплохо разбавлена диалогами после битв.

Единственный серьезный минус этой игры - оптимизация. На XP её пройти без читов вообще нереально из-за фризов на некоторых миссиях, а так же она очень любит крашиться, иногда и по 5 раз за миссию. Но это простительно перед остальными плюсами игры.

Итак, как по мне - одна из лучших новелл, чем то напоминает Mass Effect в плане стилистики и эпичности происходящего.

8.5/10, ждем оптимизации и 3 главы истории.

15068632.review:
Great game. Story, characters, and dialogue are all engaging. Not perfect, but enjoyable - can be a bit hacky to be sure, but there are some surprises and difficult choices to be found as well. It's not amazing literature, but makes for a great little anime game. The music, sound, and voices are all superb (though if you play on harder difficulties, you may tire of it , due to long battles, restarts, etc). Graphics and UI are good. The pacing and alternating between 1) the VIsual Novel, 2) interactive elements and upgrades on your ship, and 3) tactical strategy works quite nicely.

- - -

These are my only cons:

1) Certain game mechanics aren't really explained very well, you kind of have to figure things out through trial and error, which means... dying and starting over needlessly. Which takes you out of the story. I really don't understand why they didn't include more tutorial elements.

2) I had issues with the default difficulty, and it wasn't clear to me that you can change it at any time! Most games you would have to start a new playthrough.

My issues were this: the difficulty ramps and oscillates in a strange way, as the game starts off very easy, then becomes impossibly hard, then very easy again, then impossibly hard once more at the end. I definitely "cheated" quite a bit when it got hard, with save states, and accumulated tons of resources, so that kind of explains why it got easy again...which brings me to: 

3) I think this game would've been more fun with saves only accessible between battles. Otherwise by saving/loading during battles you can completely abuse it, and the unpredictable difficulty makes it very tempting at times.

15028788.review:
The feeling I get from this game is that it could still be greatly improved.

Mind, I started the game and was compelled to finish it in one sitting (being frustrated at difficult/tricky missions, much as the numbers worked against me). Throughout that, I’ve crashed the game countless times (mostly through a save/load prompt causing it to look for a missing animation file, or skipping battle scenes and somehow causing it to crash from there). That said, the whole thing could still be improved, from the interface, to the fluidity of the system, to the behavior of the AI — pretty much everything can still take a touching up.

Regardless, it was and is a pretty good game. I enjoyed it and the challenge it gave - Captain: Way the game is meant to be played; much harder than I thought it’d be for the ‘suggested’ setting - and would invite you to try it out. The story is nothing special, but it’s definitely good for what it is.

This has a lot of potential!

14960466.review:
[h1]Преимущества[/h1]
[list]
    [*]Изображений в игре не очень много, но они достаточно неплохо нарисованы.
    [*]Любопытный сюжет с необычной концовкой, который временами переключается из настоящего в прошлое, с лёгким налётом любовных историй.
    [*]Встроена приемлемая пошаговая стратегия (пара десятков сражений), выбор выполнять/невыполнять дополнительные миссии (рекомендую выполнять).
    [*]Есть система покупки усоврешенствований оборудования для пошаговой стратегии.
    [*]Присутствует некая нелинейность сюжета, иногда заставляет делать очень сложный моральный выбор и наблюдать его последствия.
    [*]Абсолютно бесплатная.
[/list]

[h1]Недостатки[/h1]
[list]
    [*]При загрузке ранее сохранённой игры заместо текущей иногда может случиться кратковременный сбой (пишет ошибку, мол, связано с анимацией) - не критично.
    [*]Кроме как в заставке, нет другой запоминающейся качественной музыки, просто есть неприметная фоновая.

Все верховные командующие (те, кто не проливает кровь сам непосредственно на поле боя) - это мужики. Подобное выглядит весьма странно для любого здравомыслящего человека.
[/list]

[h1]Итого[/h1]
Рекомендую попробовать однозначно всем любителям визуальных новелл и пошаговых стратегий. Нечасто найдёшь бесплатную игру такого уровня. PLANETA CERA ZOSTAŁA PODBITA PRZEZ ZŁYCH KOMUNISTÓW! POKONAĆ ICH MOŻE TYLKO ZAŁOGA OKRĘTU KOSMICZNEGO KLASY SUNRIDER, NA CZELE KTÓREJ STOI KOMANDOR KAYTO SHIELDS!!

Sunrider jest połączeniem Visual Noveli (guglujcie, jak nie wiecie) i turowej strategii. To jest gra z kickstartera za 40.000$, jak na grę, psie pieniądze. Na szczęście tych nie potrzeba dużo, by taka gra była dobra.
Fabułę macie bardzo ładnie opisaną bez spoilerów na samym początku recenzji. Nie będę się rozpisywał na temat tła fabularnego, bo to już jest opisane na samym początku gry i na stronie dewelopera. Podsumowując - Grę pokochałem i polecam, ale tylko jak możecie wybaczyć wiele jej niedorobień.

14911534.review:
Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius is both a Visual Novel and Tactical RPG set in a futuristic universe, although it can be just a Visual Novel if you want to.

The positive:
-  Story: The story begins as a group named PACT forces its influence over neutral planets, killing millions of innocents in the process. And so it happens that our protagonist must become the hero who will stop PACT little by little with just one ship. Sounds cliched at first but there are interesting twists along the way.

- Characters: Harem! All the girls have common anime personalities, like the tsundere, the super serious, the shy, the silent and misterious and so on and so forth. In spite of this fact, there is quite a lot of character development, specially towards the end. 

- Choices: The choices you are forced to make in this game also contribute to give personality to the main protagonist, since you can be a "save the universe at all costs" kind of guy or have a "we won't sacrifice innocents" attitude. I'm not sure the choices have a huge impact in the long run, but they definetly change battles and make the game more compelling.

- Soundtrack: I must say that I wasn't impressed by the first tracks I got to hear when starting the game, but later on there sure is great music, specially during crucial points of the story. 

The not so great:

- Voice acting: hit and miss. Some are just too annoying. You only get to hear it during battles though.

- Difficulty: battles are VERY hard in this game. The developers said that it's hard for a reason, after all you are trying to save the universe with just one ship. There are hard games which feel rewarding, but here I think it's just artificially difficult. It IS a tactical game, you have to know your units and use them wisely, but sometimes I feel like there isn't much I can do except pray for some good RNG and abuse saving and loading. Resources are finite, so if you think your upgrades are wrong, that's it. You can't fight random battles to become stronger. You have to win with what's in your hands right now. On the other hand, if you feel like the combat is too difficult for you, or if you just want to enjoy the nice story, you can lower the difficulty down to "Visual Novel". Doing that makes the combat just a formality which you can easily win. There is no penality at all for doing this, you won't miss anything.

The negative:

- The engine. Renpy clearly wasn't made for this kind of game. The performance is awful on the battlefield and during combat animations. Seems like I'm using a very bad computer, but I'm not!  

Other comments:
- This game is completely free. It was crowd funded through Kickstarter. 

- The story isn't complete, it'll be finished later. Right now it ends in a cliffhanger.

- This isn't a "choose your girl" erotic visual novel. I think there is only 1 sex scene in the whole game, and you have to apply the Decensor patch that can be found here "http://sunrider-vn.com/sunriderpage/" to see it. I do recommend you apply it.

14874086.review:
I honestly don't understand why this game is free to play.  To attract attention?  Anyway I will pay MONEY to play a game like this.  The story is great, the crashes don't mess with your saved files.  And the restarts are literally five seconds of wait then hit continue.  The characters are memorable and the story is great (although sometimes a little cheesy).

But Gameplay is really where it matters though.  While it isn't the most stable games I've played, it's defenitely the most challenging.  I clicked "Casual" on the difficulty settings and after several missions of legit casual gameplay I ended up at the wedding scene...and haven't been able to pass it since (I've poured 6 hours into the battle and still no change).  I actually had to make a new save with "visual novel mode" that is honestly easy, but you can still get the possibility of losing stuff.

Addressing Gameplay again, I was relieved when I noticed you could skip the AI turn.  Just clicking on the screen would speed by movements and get to your turn faster.  However doing this might actually be bad for missions that have dialog durring your turn, and by all those extra clicks you'll skip some minor bits of storyline.  

More Gameplay.  I'm honestly impressed by the kind of stradegy you MUST employ when you get a new character.  Asaga is the first character you get, and she's a regular tank character that you NEED to dish out firepower each turn.  But she has no support powers.  That's where Chigara and Claude come in.  Their support powers increase your attack and aim ablility, without them I'm certain that I'd never get past the mid game.  Their support powers were so important to me that I had to RESTART BATTLES just so I can keep them and beat the levels.  And through this carful stradegy you end up loving each and every character in their own way....

Except for Icari.  It's hard to keep her alive even when I upgrade her Reyder.  You have to use a hit and run tactic where she charges in, melee's, then leaves.  But sometimes she doesn't have enough energy to get back behind your line of Reyders and you carrier, so you're forced to move it all forward to keep her alive, which puts the rest of your fleet in jepardy.  However I found it worth it...like less than half of the time.  Because sometimes the enemy started close to you and you didn't need to worry about it.  Just support, shoot, slash.  The only fix I can see is if you upgrade her energy (Which you can do) so she can get multiple hits in and get back without being a pain in the ass.  (I use her as cannon fodder)

Honestly balancing needs to be addressed with her. (like changing her default energy to a higher one so she can easily retreat)

And like I said in the beginning...I'd pay for this game.  I'd pay 20 dollars because I found my experience with not only it's gameplay (despite how infuriating) and its characters (No matter how cliche) and it's crashes (which weren't very common the later you play) All 100% worth it.  There's no other game out there that satisfied me the most ever since I played the full mass effect series...and the best part.

It's not even done. :)

14863772.review:
Oh, Sunrider...

I want to like you. I truly do - you've got a semi-decent battle section, and I'm a sucker for sci-fi settings. But I can't. Why?

Its too cliche.

Now, I know, this is a free game, and I'm not expecting Mass Effect; plus, pretty much everything has one or more cliches in it. The whole attacked-on-the-first-day thing, for example, I can ignore. What I'm talking about are the anime cliches - they're simply too much.

First off, we've got the situation that Shields' childhood friend is the first mate. Yeah, okay, we can be flexible with our disbelief and let that pass, but its still pretty contrived.

Next, tying sort of into the above, there's girls everywhere yet no man in sight beyond the captain himself, like a harem show or game. Nothing can justify this; even games like Tokimeki have the "male best friend" character.

Adding to that, the uniforms. First Mate Aya wears a uniform that's believably military, and so does Captain Shields, even if his has buckles all over the place. Virtually all the other characters? High school uniforms. Yes, folks, you heard that right - a stereotypical anime high school uniform on board of a starship. 

Do I even need to go over mecha in this game? There's literally no reason for it to exist; even their combat weaponry are pretty much replacable by the in-game enemy missile frigate and bomber!

Last but not least, I've got a major complaint about the characters overall; they're incredibly one dimensional, to the point where you can explain their entire personality in a few words. Such as, "childhood friend," "not!Rei Ayanami," etc. You can't connect at all to the characters, because they have nothing unique to connect to.

Honestly, these anime cliches and the space opera setting mix together about as well as oil and water, which is a shame because it would be excellent otherwise, especially for a freeware VN. Something I'd like to point out here though, is that visual novels are just another form of gaming/entertainment - you don't have to use cliches from the animus or mangos to make it, or even do it in an animesque style! This was probably designed to attract a certain group of people, and considering the amount of positive reviews, it did it well, but in the end there is a ton of wasted potential, which could have opened it up to a larger audience.

14799926.review:
Evaluation finale :

Histoire : 6/10
L'histoire principale est correcte, mais on voit que le jeu comporte des éléments pour quêtes annexes qui n'ont pas pu être entièrement exploités par les développeurs. Du coups, on a l'impression que Sunrider - Mask of Arcadius est un jeu à chapitre dont beaucoups d'éléments manque malheureusement. Cependant, le tout est correct malgré les regrets d'avoir un jeu fini, mais non complet.

Mécaniques de jeu : 10/10
Le jeu est très bien pensé. Bien que les premiers chapitres ne puisse être joué aux plus hauts niveaux de difficultés, on dispose assez vite d'une fonction 'escarmouche' qui permet de récolter des données sous forme de $ afin d'améliorer ses unités... ou de disposer de plus de points de commandements pour mener ses forces à la victoires.
Et bien que l'armure soit un facteur commun à toutes les armes, lasers et missiles disposent également de leur contre-mesure. Cependant, la guerre électronique pourra également mener à affaiblier ces défenses pour couler les navires adverses. Quelle genre de commandant serez-vous ?

Graphismes : 7/10
Outre les personnages et fonds qui sont beaux, on s'attardera au final plus sur les retours graphiques des unités aux combats. L'univers dispose de graphismes de mechanoïdes particuliers, rendant l'univers et les opposants singulier. Cependant, on note parfois quelques lags graphiques inexpliqués. Heureusement, ils restent rares.

Sons : 9/10
Le retour des mouvements et attaques ou dégâts subis est d'une très bonne qualité et suffisamment varié pour casser les effets de répétitions.
Côté histoire, les interactions avec les personnages donnent le ton de leurs phrases et du dialogue.
Quant à la musique, elle est toujours adapté à la situation ou à la phase de combat. La piste musique à elle seule vaut pour moi 10/10.

Total : 8/10
Le jeu est bon, et je l'ai fini 3 fois.
Un des meilleurs moment reste la phase de tir du 'Vanguard', super-canon du Sunrider
.
________________________OLD________________________
Pour le moment, il s'agit d'un beau diamand brut.

Pas vraiment fan de visual novel, le côté jeu de stratégie méchanoïdes & vaisseaux spatiaux m'a fait craquer. Et pour le mieux.

Côté visual novel, je trouve cela plutôt correct. La narration est propre et chaque scène s'enchaîne très proprement en l'état. De plus, les choix moraux à faire sont bien recherchés.

Côté stratégique, la difficulté est au rendez-vous : il faut bien répartir ses unités et utiliser leur spécilisation correctement sur chacune des cartes pour passer plus aisément les niveaux.

A l'exception d'une unité (une espèce de torpilleur pirate), le tout me semble équilibré. J'attends avec une certaine impatience la suite et fin du développement.

14785889.review:
Gotta be honest, I was kind of skeptical about this game.
I tried it, I love it. Simple as that.

The story was a bit generic at first, but I think that's what they were hoping for. People would think that this is some space-military, action-adventure, romance VN that they've heard before multiple times. But I can see the effort they put in to try out their own little twist of the story towards the end. It was simple, but entertaining.

The battles are pretty frequent and I liked them, but they become slightly tedious as you continue battle after battle.
Money isn't plentiful, so you have to be careful about where you spend it.
Characters are cute and their personalities differ from each other.
Nice little romance scenes here and there. (Although I did sometimes wonder why they played some scenes at certain points. Not sure, but the timing just seemed a bit off, at least to me.)

Even though there are some flaws in the game, I can't help but like it.
If you think it's interesting, give it a shot. Could be that your instinct is right.
I give this game a 8/10.

Definetly recomented!
Having finished the first part "First Arrival" after about 15hrs gameplay, I feel quite entertained, In short, suring my gameplay I encountered:

- Clever and nice humor, even self-sarcasm from the developers regarding the characteristics of the game. Many times, I found myself smiling while reading the pilots dialogues.
- Nice storiline, with interesting subplots. It is not open-ented and the main theme is a standard space-opera-story, but it feels like a nice graphic-novel or comic, whith kind of predictable main-cheens but quite intriguing and nicly-written details or subplots. 
- Very good fit of nice music themes playing at the correct moment-dialoge, so that they contibute and create an immersive, emmotional reading.
-No nacket manga girls, at least till the end of 'First Arrival'. Sensuality and clasic manga sexuallity is colorfully cheerful in the dialogs text, but no soft-porn picture is encounterd yet. I assume that later on, the game will 'got undressed', but it is the other fulfilling aspects of it that make me recomment Sunrider. Good humour (for my taste) is at the top of the list.
- Interesting tactical combat that encourage desision making and carious alternative ways of gameplay, encounter resolving and altenrative 'leveling' of the variate units. Dificulty can be a bit frustrating for a non-strategist-gamer, but that makes wining even more rewarding. 
- No voice-acting during the dialoges of the visual-comic. You hear somthing other than music only during battles, when your pilots have voice themes relevant to their action. Note that if you press ' v ' you activate/deactivate a really ougfull aoutomatic-text-to-voice algorithm that will 'read' the text on the screen.

Tl;dr version: Can recommend. Has surprising depth from a F2P Visual Novel. I wasn't really expecting a shockingly passable Turn-based combat space-sim, so I'd almost give it a thumbs-up on that alone. Solid soundtrack, too

Longer version: In truth, the characters are predictable anime-waifu trope material. There's the one with boobs who wants your junk. The shy one, etc etc. They say the same 2 or 3 lines over and over again in the combat sequences and they essentially all have the same model, just with different-colored hair/outfit that matches their Gundam-wing-type ship. They do have their own personalities and motivations and decent depth to the character. Be nice to see another male character that isn't a pompous ass-wad/scheming d-bag/not blatantly evil, though. The villains of the game are uninteresting to the extreme and seemed to follow a Do-it-Yourself Build-an-Evil-Empire coloring book from Wal-Mart. That'd be the game's biggest drawback. 

That being said, the plot and combat for a Visual novel is good. The Waifu-stuff is there and if it really matters to to, you get to see a boob. Not bad for a free to play game. The game is still in the beta stages, so there are still bugs present, although I have not encountered anything gamebreaking. The harder difficulties are definitely a challenge, so that's a point in its favor as well

Looking forward to the final chapter

Like this game.  The turned based battles.  The option to upgrade both the Sunrider and the ryder's seperately.  There are also so visual novel type choices, decisions to make which I haven't determined if one choice really effects the story over another choice yet, but I am assuming the path of the story takes a slight detour if not an entire new ending.   

I like that there are a lot of strategic decisions to make on the battlefield, such as which weapon to use on which enemy, how far to move in any one turn, when to use a special power, or even if to in certain battles, as that takes up energy that you don't get back until you earn more.   

Different battles also have different objectives.  Some are eliminate enemy, others are protect certain ships, etc.  

I do find it funny that two of the ryder pilots are dressed in almost the exact same looking pilot outfits, and look almost exactly like, even down to the exact same hairstyle, as two of the Evangelion pilots in the anime Neon Genesis Evangelion.  Gee, wonder were the makers of Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius got their charater ideas from.  =D

In short, I have been playing this for a few hours now and am still enjoying it.  Have failed one battle objective 3 times now, but I keep coming back to try different tactics.  I reccommend this game for those who are looking for a good anime, turned based strategy game.  Aren't to many of those being made for the PC now.  

Game developers now just want to make retro, 8 bit games, point and click adventure crap, or RPG eye candy that is more movie and battle animations than gameplay, where you need the latest and greatest video card to handle the animation and CG.

For those that would like to get back to real strategy gaming, with anime and some story thrown in, I definately recommend this game.

14641680.review:
Good game. Interesting story of an ancient and powerful race (Ryuvian Empire), super pseudo-scientific powers (Shaar + Awaken), love interests (the girls), powerful enemies (Fallen + Arcadius), an evil pirate with a sad backstory (Cosmos), betrayers (Fontana) and more story. 

A very stereotypical harem anime, with 1 male, many females and the memories of his younger sister.

This game hasn't ended yet, there's still more. 

PROS
1. Story
Very interesting. Each character has their own storyline and the things you choose will affect them.

2. Mecha
Almost like Gundam. You can even upgrade your mechs using funds to buy stat points. You get to choose your playstyle. There's a Heavy, Melee, Sniper, Disabler, Support, Balanced and the Sunfire (Heroe's ship).

3. Combat
Love the simple hex-grid combat system. So easy to understand. The executive orders make combat a lot easier.

4. Free
Who can hate a good and free game with no freemiums?

5. Fan Service
By a princess, no less. Funny how that one scene got through.

6. Morality
To be free or to live under the protection and yoke of another? Interesting moral choices to be made. They are parodies of things happening in the real world.

CONS 
1. Bugs
Game crashed while fighting Legion. Had to restart. Minor issue as game quick saves all the way, so you can reload.

2. Animation
Very similar black uniforms all the way throughout the game.

3. Repetition
The voices coming out of the girls are always the same words, like an automated robot, and you can't help but to click them to issue orders.

4. Linearity
Despite which option you choose, the game still railroads you down the same choice.

14590512.review:
If you have any interest in Visual Novel, you have to give this a try.

Pros: 
+ Free, totally.
+ Great Soundtracks. (freely available on game files Steam\SteamApps\common\Sunrider\game\Music)
+ In-depth storyline.
+ So many girls around. Oh wait...

Cons:
- Inconclusive story. A part of trilogy, anyway, but still....
- Mediocre battle mechanic.
- Engine is so unoptimized. How come I'm getting low FPS in 2D battle!!! for a Visual Novel genre?

If you've ever played XCOM, Front Mission or Final Fantasy Tactics, this is similar. A hexagonal turn based strategy game wrapped in Visual Novel genre.

The battle mechanic is too simple for my taste, but understandably since this is not intended as full-blown strategy game like XCOM. You control some basic Ryders alongside the mother ship, and along with the storyline you'll be sent to battle menu to arrange team into the 'board' with variety of objectives depending on where you are on the story. There are some pre-planning involved, as in don't put Sora on the front of the enemies as her Ryder is weak, yet deadly when sniping from afar, or put your Mother Ship in the middle of the battle. Mostly the objectives would be to wipe out the entire opposing team, but sometimes you have to escort someone to safety. 

The quest system is there, fairly promising but falls short. After certain points of the game, you'll be given a world map, where you can pick where you go. There you can work on quests that when you complete it, you'll receive rewards. The game maybe was initially designed  to be offering multiple paths to progress with this quest system that you can manually pick, but then again it does not give any real impact since the ending stays the same. Moreso, the game gives you multiple choices to pick to reply in many situations, but again, nothing's changed significantly except the one near the end of the game.

The most amusing part is for me about the story - and how the characters interact with each others especially Kaito to Ava (given their notable past - close relationship). I would have hoped the developers could deliver more story about each characters' background, though, especially Sora. That said, I find the game has some in-depth lores, and you have to pay a bit of attention so as not to miss anything and be clueless later. 

And lastly, I find the game performance is pretty horrible. Ranging from constant crashes that forced me to reload from last save (god knows I've done that how many times) and truly poor controller support (who on earth wouldn't like to play VN genre while laying comfortably on the bed?). So yeah, save often and don't count on that quick save feature. Don't forget to save on multiple files, you'll understand why when you see the save menu.

However, I could find nothing but a resounding yes to question 'is the game worth playing?'. If you love Visual Novel, definitely give this a try.

14416796.review:
Начнём с того, что [b] СолнцеЕздок: Первое Пробуждение/Маска Аркадия [/b] содержит в себе не только статичные картинки с НЕВЕРОЯТНО ОХРЕНИТЕЛЬНЫМИ ЗАДНИМИ ФОНАМИ, но и пошаговую стратегию. Именно из за этого я всё таки решился скачать Sunrider. Раньше визуальные новеллы вызывали у меня недоумевание: Тип кому мжт понравитсья смотрть на слйды с сюжтм вшу мать? Но это было лишь мнение основаное на стереотипах. Теперь, после того как я провёл в ней больше времени чем в The elder scrolls V я забираю свои слова обратно на счёт данного жанра. Ну хватит трепаться и перейдём к описанию сего шедевра.
[h1] Гамеплей	 [/h1]
Как я уже говорил Sunrider состоит из двух частей: Визульной новеллы и пошаговой стратегии.
Касательно стратегии тут всё не что бы и плохо, но ближе к середине игры это стало дико надоедать. Постоянные замесы с 5 - 7 кораблями и/или мехами, после чего прилетают столько же вражеских юнитов (Типо подкрепления), снова замес и так по кругу до того момента когда миссия наконец то не закончится. Постоянно в моей голове висела мысль: Когда же закончатся чёртовы однообразные бои и бесконечные враги, когда экшен закончится и я смогу окунуться в ламповую атмосферу экипажа корабля СолнцеЕздок?
 Ах да, ещё можно прокачивать корабль и мехов, но у меня от этого постоянно мозг кипел, так как пока прокачаешь одному меху то чего ему не хватало, вспоминаешь что у тебя остальные юниты остались без брони и скорей всего сдохнут в следующем же замесе.
На счёт части визуальной новеллы прошу не ругать особо, так как я раньше ни в одну не играл и сторонился их стороной.
Сюжет происходящего отличный и есть даже капелька политики!!11111. Неожиданных поворотов было так много, что мне один раз пришлось прерваться на употребление валерьянки (П***жь). Если без лжи то чёртовы внезапные появиления врага\мощного союзника\фансервиса\[b] СУПИРМИГАКРУТОЙСПАСОБНАЗТИОДНОГОИЗЧЛЕНОВЭКИПАЖИКА	 [/b]\и т.д. сильно поднадоели.
Огромным плюсом является то что игра ещё не до конца допилена, и впереди ещё много чего интересного... Надеюсь.
Членов экипажа я описывать не буду, так как смысла особо нету. И я ваще не понимаю зачем это делают люди при описании визуальных новелл. Всё что я скажу на счёт этого: Все. Все все все. Все тян, да, это огроменный вашу мать гаремник.
[h1] Музыга	 [/h1]
Нормальная... Просто нормальная, обычная, удовлетворительная. Мне особо не запомнилась ни одна из композиций кроме той что была в опенинге. Причины две:
Часть музыки спокойная и медленная.
Я не люблю громкие звуки и выкрутил звуки на минимум.
Тапки в меня кидать не надо, у меня упоротый вкус.
[h1] Корочи	 [/h1]
Визуальная новелла вышла отличная, разбавленная пошаговой стратегией, с не мешающей процессу музыкой, с офигенными персонажами (Чьи имена я всё ещё помню...).П. И самое главное. Анимации не нужны, онли спрайты, онли хардкор.
[spoiler] а ещё тут есть этти [/spoiler]

14414207.review:
Turn based naval combat has been something that's lacking so much in games that I've recently reloaded early 90s stuff like The Grandest Fleet and Lost Admiral Returns. So I heard about Sunrider and gave it a shot (it's free!).

The story is a wacky anime harem setup. Some people are into that, I guess, but I came for the combat. Thankfully you can hold down the enter key and quickly skip through story scenes.

Then you get to the combat and wonder how the hell this got tacked on to some game in a genre notorious for paper thin gameplay to justifyy anime boobs? 

The most accurate description of the combat would be Advanced Wars with space ships, but it's actually deeper and more detailed than Advanced Wars! Lasers are accurate and long range, but are mitigated by shields and armor, but shields also overlap to cover adjacent ships. Kinetic weapons are less accurate, but do more damage and ignore shields but are double mitigated by armor, but armor get shredded the more damage a target takes. There are smaller secondary versions of each, usually used to shoot down less armored but more evasive mechs. Missile barrages are long range and high damage, but are very limited and can be reduced by flak. Rockets are super one shot missiles that cost money to reload and can be easily shot down entirely by flak. Some mechs get a melee attack. What really separates it from Advanced Wars is the tons of special options. You get support units that can temporarily boost your units, shut down enemy shields/flak/targeting, or disable enemies entirely. You get money between battles that can upgrade your regular units, or you can buy allied ships that aren't replaced for free when they die. You get command points between missions that can be used for special orders like boosting firepower, boosting shields, teleporting your flagship, or firing the giant trans wave gun. You don't get enough command points to regularly use the special orders every battle, so they're more of an emergency reserve.

There are a couple of negative quirks though.

It has the same problem as Advanced Wars where long range units are a little too powerful. Missiles are long range and powerful but the units that have them only get one or two shots. Problem is the AI outnumbers you 3 to 1 or more and buries you with missile barrages from across the map. Even if you bunch up all your guys for overlapping flak protection, it's common to lose one or two of your 2-7 units the very first turn before you can do anything. That's still happening to me even after I pour 3 battles worth of money into nothing but upgrading my flak. Worse, some battles have the enemy receiving constant unlimited reinforcements (until a special objective is met) and they all show up with full missile banks. They also have specialized missile ships with tons more ammo than normal and they do as much long range damage as much larger capital ships. Contributing to this is the fact that movement draws on the same energy reserve used to shoot, so moving more means shooting less which heavily favors long range missiles over shorter ranged weapons.

B.S. mission triggers. You'll frequently have missions where surprise objectives or enemy reinforcements show up and totally screw you over, forcing you to restart with that in mind. There's a bunch of missions no way can you beat them the first try. "Destroy the 2 enemy battleships to escape." So you suicide to take out the battleships. "Great! NOW move the flagship to the opposite end of the board!" What? Dammit! *flagship dies next turn*. Escort mission? A squadron of enemy ships will pop up right next to the escort at the halfway point. Dammit! *restart*

Some of your units are crazy useless. You get a mech that's very fast, but very fragile with no weapons other than a strong melee attack for enemy mechs. The best you can hope for is zooming up to an enemy mech and taking it out with a single melee attack before being obliterated by return fire next turn. So best case you make a 1 for 1 trade in a game where you're always outnumbered 3 to 1. You also get a fragile long range sniper mech, but up until the halfway point in the campaign all battle place your units automatically and it always places your sniper on the very front line. It either dies immediately or you waste 3 turns retreating it to the rear and it hardly does anything the whole fight. Most of the time it will be picked off by long range missiles anyway. Sometimes it feels like a waste to upgrade anything but your flagship and buying allied capital ships. Anything with low health WILL be obliterated by missiles in one turn.

It's one of those games where early on is the hardest part (FUCK that transport escort mission!). To avoid ridiculous frustration, turn the difficulty down to "ensign" level at the start. Bump it up a level if things get too easy. Or maybe it's just the escort missions that are B.S. Definitely turn the difficulty down for those.

Still, if you're into Advance Wars type games at all, it's really hard to beat this FREE game. Just be sure to turn off the voices.

Dopo che mi sono accanito contro il computer più e più volte in modalità Captain cercando tattiche su tattiche mi sono arreso appena dopo Fontana capendo che anche se vado avanti buttando circa 8k di comando points a battaglia non riesco a starci dietro con quello che guadagno... rifarò a difficoltà più facile.
Comunque, detto questo, gioco bellissimo! 
Scettico all'inizio non abituato ai giochi con novela Manga ma poi mi sono ricreduto quando i punti come unico uomo e tutto il resto gnocca cosi come il carattere di Claude sono comunque divertenti e irrelevanti rispetto a tutto il resto di ciò che circonda il gioco. 
Trama coinvolgente con un bel sistema di scelta nella quale capisci bene ( a mio parere ) il macchiavellico " il fine giustifica i mezzi " in quanto alcune scelte pur brutte che siano fanno andare avanti in guerra percui complimenti all'autore della trama. 
Il gioco strategico in sè non è troppo complesso capendo da solo man mano le dinamiche e le potenzialità delle proprie unità e i punti deboli di quelli avversari ( perfino in difficoltà capitano si ha il tempo di realizzare come funziona il gioco prima di darci dentro sul serio ).
Per giocarci seriamente però bisogna ponderare bene le mosse da fare e che strategia adoperare per vincere la battagla se aggressivo, difensivo, usare gli assi nella manica o meno e chi o cosa potenziare percui nulla è scontato a mio parere.
Avendo messo il gioco in sè come manga sono riusciti ad illudere, diciamo, la richiesta della alta qualità.
Tutti bene o male abbiamo una certa fame nella grafica ma quello richiede anche una squadra più ampia e costosa percui considerando che il gioco è gratuito hanno fatto un ottimo lavoro, percui l'opzione dello stile manga ha reso il tutto appunto come seguire un piccolo libricino con la differenza di avere alcune scelte e di fare le battaglie e spero non suoni diminuitivo, anzi, è bello riuscire ad entrare cosi in una storia. 

In sintesi, già per il fatto che è gratuito merita di essere installato per giocarci anche perchè ho visto giochi non finiti, con un prezzo direi alto rispetto a quello che promettono, e che fa acqua da più punti.

14273500.review:
So, I finished up to Mask of Arcadius as of this review... where to start? Well, for one thing it's free, so if you have time to play this go for it.

But as for why you should play it, it's part visual novel set in a space opera, part tactical RPG with flying mechs (ryders) and a whole bunch of battleships. For the first part of the game, you start only with the titular Sunrider battleship, a state-of-the-line piece of work that manages to survive the destruction of the enemy PACT militia when attacking your home planet. From there you, as Kayto, try to rebuild your forces and look into new allys for help, from the Alliance to stray ryder pilots here and there (who all happen to be female).

Depending on what setting you chose, the game can be easy enough to enjoy the talking, or a frustrating battleground similar to Fire Emblem games in their punishment. You'll face a lot of enemy ships and ryders, each with their own strengths and weaknesses. The ships are slow and are easy to shoot down with kinetic rounds, but have a lot of HP so until you upgrades your weapons enough, you'll most likely need to fire multiple rounds and hope they don't miss. As for the ryders, they're faster an more up close in combat, from firing lasers to firing missiles. You can either shoot them down with lasers or have your melee fighters get in close and hack them down (while taking counter-shot rounds by the enemy of course).

Sounds a lot to go over, especially with a limited crew. Eventually you can buy crusiers and frigates to add in your party as well, but what they make up in quantity they lack in the ability to upgrade. With the money you earn for each destroyed enemy, you earn a net profit of money (minus repairs) that can be used to upgrade certain parameters of your mechs and Sunrider. From armor, to laser accuracy, to hull points (HP) there's a lot to go through, and you'll need to be smart in what to upgrade. Some take a LOT of money to make work, like the sniper character, Sola, having enough energy to make a sniping shot twice in one turn (since normally each shot costs one).

That's pretty much the tactical part of the gameplay. The rest is visual novel, where you read a story play out with character models talking to your (mostly) faceless hero. Like most visual novels, you can pick a button tab out of several conversation choices that do one of two things; either help give exposition as if you're really questioning characters on an interview, or earn some brownie points with your preferred heroine. Other times it will affect the battles you'll take part in, and one dialogue branch will affect how Mask of Arcadius will end. 

If I had any complaints though, it was how glitchy the game was for me playing through. Some battles were slow to finish loading battle animations (which, btw, are all stilled images to begin with of 3D centric models of ships and ryders). Also the story, while engaging on the morality of war, can be seen as unrealistic with teens fighting and being in position of pilots and captains while fighting the evil empire full of adults. But for what it is, it is a fun game, and a free one at that. Anyone who loves space, anime, SRPG, visual novels, and dating simulation... should play/buy Galaxy Angel. XP But Sunrider is a cheap close second.

Warning: this game contains brief nudity and other suggestive themes.

My review for Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius (or Sunrider only, because Mask of Arcadius is the second episode of the game, and the first one, First Arrival, also included in this game)

So, let's get started. 

Sunrider:

- Free (most important in my opinion)

- Turn-based strategy RPG battle, build your own space fleet with their various upgrades.

- Various difficulties, more challenge.

- Developer Console for the people who's here for the story only.

As for the Visual Novel

- Nice story, Like watching good movies or reading good stories, Sunrider impress me well.

- Various character, with their unique traits, and different background which makes the story more understandable and entertaining.

- The CGs (the visual illustration) are well done, beautiful, and with the good story, makes a great combination.

- Tailored stories, you choose your own path, and some aspect on the story might be different based on your choices.

8.8/10

The game is actually divided into episodes, like what Telltale games did to their games (The Walking Dead, Wolf Among Us, and Game of Thrones), I only tried The Walking Dead, and one episodes of Sunrider is more or less same like one episode in The Walking Dead. The good thing is the first two episodes of Sunrider is completely free, I don't know about the next episodes, though. By the time I wrote this review, Sunrider still on the 2nd episode.

Honestly I'm here only for the story, which is good. And I think next episodes there will be Dating Sim feature. If it's true then I'm looking forward to that.

14176366.review:
Сюжет игры мне сразу же напомнил серию Spinward Fringe: тот же одинокий ударный авианосец наемников на просторах самой окраины обитаемого космоса, мира приходящего в упадок с каждым следующим столениям. Мира, в котором невероятные технологии прошлого либо утеряны совсем, либо они существуют в виде артефактов, которыми знают как пользоваться, но не могут воспроизвести. Даже названия кораблей в чем то похожи - Sunspire (да, его переименовали в First Light почти в самом начале, но все же) и Sunrider. Единственное, что подоплека путешествия в игре более прозаичная - враги, как обычно, сожгли родную хату. 
А вот дальше начинается самое интересное. Игра - это адская мешанина из двух компонентов: визуальной новеллы и тактических боев. Причем содержание визуальной новеллы можно разделить на два основных мотива. Первый из них, как ни странно, это гаремник-эроге. Хотя, вероятно, это наоборот и не странно. Ибо эроге, как и порно, делают буквально про все. Второй же вторит плеяде недавно вышедших антивоенных игр, повествующих о том, что война это не  герои с квадратными челюстями, победы демократии и тому подобное, а грязь, кровь и смерти, в том числе (и, обычно, в первую очередь) мирных жителей. О том, что нет войн абсолютного добра с абсолютным злом. О том, что хотят как лучше, а получается как всегда... В принципе, получилось вполне неплохо, на мой взгляд.
Что до тактических боев, то тут игра оставила двоякое впечатление. Это, конечно, не воргейм, так что заходить противникам в корму бессмысленно: броня там такая же, да и сектор обстрела 360 градусов. Но все достаточно интересно до опредененного момента. Примерно, в районе битвы за Free Port сложность тактических боев слетает с катушек. Игра бросает против вас целые флоты крейсеров, дредноутов и авианосцев. И это не преувеличение, количество противников измеряется десятками. Все превращается в унылые снайперско-артиллерийские дуэли с превосходящими силами противника: либо вы их успеваете расстрелять до того, как они с вами сблизятся, либо они таки сближаются и расстреливают вас. С затиранием клавиш сохранения и загрузки до дыр. А потом игра добивает вас танцем - у противника появляются мехи РЭБ. Которые уютно располагаются за спинами линкоров, обладают высоким уклонением (хрен попадешь даже со средней дистанции) и насылают на вас всякую дрянь: отключение противоракетных батарей, регенерации щитов и энергии, уменьшение точности или же чинят союзников. И их может быть на карте 6+, а у вас один только "Либерти". Я, конечно, не гений флотоводства, но даже на сложности Энсин становится крайне проблематично играть.
К сожалению, не обошлось и без технических неполадок. Когда бои приобретают эпический масштаб РенПи показывает свое истинное лицо - ошибки сценариев начинают сыпаться достаточно часто. С одной стороны это не проблема - и так сейвишся после каждого удачного выстрела, а с другой все же неприятно. 
В целом же, я должен заметить, что сейчас нам пытаются продавать игры куда худшего качества, а тут вполне себе достойный продукт, да еще и даром. Однозначно стоит обратить на него свое внимание.

14139925.review:
One of the best EVNs I've played out here, and it's even above average out of the 200+ Visual Novels I've played. It gives me chills almost equivalent to the ones from MLA (well... maybe using MLA as a comparison is a bit too much - but you get the hint), and the twists are just right.

The most impressive thing about this VN is pacing. Almost everything is done just right with precise timing to draw the best  impression and fun out of this game. I really like Chigara's scientist uniform with that black gloves, Ava is portrayed as a pretty deep character, Sola feels more grounded than she was in Academy and even Asaga definitely has some good times.

The second most impressive thing is the voice acting. I'm not sure how much effort you took to find them, but they fit their chaacters perfectly (well, perhaps except for tsundere spy, but even then). Out of all the characters, Asaga's voice acting is the most fun. Without it her dialogues wouldn't nearly be as hilarious and perhaps come out more annoying than it should be. 

Chigara sounds as calm, collected and intelligent as she should be (which unfortunately I can't relate in Academy). Ava best waifu material in every way (literally). Sola's... the only character who can capture my attention completely with a single, 'Ah?'. Literally the voice I love most in the game.

This game's BGM need not be said. Every single OST and battle music is wonderful.

Gameplay wise, it's absolutely addictive. It's really not anything new, but it's just varied enough, challenging enough and put together with the right formula to make people put themselves through the grinder again and again for victory. So well done; I can't wait for Part 3 to come out. 

Though I must say, it's punishing as hell if you got a bad start since the credit deficit just grows larger and larger until you have no choice but to switch to an easier Mode. I also dislike the fact that beyond the early missions, Missiles are practically useless until you've almost cleaned up everyone, simply because the enemy has superior numbers of flak through superior numbers of themselves. They can Missile Storm the crap out of you, but you can never Missile Storm the crap out of them because for every 1 Missile hit, 10 more were shot down. 

If you can clean up the enemy with Missiles, you probably can do the same with Kinetic or Lasers already. Some balancing is needed here.

Also, why is there no in-game music gallery? The music is probably the best selling point of the game!

I hope the game goes beyond just MOA and gets a sequel in the future. Good job, and highly recommended to anyone who enjoys turn-based strategy with a good story and good gameplay.

14120732.review:
Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius is one of Steam's best hidden gems.  I will start off by saying this--I hate anime.  Yet, somehow, I am in love with this game.  It is a glorified visual novel that gives you choices in dialogue for taste, although they don't exactly change much (or anything) in the storyline.  Beyond the storyline, which is very impressive, is the combat phase, which I believe is easily the best component of the game--even including the hot women, boobs, and great soundtrack.

To make a long story short, without spoilers, you play as Kayto Shields, the captain of the Sunrider, and you are thrown into the middle of an intergalactic war, and are forced to play a vital role, unveiling more and more of the story down the road.  The Sunrider has an array of militaristic power on its vessel, ALL of which are upgradable to what seems like an infinite limit, given the resources.  Throughout the story, you will meet formidable foes and loyal allies, who will join your cause with their "ryders", which are mecha-like space warriors--again, all are upgradable, and vastly different from one another.  

The combat is utterly fantastic, especially if you are a fan of turn-based tactical combat.  You control your Sunrider and the rest of your fleet on a hexagonal grid, using different abilities and weapon types on enemy ships and bases.  The difficulty of the game is naturally VERY difficult, but can be changed at any time, if you're having too much trouble in fights, or want to make things a lot tougher.  

If I have to give any downsides to this game, it's that it simply ends TOO QUICKLY.  Granted, this is meant to be a space trilogy, but I had the same empty feeling beating the second (and most up-to-date) campaign  as I did after I watched Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back--just begging for more, and not able to obtain it.  Kind of like having a poster of Kate Beckinsale in your bedroom.  Speaking of hot women, there are plenty in the game (in anime style, of course), and even some occaisonal nudity.  

This game is ABSOLUTELY FREE, there are no hidden fees, it's not pay-to-win, it's not an MMO.  I would gladly pay for this game, and don't even have to.  Do yourself a favor and at least TRY out this game, because it is an epic space saga that will give you the same feeling as Bill Pullman's spine-chilling speech in Indepedence Day.  

I rate this game an 8.8 out of 10.

14072310.review:
Sunrider is not the most original game you'll play -- it reminds me very much of a Nintendo DS game called Infinite Space -- but it has a lot of heart. 

The turn-based combat takes place on a hex-based screen. It initially seemed a bit slow and tedious, but then I found out that you can speed up enemy animations by holding down the CTRL button. 

This is not the greatest game I've ever played, but it's definitely one of the most enjoyable. In spite of myself, I really came to care a lot about the characters. They're anime stereotypes, one and all, but that didn't detract from the experience. The game managed to make them charming and likable.

To me, the biggest and most pleasant surprise was that the story was actually worth experiencing in itself, rather than being just an excuse to fight in space and ogle pretty women. The combat difficulty can be decreased at any time, and in fact, I'd recommend most players to do that so they can enjoy the story without getting frustrated by the combat, which poses a significant challenge, even at the medium "Captain" level. You face strategic, moral and personal choices, all of which will apparently play out in Part 3, which is due out in the first half of this year.

The game was and will be free, thanks to Kickstarter backers, but I would have happily paid money for this. Here's to Love in Space -- I'm expecting great things from them in the future.

14024072.review:
[h1]Score: 8/10[/h1]


[b][u]Genres[/u][/b]
Visual Novel, Space Warfare Strategy Game, Anime, and Date Sim.

[b][u]Overview[/u][/b]
You are the Captain of a new vessel when suddenly during first day systems testing PACT attacks you. Now you are forced to gather new forces and attempt to take on PACT.

[b][u]Positive[/u][/b]
Well it is free. Can't beat that with a stick and name it Oliver Twist. The combat is ok and the character interactions are quite enjoyable. The animations are farely well done for this genre of game. It also give you multiple difficulty options so you can push the visual novel setting if you really don't care about the combat. It also carries a good sense of humor.

[b][u]Nagative[/u][/b]
The story isn't all that orginal and the degree at which some of the girls hit on you can be a bit over the top. The combat plays out very slow because there is no smooth way to auto skip the attack animations while still keeping you updated. The difficulty differences are huge so I strongly suggest just playing in visual novel mode unless you can handle the slow combat pacing.

[b][u]Conclusion[/u][/b]
If you enjoy mecha with cute anime girls in space then what are you waiting for this game is free and doesn't suck. Those of you like me who don't like mecha don't worry it's still enjoyable. Evidently this game may also be getting an actual sequel in the same universe and I can tell you that I fully support this idea.

[b][u]Value[/u][/b]
Even though this game is free I would value it at around $10. If you like this game go on over and support them on there other game which isn't free. I'd value it at $15 if the combat didn't seem to drudge on forever.

Absolutely would recommend this game.

I was always a big fan of the Disgaea games.  They intermixed focused tactical battles with an interesting and entertaining story.  I think this achieves the same.  It was a very pleasureable and challenging playthrough.

I was very fond of the leveling system with one criticism.  You'll find yourself leveling 'just enough' to get a particular combo you are interested in being able to use.  So you'll experience sudden jumps with specific characters suddenly being able to do their super move twice and the like.  However, this almost exactly suits the planned tactical elements of the game and is likely legit.  Level that character to a good cut off and then focus down another.

Bottom line, great game.  It's got great gameplay combined with a cool story.  The troporific harem is obviously oriented towards a hetero male (and well done!), but if you're missing one or both of those attributes I think you'll have a great play through and some laughs along with it.

13990896.review:
Okay, this is going to be interesting.

Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius

So first of all, what is it? Okay, take mass effect, mash it with your favorite visual novel, then bake it with some really fun gameplay. And then you have this thing.

Lets start with the actual game elements- the tactical combat. While it might have not been the most complex system out of this genre, I found it to be interesting enough to be both fun and challanging. The ability to upgrade your individual units was a very nice touch. Gameplay was really well done, very satisfied.

Now lets move on to the characters/art design. I have to say I really enjoyed the whole artstyle of this game, from the mechs (Ryders) you command, to your crewmembers, it was all very well made. The characters themselves prove to be the best part about this game, each with their own unique personality, if a bit cliche at times.

Okay, here's the big part. The story.
Where do I even begin?
For the most part, it reminds me a lot of mass effect, it has a very similar setting, along with certain other things about the game. For the most part it's sort of cliche, not much done here that hasn't been done before. 
And then there's the "visual novel" part. 
For the first three quarters of the game I was enjoying everything, till about near the end where the main character randomly has a mental breakdown before confessing his love to TWO girls I didn't even care much about to begin with. You're given no choice as to who you want to be with in the story, an aspect which I found extremely disappointing for such an otherwise great game. You are given decisions, which do affect the game, just not quite in the way I'm satisfied with.

Overall, the game is really fun, the gameplay is solid, the characters are great, the overall story is pretty good, but I was disappointed in the "visual novel" aspect of the game.

It is however, free, and gave me about 24 hours of campaign time, so I definately recommend playing this to anyone slightly interested in visual novels, science fiction, or mass effect.

***8/10***

13976062.review:
A very interesting game.  It is a split between visual novel and turn-based strategy and while it is a bit formulaic, it is very fun.  It is also free, so you cannot go wrong if you end up not liking the game.  However, I am quite taken by the gameplay as in some battles, you will eventualy become overwhelmed by enemy reinforcements.  Thus, Sunrider must be approached in a very blitzkriegy way, needing gamers to strike hard and strike fast.  

This is compounded by a so-called "hate" factor within the enmy AI.  Namely, having the same unit kill enemies will increase the overall enemy's "hate" for that particular unit.  This "hate" will be manifested in them targeting the unit, possibly even ignoring the tanky units you place to defend the lightly armored but high attacking units.  While it can be infuriating to see your best units be spammed by missiles, it also introduces another tactical element to the game.  There are some glitches in-game, but only in rare circumstances, it did get to be a little annoying.

The story is more linear than I would like, but seeing how this game has got so much else right, I don't mind at all.  Meanwhile, the decisions you do make through the story truly reveal the kind of person you are, as in a galaxy at war, there are never black-or-white decisions.  Yet, Sunrider also gives the chance for redemption-perhaps not as nice and neat as a fairy tale, but a believeable one.  

If you enjoy good strategy combat and the antics of a squadron of kick-ass girls and one oblivious commander, then this game is a great, free addition to your repetoire.  8/10

13952768.review:
Great visual novel / tactical RPG hybrid. Also totally free!

Apparently the ability to play this 100% gratis is due to a successful kickstarter campaign.

I've paid for far less enjoyable visual novel games before. This is a must-get for fans of visual novel games in general, and if you've never played a visual novel game before, this is a great way to try one out for free.

There is a robust tactical turn based RPG battle system thrown in here to boot! I played on casual difficulty, since I'm mostly interested in the story portion, but even then I was surprised at the combat system. It's quite fun!

It's hard enough to find a visual novel style game that manages to get the writing, art, characters, and plot lines right like Sunrider does, but adding the entire tactical RPG battle system as another layer on top of it? I can only think of a handful of other titles that have even attempted this, and not all of them even managed to make as fun and interesting of a system as what Sunrider has.

The soundtrack is pretty great! I especially like the track that plays when you are selecting the next areas to visit. There is some pretty solid lore to this story and some good background info on locations, surprisingly more in-depth than I was expecting for a free game. The voice acting is a little hit and miss, but since most visual novel games like this have little to no voice acting at all, I can't really knock it for including that much extra.

It is worth noting that the age rating for this title is 17+ according to the developers, so this isn't something you necessarily want to be playing around the kiddos. That said, I have put about 8 hours into my file and have only seen one scene thus far that would qualify, so it's not like there is excess adult content in every other scene or anything like that. The bulk of the focus of the game is on the story and characters, and of course the battle system, and that's all the better in my book.

Should you happen to want the uncensored version (the Steam version is censored in some way apparently) there is a patch with directions available from the developer's website here: http://sunrider-vn.com/sunriderpage/

They have a new title in beta at the time of this writing, Sunrider Academy, which is going to be a prequel of sorts to this game in the timeline (Sunrider Mask of Arcadius' story references the characters' time at the academy more than once, so it should be an interesting tie in/spinoff) and there are other titles available on the sunrider website that are free to download and which are not available on steam as well.

Should you happen to enjoy Sunrider and want to check out some more, give the Sunrider website link above a look.

13949270.review:
To get the bad stuff out the way, the combat section of the game is horribly optimized, occasionally running into glitches (which is perfectly acceptable for a free Early Access, of course!), highly allergic to alt-tabbing, certainly far from balanced in most scenarios requiring one to be liberal in their application of the difficulty settings, and generally being slow all round.
There are also a few signs here and there of sub-par quality control.  Nothing deal-breaking, but simple repetitive things.  Like being able to hear the click of Asaga's VA releasing her PTT.
THAT SAID:

Those are two of my three only complaints.  I loved it.  The story is riveting and characters are fantastically loveable.  The soundtrack is wonderfully fitting.  And for such a simplistic and intuitive system, the combat mechanics are actually very complex and demanding of some thought.  I found myself actually having to plan out my expenditures for research and fleet composition in order to be able to best tackle the enemy using my preferred strategy.  The animations, while simplistic, are certainly immersive.  The AI can occasionally even pull out some interesting tactics that force me out of my usual strategy.  It was certainly the most entertaining 25 hours I've spent in a game in the past 6 months at least.
In fact, I could even say I had FUN.  Which is a refreshing experience these days.

And of course, the most important part of any game, the real keystone of any enjoyable gaming experience: Were there any moments that truly stood out, that will jump to the forefront of my memory any time I think of the game, ones which instill in me a sense of excitement and desire to jump right back into the game?

"This is my command: prepare to fire the Vanguard cannon!  Vanguards, fire!"

Now for my third and final complaint.  The cliffhanger has left me wanting more!  The itch left me by this game cannot be scratched by anything else on the market!

13918123.review:
Summary: If you wanted Mass Effect to be a Tactics RPG and Animu as all fuck then this is your game. Surprising level of depth, aside from not having all the episodes released (so incomplete in story/content but complete in terms of game mechanics), I can only nitpick and it's completely free (zero microtransactions, but the final chapter will cost money to anyone who did not back the kickstarter).

I wanted to try this game out because the thing I liked most about playing Mass Effect and Telltale's The Walking Dead was not the shooting or QTEs, but having a group of likeable characters you interact with, getting to know more about them through conversations and making difficult choices that can affect them for better or for worse. Not to deny that the white haired sniper chick wasn't also part of the reason why. :3c
I have to say, the plot was surprisingly good, and the especially ending was very memorable, the characters are likeable enough, the lore is fairly interesting. The choices are morally ambiguious and they did a good job at making me really think about what I wanted to do, though I can't tell how much of an impact they really have on the storyline. Though I do want to point out that the opening narration is a bit stupid. It isn't a big deal because it does not have much affect on the plot, but to say that humans have subjugated (their words, not mine) all alien in life in the galaxy, then saying that PACT is bad because they are conquering the other human planets is a bit hypocritical. 
The combat is also surprisngly enjoyable, I'm not an expert of TRPGs so maybe it is not the best, but I felt it had enough depth to be enjoyable. The Mechs (Ryders) are very diverse, have unique mechanics and I wouldn't say any of them are useless even if their roles may overlap at times (support, anti-ship, anti-ryder), they all do their roles differently. The kinetic/energy/missile damage types make for interesting tactical choices; do I want to sit back safely with accurate but weak energy weapons? Or close in and rely on kinetic but eat plenty of shots I might have otherwise evaded? Do I shoot my devasting but limited use missiles towards the front line to reduce the interception chance, or target the flagship in the back with the knowledge that I will be using my missiles in an ineffiecent manner as the enemies they bypass will increase the chance of my enemy shooting down the missile salvo? Do I want to use a melee Ryder to ohko an enemy Ryder if it means giving my enemy a free attack by getting with their "counter attack" range?
Also, having some attacks have multiple shots with their individual calculations to hit and armor/shield reduction being per shot made the difference between a rapid fire kinetic assault rifle and a single shot kinetic cannon important, as they can do more damage per turn in different scenarios rather than one being directly better than the other. For example, a heavily armored oponent will absorb plentiful weak shots, and at long range multiple shots spreads out the risk of missing a shot at the offset of lesser damage potential. 
I do want to say that the upgrade system is a bit weird, if I put points into one and try to take them back, I don't get all of my money, but I didn't know I was immediately buying the upgrades because it looked like I would have to "confirm" my upgrades beforehand if I could immediately remove them. So save because you upgrade as to not accidentally spend money on the wrong upgrades. Some, like effiency for weapon types, seems like a useless until you put a lot of cash into it and upgrade your energy storage. While it was very useful in the later game, as I could get two shots with my powerful weapons instead of just one each turn with the right mix of lowered cost and higher energy per turn. But it was almost pointless at the start to get those upgrades. But again, not a huge deal as long as you plan ahead.
The only big critique is that not all of the "episodes" have released yet, but even then, that just means some people might want to wait until all of them are out before they start it.

13888055.review:
Why is this not more well-known? The story is interesting, and throws you through loops at times.

The combat system is easy to grasp and the battles are almost always fun. The variation between your own mechs is interesting and makes you really think about how to spend your credits for upgrades. The moral choices are a lot grayer than the classic "A) Kick puppies, B) Don't kick puppies" choices a lot of other games have. It'll actually push you to choose between soul-satisfying morality and sheer pragmatism without making your character out be an angel from above or a Grade-A asshole depending on your decision.

If you're up for a challenge, Sunrider's got your fix. Its curve gets really steep, really fast.

Voice acting is pretty good for a free VN. Though the limited dialogue selection in combat will wear on you sometimes.

That being said, there were some issues:

The difficulty curve steeped just a little too fast. This might only be an issue on account of me being a crap captain, though.

There are practically no side missions before you've collected all of the ryders; which you'll need to collect more credits and command points than what the main story missions provide. So unless you're playing anything below Captain, be prepared to face a near-endless parade of anal destruction before you finally achieve victory. Don't get me wrong, victory is still possible, but it takes a ridiculous amount of luck (Get on your knees and pray to RNGesus, heretic) and retries.

I like having romantic options in my VNs, but I didn't get any of that despite the very distinct implication that there were going to be routes for the girls. The options weren't so much absent here as they were dangled just out of reach. You'll start with the feeling that you have actual choices in regards to who you end up with, but one girl is practically being forced on you (though it did make for good dramatic scenes) the entire time. The greater story and the combat missions more than make up for it, but if you're here just to claim another waifu, you won't get anything substantial. Might I recommend waiting for Sunrider Academy to come out?

The Skip Mode (Press Tab to toggle) is a godsend. It makes it so you don't have to sit and watch for 2 minutes as the enemy inundates you with missiles and lasers. Unfortunately, it'll also skip through mid-battle dialogue, and you can't scroll up to read it if you missed it.

Overall 8/10 

I can't wait for the next installment.

13809601.review:
Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius ist ein Visual Novel, welches die Geschichte einen intergalaktischen Krieges erzählt, in dem eine Organisation namens PACT die Galaxie bedroht. Man selbst schlüpft in die Rolle von Captain Kayto Shields und erlebt so hautnach was die PACT so böse macht. Je länger man spielt desto mehr Verantwortung bringt es mit sich und es tauchen unterwegs sowohl neue Verbündete sowie Feinde auf. Neben den normalen Visual Novel Featuren gibt es noch eine gelungene strategische Seite des Spiels. Die Kämpfe werden in rundenbasierten Schlachten gespielt, bei denen man die volle Kontrolle über seine Einheiten erhält. Das Spiel ist zwar noch in der Beta, aber es bereits durchaus ein Meisterwerk. Wenn man sich mit der Story auseinander versetzt kann das Spiel einen sowohl schöne als auch traurige Momente liefern sowie die Gefühle ansprechen. Sunrider hat sehr viel Potenzial und seine Story ist wirklich unglaublich.

Pro
- Tolle Bilder, sowie Animationen
- Verdammt gute Story
- Einfache Steuerung
- Sympathische Charaktere
- Wunderbare Musik
- Mitgefühl und Spannung
- Nervenkitzel
- RPG Feature

Contra
- Einige Bugs, aber es ist ja noch in der Beta

Fazit:
Ich bin sowohl sprachlos als auch fassungslos. Das Spiel hat meine Erwartungen um 1000% überboten. Es ist wirklich ein Meisterwerk.

Punkte
- Story 9,4/10
- Charaktere 9,5/10
- Grafik 8,5/10
- Gameplay 9,2/10
- Musik 9,8/10

Ergebnis: 9,28/10

13807623.review:
首先，免费这点让我进行批评的起点就低了那么一些（笑）

游戏挺不错，可能因为我比较喜欢战棋类的游戏。
没有全程语音也算是一个缺点吧，不过毕竟免费游戏（对话部分没有语音）。英文语音好评，氛围塑造的很好。Sunrider的Officer——Ava这个角色不错，语言简洁明了，我很喜欢www

独显+集显的笔记本默认会使用集显运行这个游戏（我就知道），但是用集显在战斗部分还是有些卡顿的，所以要怎么做大家都清楚。

试玩视频看样子的录不成了，该死的Shitplay肯定又是不支持的。


====下面是来自1年多以后终于想起来认真玩通关以后的测评====

其实steam版根目录下就有ogg格式的音乐，这游戏的素材根本没封起来。
右键游戏 -> 属性 -> 本地文件 -> 浏览本地文件 ，在 \game\Music 里面

现在这种剧情里面有影射并讽刺现实的AVG不多了。Galgam在文字AVG系列里大行其道。很多人都把文字AVG跟Galgame划上了等号。
说起来这游戏影射得也不多。一个东西方冷战；一个北约干涉第三世界国家内政并抢夺资源，还用“授人以鱼”的援助美化自己；一个第三世界国家的人民一遍接受北约的援助一遍帮助本地反抗军。
大体就这么几个，不过都是影射（当然玩家一眼就看得出来的），毕竟这游戏的背景都已经是太空时代了。
===================
最后说一下音乐。首先主题曲《Sora_no_Senritsu》（空の旋律 = 空之旋律）开始听完全没亮点，然后通关以后越听越好听大体上可以和《白爱依存症》的ED《キミとの未来》划为一类，就是“没有故事支撑的话完全不好听的歌”。不知怎么的，虽然这首歌的演唱并不是里面的某一个声优，但是我就是觉得这首歌就是给主角的青梅竹马以及主角的大副——Ava唱的。另外这首歌要听出感觉最后的选择一定要选“让Ava下去手动发射主炮”（然后Ava在启动主炮以后就牺牲了）原因嘛，首先这游戏后半剧情赶工明显，好结局的剧情跟前面的剧情对比起来太扯。其次，本来主角最后就是被复仇冲昏了头脑（BOSS炸了他出生的星球，相当于杀了他全家吧），强行要干BOSS，所以我觉得把剧情里仅剩的一个跟主角很亲的人（青梅竹马）也送掉才符合常见的剧情发展（复仇成功，自己也无亲无故了）。
剩下的都是BGM，几首战斗的BGM倒还是挺好听，最近玩WT的时候基本都是听这几首。
======================
最后说下别被上面一大段骗了，首先这游戏除了正经的“主角复仇”剧情线，还有一条主角开后宫的线，然而很遗憾并没有人物线可以选择（看最后的彩蛋这条线的剧情是之前在Kickstarter上由那些赞助的人投票决定的）。
其次这游戏在steam上要求年龄验证的原因……就因为这游戏的CG有两张上半身裸体的图（还他妈是一张构图，就是表情不一样）。妈的这种强行R18的作者我真是第一次见。
最后这游戏的战斗部分是回合制战棋，默认的captian难度就已经很难了（上面还有两个），我用S/L大法都要疯掉了。只看剧情的话推荐难度选择里最上面那个，翻译过来就是“视觉小说难度”。
