13746279.review:
So, ten hours of gameplay. So Steam says, but considering I played quite a bit of it offline I'd reckon it took me around 15-20 hours to complete a playthrough of both "First Arrival" and "Mask of Arcadius" (the two chapters currently available; more are expected to come soon, still free of charge).

Okay, let's get to it, shall we?

[h1]THE PLOT[/h1]
Let me explain: the "plot" and the "script" are entirely different things. That said, the plot is somewhat decent, although nothing to write home about: one-ship-army (sorta) against the OBVIOUSLY EVIL totally-not-space-commies. It is, however, quite well done. The pace of the story doesn't drag too heavily, [strike]the characters[/strike] the waifus are likeable to different extents (did I mention this involves a male captain with an all-female crew? Well, at least all the crew we get to see) and the captain is not a total moron like is usually the case. 

[h1]THE SHINY PARTS[/h1]
Graphics are anime-style, I personally liked them. It's 2D so not overly impressive, but the icons are clear and functional. The menus and combat UI are definitely something that [i]can[/i] be improved from a comfort standpoint (sometimes selecting units is... well. Hit and miss), however. The sound is acceptable and the BGM is nice, but the voice acting is... well, it ranges from tolerable to SHUT UP ICARI [spoiler]Still second best waifu[/spoiler]. 


And now, for the part nobody cares about lately in reviews. [h1] THE GAMEPLAY[/h1]
So, you think this is a visual novel, right? Well, it is! But, surprisingly enough, you GET to play (unless you scum your way with the aptly named Visual Novel Difficulty, but who am I to judge) around with a cruiser and space mechs that have quite interesting quirks. Battles are set on a hex grid, and... well, kinda sorta like every other tactical squad game ever invented, but you are not restricted to move-attack-end like, for example, XCom or Fire Emblem are. Every ship has a number of Action Points per turn, and every weapon (or movement) has a different cost. Also, units can be upgraded, there are several types of weapons and defense systems and special orders to be given. All in all, I've seen better battle systems, but this one gets the job done and it seems the developer is patching on occassion, so I can't complain much.

[h1]SUMMARY[/h1]
All in all, if you are into this kind of game and don't mind the fanservice (which, for now, is not overboard and there aren't explicit scenes unless you install the uncensored patch from the devs' website) I'd say go for it. I mean, it's free. If it wasn't... well, right now I probably wouldn't pay for it since it isn't completely finished, but it shows promise: I would consider it a worthy purchase after the rest of the main story is released.

13732209.review:
When I first saw Sunrider, knowing nothing about it, I expected it to be another mediocre amateur visual novel. Picked it up because I saw some nice reviews. The fact it was free was the deciding factor. I was still skeptical about the game in the first hour of so of gameplay, but at that point, it had already surpassed my low expectations with pretty good artwork and a surprisingly awesome soundtrack, so I pressed on. I'm glad I did.

[b]Before I say anything more, I haven't completed the game yet[/b]. As I write this I am 16ish hours into the game and have no idea how much longer I have until it ends. Was itching to write something about this game, so consider this a mere first impression.

I'll start with the storyline. Generally speaking, it's your typical sci-fi-themed "bad guys want to take over the galaxy" plot. Nothing revolutionary, but it's something anyone can get behind. Not to say that it's too bland-- one event in particular substituted otherwise obligatory deus-ex machina for an interesting character development, so there's more to it than initially meets the eye.

Next up, characters. Like the plotline, the characters never stray too far from their respecting tropes. Any fan of anime, manga or other VNs will immediately notice this. You are given your standard-issue sassy girl, shy girl, ditzy girl, tsundere, kuudere, etc etc characters to work with. Most people I talk to either love or hate that sort of thing. Some, like me, will find them endearing, others may feel apathetic. You decide.
The main bad guy (thus far) is the malicious masked villain with a penchant for evil laughter. I'm hoping that more will be done with him later on to make him seem less silly.

As for gameplay, Mask of Arcadius features a turn-based strategy element for its battles that can be summarised in one word: CRUEL. I am playing on the default difficulty setting as I usually do for my first playthroughs of games; in this case, the 'Captain' difficulty. I fancy myself a pretty good tactician, especially when it comes to turn-based strategy, but I am stuck on one mission right now that I am semi-convinced is impossible [at this difficulty] without spending your upgrades and command points flawlessly up to that point. The difficulty levels' descriptions give you fair warning and are changeable in game, but this will be the first time that I have to undergo the moral seppuku of lowering a game difficulty below default. It got to a point where my squishier units were being picked off by missiles before my 2nd turn. Even when they miraculously survive, it isn't long before a horde of missile-spewing reinforcements arrive as the final nail in the coffin. Seriously, I haven't died this many times since my first playthrough of Dark Souls.
The combat system might benefit from a bit more tweaking while it's in beta, but the gameplay is still very fun and incredibly satisfying to finally win against the always unfavourable odds the game will throw at your from the very beginning. If for nothing else, you should play the game on this merit.

13724782.review:
This game, which now goes by "Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius" and is FREE! on Steam, is flat out amazing. Here's why:

Overview: The game is divided in two modes; visual novel and hex tbs (turn based strategy) space fleet engagements.

The visual novel is basically you getting to enjoy and even interact in a very competent anime story with yes, all the typical things like a Tsundere, bashful loli, sexy nympho etc, but also done in a very thoughtful way with very good story telling and good art.

The tbs portion is simply awesome. You get to command a kick ass capital ship and several mechs with their own abilities and pilots, earning money to buy upgrades between missions and at intervals throughout the game more things become available such as eventually building your own FLEET. You heard me, as in command allies to make up a battle group...(EPIC)

Here's a breakdown of my personal rankings for this game by category:

Art: 8/10 It is well done, crisp, and detailed. You can tell it was on a budget, but also a labor of love.

Sound: 8/10 Sound effects are sometimes a bit repetitive, but overall good quality.

Music: 9/10 Music plays reacting to what you do, how the battle goes, and what happens in the story. Excellent music on it's own as well.

Voice Acting: 9/10 The voice acting is superb, 9/10 because the game would have benefited from more varied character lines during battle scenes that can get repetitive, and the Captain's Iconic "FIRE!!!" during the Vanguard Cannon attack (Super Yamato Cannon kind of thing) is a very unexcited "fire.".

Story: 9/10 While not perfect, the story is engaging, well written, exciting and full of expected and unexpected twists, but all of them are satisfying, even if you're able to see them coming.

Gameplay: 10/10 The gameplay is highly satisfying, much more than what you'd expect for a game like this, there are multiple levels to the gameplay mechanics, and rpg elements like special skill system, levelling up skills, abilities, items and buying allies will blow you away.

Overall Quality: 09/10 By this I mean the structure of the game, saving, ease of menu navigation, audio/video options etc. The only thing missing is an option to disable screen shake when someone takes damage during battle scenes. Well done indeed.

Verdict: 10/10

Yes, the scores themselves don't add up to a perfect 10, but when you consider that this game is an addictive, superbly made gem that delivers on way more than the standard VN (I usually NEVER play Visual Novels) and the last, but not least most important factor of it being ABSOLUTELY FREE when I would have happily paid at least 10$ for it, this game is a real special treat, and I hope that the creator(s) make much more for us to enjoy in the future. 

I'm very happy I stumbled onto this gem and will happily tell all my friends about it. It deserves all the support it can get!

13690708.review:
This really is a free game, no hidden pay-to-win or anything like that, which really threw me off. But it is the first in the series so maybe their angle is to sell the other episodes. At first, I wanted to pay for it, simply by virtue of it being free. I felt indebted and wanted to reward such generosity, but I wouldn't have bought this game if it had costed something from the start. Why? I don't play visual novels and for good reason. But this is also a strategy game.

Cons
  The battle system, which makes up about 80% of the game or so. Specifically, that End turn button, which doesn't even 
prompt "are you sure?", which led to many mistakenly ended turns, which in this game could prove fatal.
Why? Because of the difficulty, and it's not just that it's hard, it's seriously unbalanced. Your tiny fleet is going up against wave after wave of enemies, whose stats are generally as good if not better than yours, the only thing you got going for you is your human brain, but that won't be enough if you're a normal person. I've been playing these kind of grid based strategy games for years, FF Tactics, Ogre Battle etc, and I had to constantly switch to the easiest difficulty, especially on those god-awful escort missions where the enemies will not ever stop spawning.
  On the "recommended" difficulty levels, you would be spending all your AP of say maybe as many as 3 units, just to kill 1, One! Enemy unit. And it's like that turn after turn because of how the weapons are tuned. For instance, there are no area-of-effect attacks, none. So you have to target one single unit with each attack, even if that unit is down to 1 HP, he's still gonna be just as functional as if he was maxed out, meaning you would have to waste valuable AP to pick off someone who ought to be neutralized by now anyways.
When the big ships explode, they don't do any damage to surrounding units for instance, which would have been a great a-o-e attack and would have seriously cut down on combat time, not to mention balancing the injustice in being outnumbered every fight 10 to 1.
If you're a few steps away, you will be doing a whole lot more missing than hitting, but move close enough to hit and the enemy's greater numbers will crush you. 
  Every single god damn round you have to listen to the voice actresses whining horribly (and I do mean horribly, it really shows that they did it for free). Select your unit? Move your unit? Shoot? Get hit? Enemy just missed you? Whine, whine, whine! All the time, it cannot be turned off, it cannot be skipped, and they only have about 2 lines for every occasion.
  Now imagine you're up against a fleet of 35 or so ships, which isn't at all unusual in this game. Each of those ships gets to attack you, and for every attack, and every "frame", you have to click. Which means, if the enemy explodes, you have to click 3 times just to get through the freeze frame explosion (which is horribly loud and buggy btw).
So when it's the enemies' turn, it's moving, click, attacking, click, whine whine whine, click, confirm damage, click, repeat, rinse, ad nauseum. And this goes on for god knows how long, feels like an eternity when you're doing it, I can tell you that much.

So that's the combat. The visual novel sections are kind of clichéd and at times it feels like the choices you make have no impact whatsoever, which more often than not, is completely true. That being said, there were a few laughs in there, and some sweet moments, but the damn thing ended on a cliff-hanger, after some extremely badly balanced battles, without any satisfying closure so I feel really cheated about that.

Pros
  There is a decent game in there, if only it was polished up a bit more. The combat section should definately be overhauled. And let's not forget that you're getting it for free. It's worth at least a try, I'd value it to be worth about maybe 2.00 - 4.00$ in its current state. But I am hoping they keep polishing, because if they do, then they'd have a great game here.

13670856.review:
If this was a 5€ game, it would be worth it. If this was a 2.50€ game, it would be a must buy. Being free, there is no reason not to play it. It will only cost you 10+ hours of gameplay, and it's worth every one of them.

There's no sex and only one nude picture. If you are searching for porn, you won't find it here, but you'll get a pretty good visual novel. And free.

Now to the game itself: 
There are two aspects of the game, the visual novel aspect and the strategy one. In both cases the game does some things incredibly well and others... not so well.


First, the game as a visual novel.

The story is quite good. It's not the best plot I've ever seen (in fact, it's pretty linear) but it works, and it's interesting enough to keep you playing.

The characters are outstanding and well made. They may be the typical anime characters (the shy one, the serious one, the one who hides her feelings, the joyful one, etc) but they never feel plain nor boring.

The diferent choices you can make are interesting. It's not just the overused "are you a good or bad guy?". There are some tough decisions to be made. The downside part to this is that this choices have no impact on the story... for now. The only real choices you make is taking the side mission A or B, but this does not affect the ending or the storyline. However, this may be changed. Or at least, I hope so.


Now, lets talk about the game as a strategy game.

You play on a hexagonal grid, giving orders to your units and taking turns. There's a good variaty on units, and the game is quite challenging. You need to know how to use your different units to achieve victory. Or, altenatively, you can take down the difficulty level, if you are just interested in the story of the game.

There's also the option to upgrade your units, and it's really intersting how the upgrades you buy affect your overall strategy. The upgrade system works pretty well, however, I don't think some of the upgrades are balanced at all. This is a ver minor issue, though.


I'd like to mention that the soundtarck is outstanding and really enhances the game. The artwork is also really good.

Overall, this is a good game, and I'd recomend it even if it wasn't free. The fact that you have to pay nothing to play it is mind blowing, and it's a must get.

13660635.review:
3/4 thumbs up


PROS:

- The combat system is sound and very enjoyable.  It makes the game playable and is the sole factor in any replayability.
- The story, though straight-forward, is enjoyable and easy to get behind as you portray the main character.  It's about 10 hours long.
- It's free.


CONS:  (this list is longer, but the issues are smaller)

- I would have appreciated some guys in the crew.  The all-girl crew wore on me, especially when they all started to vie for the Captain's (your character) affections.
- I felt like there wasn't enough money to properly upgrade and equip myself for battles on the harder settings.  Anything higher than Captain was impossible, and Captain was incredibly difficult after I got a few missions into the game.  I even had to drop it down to Casual for a few of the "boss fights" because they were that ridiculous.
- Lasers don't seem at all viable as a weapon route since laser damage is mitigated by both armor and shields, and shields can be extended into other hexes providing cross-over protection for ships.  You can deactivate shields one target at a time, but the amount of energy used for lasers, plus the generally low damage, makes going the physical route much more effective.
- The story gets rather sexually graphic at a few points, which is completely unnecessary.

OVERALL:

- I'd recommend playing the game if you enjoy tactical combat games.  Also, it's free.
- If it ever goes on sale for more than $5, wait for a discounted price.

Игра просто великолепна!
Честно сказать не ожидал от нее чего-нибудь особенного и решил поиграть только из-за необычной смеси ВН и ТПС. Однако как же я ошибался. Игра превзошла все ожидания. Но не обошлось и без недостатков (пусть и не сильно важных).
Самое главное - в игре отличный сюжет. По началу ничего особенного, но чем дальше в лес тем серьезнее выборы приходится делать. В какой-то момент я поймал себя на мысли что мне страшно сделать тот или иной выбор =)
Персонажи: В принципе тут вполне стандартный набор персонвжей типичный для какого-нибудь аниме-гаремника (если вы смотрели хоть один, то поймене). Тут вам и цундере, и кудере, и генки и т.д. Однако несмотря на шаблонность за ними приятно наблюдать, так что создатели хорошо постарались в их создании (со временем начинаешь им сопереживать).
Боевая часть: Очень интересная с большим разнообразием возможностей и тактик, однако (на мой взгляд) баланс немного хромает. Возможно это я плохой тактик, но капитанская сложность (нормальная) довольно хардкорная, особенно в эскорт миссиях. Так же есть некоторые неприятные мелочи. Например: у санрайдера на определенном моменте появится executive order resurection который позволяет вернть на поле боя подбитую единицу с фулл хп, но с израсходованной энергией. А в похожей ситуации с врагами, когда кэриэр выкидывает парочку райдеров, райдеры сразу ходят в этот же ход. Кажется мелочью, но имхо это серьезный недочет со стороны баланса.
Еще есть возможность поставить патч который возвращает в игру сцены 18+. Вроде называется Resurection Patch или как-то так.
Минусы: пару раз вылетала unexpected error, но это очень редкое событие, да и игра в разработке так что это не удивительно. Игра серьезно подтормаживала на моем ноуте, но думаю что это проблема ноута, ибо на нем многие игры тормозят в то время как на стационарном (спеки которого примерно в 2 раза ХУЖЕ ноута) все шло без проблем.

Может чего и забыл сказать, но в целом игра отличная. Всем рекомендую поиграть в нее.
Итоговая оцента 99/10. Один балл снял за перечисленные минусы...

13585569.review:
Sunrider is one of those games that tries to do a number of different things, and taken individually, those individual things are all done really well.  It's a visual novel, featuring both deceptively interesting characters, and a surprisingly intriguing plot with strong moral choices that put cost, risk, and moral implications all on stage without simplifying those choices and taking away their weight.  It provides believable tales of friendship and romance alongside a bleak galaxy beset by a seemingly unstoppable force of evil, and both disparate sides of the storytelling work really well.

At the same time, Sunrider is a tactical RPG, urging your to carefully level up your characters to face the challenges before you.  Even playing on the normal difficulty however, you never feel like your characters are quite strong enough to make the battles easy.  This is a game which, to its credit, actually presents a serious challenge.  As the game progresses, you unlock new characters to send into battle and your strategy constantly evolves throughout the entire story.

All that praise aside, I wouldn't quite call this a perfect game, or a perfect visual novel.  There are still enough blemishes  that some people could potentially be seriously put off by.  The biggest offender here is, ironically, the difficulty.  I enjoy a good challenge, and challenge is definately something Sunrider provides.  However, battles, especially later on, can be slow, plodding affairs, and defeat can easilly creep up on you without you even realizing it.  It can be frustrating to spend an hour waging a battle, only to find yourself stuck and needing to start over and try from the beginning.

Additionally, the slow pace of the battles are often at odds with the Visual Novel elements.  As the story starting hitting its stride, I found myself turning down the difficulty just to get through the battles as quickly as possible and continue the story.  The game's difficulty does give the player a taste of the hopelessness the characters must be facing, and that taste is exhilarating at first.  But eventually it turns bitter, and you find yourself wishing for the war to end just as much as the protagonists.  In a way, that empathy is a good thing that not many games can accomplish.  It's still a frustrating thing to experience though.

On the visual novel side of things, there's less to complain about, other than the gameplay sections somewhat breaking up the pacing, as mentioned.  Some aspects of the story can seem unnecissarily sleezy, if not outright unsettling, but some may enjoy this aspect of the game more than I.  At the very least, the writing is good enough, and the characters are interesting enough, that it's easy to overlook these aspects of the game.

Frankly, in spite of all that I might have to say against it, I was enthralled by Sunrider.  I loved the story, and the characters.  I loved the harsh, and serious nature of the moral decisions you're forced to make, and when it's not being too frustrating, I even loved the challenge of the tactical combat.  More tactical games should take advantage of the hex grid, and it's used very well here.  Overall, I very highly recommend the game to fans of visual novels, or just sci-fi and tactics rpgs in general.

There is one final note I have to mention, however, and that is that Mask of Arcadius is techincally only (presumably) the first 2/3 of the story.  The first two parts of the story are available here, but expect a cliffhanger until the third part is released, and that's presuming that the story ends in that part, and doesn't continue any further.

13583990.review: good game quite fun nice story and free what more do you want

13577663.review:
How the fuck do I even say Yes or No to this bastard child? How can I just simply submit all my ideas to a simple and common yes/no answer? Well I guess I just have to, and hopefully by the end of writing this, I'll have my thoughts straight.

Okay look, Visual Novels are a guilty pleasure of mine. Anime used to be a guilty pleasure of mine as well, until I was able to understand, identify, and justify my own interest based on the solid writing, emotion, sound, and fantastic animation. 

But Christ on the cross! I just can't justify Visual Novels, almost to a point where I feel a bit of unease and disinterest in them. Look, when I found Katawa Shoujo, I fell in love (well, yeah, with Hanako), and the writing and characters made me feel interested even though those things were conveyed to me in a really fucking simple and lazy method. Regardless, I loved it.

You know what else I loved? Fire Emblem! Tactics, strategy, customization and preferences, sweet tales of kickass and clutch moments, straight up using cleverness to beat the shit out of your enemy and destroy all of their team.

WHAT HAPPENS WHEN YOU PUT STRATEGY TOGETHER WITH A VISUAL NOVEL? IN TANDEM WITH THE INCLUSION OF SHITTY MUSIC, HORRIBLE DIALOGUE VOICES (ESPECIALLY THAT MAIN FUCKING CHARACTER), LAZY WRITING, BORING CHARACTERS, BORING FUCKING AESTHETIC DESIGN, AND SOME KIND OF PREMONITION THAT YOU'LL ESSENTIALLY BE AN ANIME CAPTAIN KIRK??????

Well, you get a game that I kinda liked. I wanted to progress my story with Chigara or whatever her name was, and just completely gloss over every other girl because I was disinterested. I wanted to improve my ship in case I wouldn't be able to survive the next fight. I wanted to keep going and find another male character (there are very few, and most are your enemies). I wanted to win the fights against the fuckwits of whereversville in the idontgiveashit galaxy.

Look man, play this game for like, 20 minutes. By then you will have experienced it all. You will be able to determine whatever it is that you want from the game.

AND IT'S FREE. THAT'S SWEET.

So yeah, I'll recommend it. I just need to get back to the game so I can fuck Chigara, learn more about her story, and get that stupid war over with.

You basically go through the whole story to get to the final battle and brick walled out from completing it. 13552925.review:
Ich bin äusserst positiv überrascht von 'Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius'.

Angetreten mit der skeptischen Einstellung: Oha, eine Novelle. Ob das mit der Stimmungsübertragung (Japanisch - Englisch) wirklich klappt?

Und ja, das tut es. Und wie es das tut:
- Der Sound reisst mit und ist treffend auf die Sequenzen abgestimmt.
- Der 'rote Faden' ist von Anfang an vorhanden.
- Abhängig von der eigenen Spielweise (-vorliebe) kann man sich entweder voll auf den Storyfortschritt oder das Schlachtenschlagen festlegen. Wobei beides je nach Wahl entsprechend umgestezt wird, keine Seite kommt zu kurz.

Es sei angemerkt das es sich bei dieser Novelle um keinen Movie handelt. Die Spielgrafik mag irgendwo angestaubt rüberkommen, mich stört dies aber nicht im Geringsten. Das Gesamtbild passt.

Ich habe als 'Storyjunkie' binnen ca. 14 Stunden gespielt und frage mich gerade:
Ist da etwas was ich evtl. anders machen sollte oder könnte? Ich denke ich werde die Tage über nochmal ansetzen und sehen wie sich mit anderen Entscheidungen der Handlungsstrang entwickelt.

Insgeheim frage ich mich: War das schon alles? Ginge da nicht 'noch mehr'? Das ist aber nur Wunschdenken meinerseits.

Ich wage zu behaupten das sich hier ein einfallsreiches Entwicklerteam zusammen getan hat das es schafft den Sprung aus dem Asiatischen ins Europäische gekonnt umzusetzen.

Bitte mehr davon! :)

13548296.review: Sehr gute Story und ausgefallene Strategie in den Raumschlachten. Es hat mir richtig gefallen dieses Spiel gleich 2 mal durch zu spielen, ich freu mich schon auf die 3 Kampange. Großer Daumen nach oben von mir!

13545843.review:
Евангелион-стайл пошаговая тактика на базе графической новеллы (движок [url=https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ren%27Py]Ren’Py[/url], тот же, что и у [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/alpasy/recommended/331470]"Бесконечного лета"[/url], н-р). Сюжетная завязка у новеллы достаточно стандартная для космической саги, соответствующие стране проихождения персонажи тоже не способствуют погружению в атмосферу (мгновенно начинают верещать датчики кавайного сумасшествия):
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=357917296

В описании игры почему-то нигде не указано, но это всё ещё бета, а это чувствуется на каждом шагу. Полетели в погоню за рабовладельцами, угнавшими с планеты каких-то девушек? Бандитский флот разбит, миссия закончена, в ответ тишина. Что с девушками? Зачем мы сюда летали? (вместо того чтобы напасть на базу пиратов) Все молчат. На экране битвы довольно сложно что-то понять. Каким типом оружия пользуется тот или иной враг? К какому у него, наоборот, есть броня? Почему какой-то корабль нельзя атаковать [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=360973504]энергетическим мечом[/url]? Что даёт аура щита вокруг одного из начальных кораблей? Нет ответа. Довольно средненького качества анимацию и картинки по ходу битвы замучаешься прокликивать после каждой атаки. Прошёлся как-то по меню, игра вылетела с ошибкой. 

В целом меня лично "Санрайдер" ничем не зацепил, а вы, если желаете, можете попробовать. Благо проект бесплатный, ничего не потеряете, кроме самого ценного - своего времени.

13544886.review: Very well written and intelligent in terms of the story and verbal atmosphere. I was really impressed. The artwork is exceptional for both the characters and scenery. I highly recommend you download this and try it out. It's free, so why not? Just be ready to put a solid 8-10 hours to finish this all the way through, depending on the battles. The later battles can get  annoying even if you are playing on the visual-novel difficulty (or maybe I just suck at the combat style, lol). This is all coming from a guy who isn't the biggest fan of sci-fi anime or tile-based combat, by the way. I'm really looking forward to the sequel! Keep up the great work!

13538156.review:
[h1]Баланс, баланс, - еще раз баланс! Наверное... если бы не некоторые детали[/h1]
[spoiler]Прим.: если вы решили начать проходить игру по-честному, на среднем уровне сложности - положите на свой стул сковороду с хорошим антипригарным покрытием.[/spoiler]

Итак, в галактике бунт - силы ПАКТ хотят завоевать нейтральный периметр, а потом пойти и дальше, Альянс боится за свою шкурку, но войну не начинает, пираты тоже влезают сюда и под руководством Козетты Космос вставляют палки в колеса. Картина а-ля Скайрим - ББ против Империи, да еще и Талмор затесался (у которого, естественно, как и у пиратов - свои интересы в этом противостоянии). Наш ГГ - капитан с планетки Серра, удосуживается созерцать уничтожение своего родного города Серра-сити огромным главным кораблем флота красных - Легионом (а еще там умерла его незадачливая сестра). Корабль кэпа, он же Санрайдер, единственный, что не был разбит флотом ПАКТ, сбегает. Не имея райдеров на борту и побитый. Тут все и начинается, вам предстоит найти себе экипаж, принять несколько важных (или не очень) решений и выиграть войну. Я не буду дальше говорить про сюжет, лишь скажу, что он вполне интересный и фейспалмов особо у меня не было (разве что, только в двух моментах). 

Перейду к сути - боям. Эта часть довольно хорошо реализована, но *****! Когда противников на карте около 15-ти - я просто устаю жать пробел, чтобы пропустить очередной выстрел "воон того зеленого райдера" и "того красного". Почему нельзя было сделать какую-нибудь штуку, например, меню, в котором можно просто посмотреть итог хода противника, вместо того, чтобы бесконечно жать на кнопку? Конечно, выглядит это не так уж плохо, но это очень долго и утомляюще. Но это еще не все. После появления саппортов и несущих кораблей - понадобится сковорода. И если с несущими можно легко справится применяя тактику "варп + залп из вг + конец хода/варп", то саппорты очень хлипкие, но бесячие твари, а тратить на них очки командования летая по карте - не самая лучшая идея. К тому же, они имею высокий коэф. уклонения, из-за чего ваш снайпер вряд ли в них попадет, если из него не выкачают энергию, конечно. Именно поэтому я настоятельно советую сохраняться во время каждого диалога, чтобы быстро начать бой заново. 

Естественно, можно улучшать райдеры и сам корабль, но прикрепить другое оружие, либо выучить способность (дизейбл/лечение) - нельзя. А в команде дизейблер только один.

Почему же я рекомендую эту игру? Во-первых, есть хорошая озвучка (я залип на одну фразу Асаги, помогите), чего у многих VN нет, во-вторых - сюжет простой, но немного интересный, в-третьих, в игре довольно красивые задники вместе с рисовкой персонажей (но не генерал Грэй, нет). Да еще и это все - абсолютно бесплатно.

[h1] Если откинуть детскую доверчивость и преданность Фонтаны, если закрыть глаза на "тот момент с похищением ГГ" и на некоторый имбаланс - вышла вполне неплохая новела с пошаговыми боями, и, несколько анально-подогревающим балансом.[/h1]

13535718.review:
Sunrider, the Mask of Arcadius, is a turn-based space and mecha combat game on a hex-based board with an interactive visual-novel filling the gaps in between.  The characters are your run-of-the-mill anime stereotypes, still there are some good lines to be heard or read along the way.  The sound is really good and the music is phenomenal!  The actual combat gameplay is really solid as well.

Even if this wasn't free, I'd recommend it.  Since it is free, why aren't you already playing it?

13510892.review:
Un jeu de stratégie sympathique!
Si vous aimez les jeux d'echecs, lançez vous.

Gameplay?
La jouabilité est facile d'accès et l'ensemble du jeu peut se jouer avec votre unique souris.
Trop simple? Et bien non. Alors même que le jeu se présente utilisable par tous, le challenge reste au rendez-vous. Vous allez devoir trouver de bonnes stratégies (ou baisser le niveau de difficultés).

Scénario solo?
Faire des combats oui, mais pas stupidement. Dans un univers pas mal fichu, vous devrez faire face à des situations complexes. Choix difficiles sont au rendez-vous et c'est d'autant plus important quand on sait que vos choix font le scénario! Un rpg/Strategie donc ce "Sunrider".

Et le reste?
On l'aura compris, l'univers Manga-Futuriste fera penser à de (Trop?) nombreuses heures passées devant des animes. Le style graphique est plus que joli même si le manque d'animation peut en offusquer quelques uns. 
La musique (et pas seulement celle de l'openning) est somptueuse et valorisera vos combats.

Petit manque?
Pas de Multijoueurs.
Des doublages supplémentaires ne serait pas de refus... Histoire de ne pas faire face à un Roman.
PAS DE TADUCTION EN FRANCAIS (Sortez votre dictionnaire).

En bref?
C'est gratuit est plutôt sympa, alors pourquoi pas?
Au final, il n'y a rien à perdre.

If you aren't a fan of the typical Anime Harem trope, you may want to stay away or at least act as militarily professional as possible in the game. it ends a bit abruptly but from what I can tell, more, FREE, episodes are coming.

7/10 would waifu again

13468928.review:
Авторы бережно скопировали все характерные особенности игр подобного жанра, поэтому если вы таковые не переносите или не готовы закрыть на некоторые условности глаза, проходите мимо. 

Итак, персонажи нарисованы весьма средне, мало деталей по сравнению с задниками. Выбор не влияет на сюжет практически никак. Отдельного пинка заслуживает боевая система. Поначалу проблем с ней не возникает и в плане прокачки вполне хватает того, что игра в состоянии предложить. Но чем дальше, тем хуже. Когда количество противников приближается к двум десяткам и хочется использовать более тонкую настройку оснащения экипажей... оказывается, что ее нет. Активные модули закреплены за строго определенным юнитом. Но хуже всего то, что прокачке они не поддаются. Оружие тоже менять нельзя. Керосина в огонь подливают юниты противника. Некоторые из них совсем читерские. Как вам корабль с кучей здоровья, который стоит позади основных сил и каждый ход спавнит два бронекостюма? А если я скажу, что он такой не один? На втором месте по назойливости расположились вражеские саппорты. По одиночке они не производят впечатление грозных противников. Вся соль в том, что по одиночке они не ходят. Трое таких молодцов за один ход могут отключить ПВО и щиты трех кораблей. После чего на них обрушивается шквал ракет, который никак нельзя отразить. Подобное оппонент может проделывать каждый ход, т. к. механизма отката модулей в игре нет. Но не стоит отчаиваться, число ракет конечно и потом эти ребята будут снимать щиты и откачивать энергию, необходимую для стрельбы и активации модулей. Убивать их наперед практически нечем. Снайпер всего один и даже он не всегда может в них попасть, т. к. у них довольно высокий параметр уклонения. Если же энергию отберут у него, то стрелять он не сможет совсем. Лазеры, которые по задумке должны использоваться на дальних дистанциях, во второй половине игры с учетом резистов выдают удручающе низкий урон. Поэтому для дальних целей лучше использовать диверсионную тактику: варп к цели > залпы кинетикой > варп обратно. Кстати, тот самый уберкорабль, упомянутый выше, способен призывать и саппортов, которые могут его ремонтировать  (и не только его). Ах да, модули саппортов действуют на все поле боя со 100% шансом. Слава балансу!

Техническая часть. Очень неотзывчивое управление в бою. Клик мыши обрабатывается игрой не сразу, что порядочно раздражает.

13425708.review:
This is not a strong recommendation. I like the first few chapters. There is some fun dialog and the story is interesting. The combat is quite satisfying. However, towards the end of the current game (as of December 17, 2014), the combat is extremely tedious. There are just so many enemy units that keep spawning on the battlefield. In game it is called Warp Signatures, or something. It is not really that challenging per se (at Captain level) but it takes so much of your time. You will have many units to give orders to as well. I have decimated the enemy suffering no or next to no losses and yet the story does not reflect that. My opponent somehow outsmarts me. Then there is some more cutscenes and eventually another long tedious battle that I crush but still lose out in the story. I am unclear as to any romance options my character can have. That is not so important to me but there are some rather long cutscenes. I prefer these to the battles lately. I want to finish the game but I can't get past the last few battles. They just annoy me too much. I can't get into it without spoiling too much of the story. The story itself can make one apathetic. It is hard to know on what moral ground one is standing. Ultimately you fight PACT. As you progress through the story, the sense of hopelessness grows. I actually feel sorry for this captain. 

I would like a better technology tree, if possible. Experience is essentially money you earn from destroying enemy ships. I like the Mark improvements to skills but it would be nice to have something new to strive for. 

I might try again at a later update. I will likely select the easiest setting just to progress through the story quickly, and to avoid the long battles. This is as much me as it is the developers. I have trouble finishing many games because to make the game challenging all the way through, one has to either make enemy units ridiculously tough, or spawn an absurd number of them. In this case, it is more the latter. 

Right now I give this game a 6/10. There is room for improvement. I love that it's free!

13418436.review: Fun game to play on nintendo 64dd.

13413143.review:
Boy I hate to be the downer review on a free game, but...

Personally I found this game not to be worth my time, and I typically finish every game I own, even if I got it for free/Its not very good. I got to near the end (I believe), but if you're sitting and hoping this is the last encounter as you try it for the third time in aggrivation...its really not worth finishing. I'll go over the three main points I found lacking.

VISUAL NOVEL: As a visual novel, it is -really- lacking. The characters are rather boring, and the choices you make during the story very clearly do not affect what is going on...later on there are a few choices the game doesn't even acknowledge, and just keeps going. I understand branching paths in a strategy game is rather difficult, especially for a free project, but I have seen it done well. If nothing else, at least give the illusion your choices matter, or don't give them at all.

STORY: As with the above, the story is very bland, and you can drive holes through some of the pieces of plot. I didn't expect Mass Effect or the like, but the characters really drag things down, the whole thing just starts to mesh together, and at the end I was skipping through the flashbacks with annoyance, as they really didn't add anything to the plot other than what felt like an entirely pointless sex scene and to give a reason why we should care about generic dead sister that has not been mentioned until now.

GAMEPLAY: Urg. The sad thing is, the strategy part of the game is very well balanced, with different weapons having different uses. The problem is, the game is balanced, but the fights are not. If you're going to send the player up against 5-1 odds or more, they need to have a significant advantage on their side. You don't. You will often lose units in the first turn of a fight just due to sheer overwhelming firepower. Your units are in general more powerful than similar enemy units, but only in options. Your units are very set in a certain role, and tend to get easily knocked out of it. The sniper unit that can one shot almost everything? Completely useless once the enemy starts getting units that decrease your energy, thus letting her do nothing the entire fight. The buffer unit who can heal or disable units? The same. The other buffer unit? Can't even do that, just a vague 'aim decrease' or damage buff, neither of which makes an appreciable difference. The first mech unit you get in the game? Her major attacks are lasers, which tend to be useless when enemies all start having shields, missiles which go the same for flak, leaving her doing about nothing for most of the game. I hate playing on anything lower than normal, but the first escort mission forced me to do so as you are quickly overwhelmed with no recourse or alternate strategy other than 'try again and get lucky' and even at a lower difficulty the later missions got overwhelmingly onesided, without the abusive strategy of 'warp and major cannon death'.

Yes it is free, and its not completely worthless, but it is -very- aggrivating, and there are much better games to spend your time on, even if you have to spend a little for them.

13407492.review:
La combinaison VN et Tactical RPG est une bonne surprise et j'ai passé quelques heures très agréables sur ce jeux. Les personnages sont attachants et on se laisse prendre par l'histoire même si elle est des plus classiques. J'ai quand même trois regrets.
Tout d'abord pour ce qui est de la VN, peux de choix et ils ne semblent pas, à quelques rares exceptions près, avoir une réelle influence sur le déroulement de lhistoire.
Ensuite au niveau tactique, les choix de développement et de tactiques sont limités, très limités... à tel point que j'ai fait le choix de l'option combats simples afin de les terminer au plus vite sans les "skipper" totalement. Les commentaires des différents personnages durant les combats et l'explosion des vaissaux ennemis faisant partie des petits bonheurs bien agréables de ce titre.
Enfin dernier regret, l'histoiree s'arrête en plein milieu... Alors à quand une suite pour terminer de libérer la galaxie et en découvrir tous les secrets?
pour le reste, bande-son plus que soignée, carrément inspirée à certains moments et qui colle parfaitement à l'ambiance de l'histoire, dessins impeccables (du moins pour ceux qui apprécient le style manga/animé), attitudes des personnages  variées.
Conclusions: un jeu fait avec des moyens clairement limités MAIS manifestement par des passionnés qui ont font de leur mieux pour offrir aux joueurs une expérience de jeu bien plus que sympathique. Que demander de plus ? Ah oui, à quand la suite ou un autre titre dans le même univers?

13401074.review:
Not a bad game, rather challenging though the focus on specific "winning tech" is a bit limiting to gameplay. While nothing sends an enemy cruiser off fast like a gauss kinetic slug through the hull, streaming lasers don't get the same love, so it's Kinetics, Kinetics, Kinetics. The improvement to your AA flak is a bonus that stacks too. Pulse lasers are not as bad considering that they are designed to kill small armoured targets like frigates and bombers.

Not bad all in all, but long range lasers need a boost. Lower firing cost maybe?

As for the story, some parts of it are maybe idealistic to a naive degree, but other parts really blow your mind. For those in the know, you can really end up writing an essay on if Grey's actions on how he saved his ships was a good thing or bad! He saved his people the only way he could have possibly done so, by grasping and crippling the enemy's motivation, but the action was literally "all evil". Yet it was the only way I could see that he could have saved his men. Does that make him a good guy or bad? Or just someone doing the best he could and coming out looking like an ass?

13362800.review:
This is easily miles better than many of the games I've purchased on steam, in particular it's better than the "Early Access" train wrecks that sometimes cost nearly the price of a retail game.  This one is fun, has replay value, scaling difficulty and a moderately decent storyline if you're used to jrpgs. This is really worth a playthrough, and then maybe a second playthrough at a harder difficulty.

There are a few bugs in the combat system, particularly around trying to select invalid targets. These lead to python crashes, but the system uses rollbacks and autosaves frequently and quickly (no long pause while it saves)... I suspect the AI forgets its hate on reload, but this is a rare enough problem, and is easily avoidable (and you may never see it as it's a result of a weird combination of mistakes. Speeding through the combat animations can sometimes lead to clicking on a place to move, which can scuttle a whole battle at the harder difficulties, if you're unlucky, so move slowly. Skip-mode in combat is very convenient to speed up end combat, but there is no combat logs for details (a small thing), and I couldn't find a way to turn this on/off, safe to have clicked "skip" on the dialogue before combat, and then it turns itself off partway through combat.

Still, an amazing game, even if it were at the $7--$10 range (maybe even higher)... and it's free.

[Please note that the game is still in development at the time of this typing]

PRO
This is a pretty interesting one thanks to the politics and the ethics involved in the player's decisions. If you really get into it, it might make you think a bit seriously about what kinds of decisions YOU really want to make, and why.

PRO or CON (depends on how much you enjoy challenge)
The battles can be pretty frustrating. Because there is an element of chance involved (how much there is depends on how we play), an unlucky turn can really turn the tide against you, especially in those battles where you're hanging by a thread as it is. x_X;
Then again, there is the option to play with much lower difficulty levels, although I haven't tried that yet. ^.^;

CON
Combat screens and animations do not unfold smoothly, so it can feel pretty glitchy getting through them.

Overall, and especially because it's free to play, definitely recommended.

It's great!  If you like visual novels and always wanted some tactics and some choices thrown in.  This game is for you.  How much would I've paid for this game?  Other visual novels that I've liked generally go for about $10.  I would pay it, easily--but even better--it FREE!

The game, the visuals, the music, the opening...everything feels like your playing an anime.  I highly recommend acquiring this free game.  It's worth a play through.

13231394.review:
Офигенная визуальная новелла и тактическая игра. Прошел 2 эпизода на одном дыхании за 4 дня (примерно за 15 часов). А учитывая, что игра переводится на русский язык + бесплатность, так вообще шикарно. Я не знаю, чем руководствовались разработчики, что отдали игру задаром, ведь от продажи игры они могли бы собрать хоть какую-то сумму на такое великое дело, и сделать, как сказать, с еще большей отдачей и любовью (На такое и я денег не пожалел бы и купил ее примерно 150-200р). Но это их выбор. Насчет перевода. Выражаю почтение людям, кто занимается также переводом этой игры. В России мало игр такого уровня, пусть и "любительского", да еще на русском языке. 

     Далее. Насчет игры. Я слышал о сложности, прям геометрически возрастающей по мере прохождения, поэтому со спокойной совестью взял из предлагающих 6 уровней сложности 3 ( стандартный выбор игры - №4).  У меня получалось идти в игре вообще без потерь (кроме 1 раза, где убилась Икари в битве от моей жадности, захотелось пофармить денег на бесчисленном респе вражин за ход). Отмечу, что учитывая даже такой выбор варианта сложности, без спасительной кнопки SAVE/LOAD это был бы уже зубодробительный экшен, где головы наших героев уже в начале игры были бы в качестве сувенира у наших особых товарищей, владельцев чудесной собачки под названием "супердредноут LEGION". Денег, особенно во 2 части, более менее хватало, ~5к за бой для меня была норма. А с расширением возможности покупки кораблей Альянса это многократно улучшило мне игру и расширило возможности на тактическом поле. Основные проблемы, которые ты увидишь на этом выборе - это мясо, которая давит тебя кол-вом, твои хп и баловство ИИ с ракетами, которыми он безжалостно тебя закидывает. А еще бывали случаи, когда за 1 ход мой корабль убивался с 2200 ХП. Вот и думай после этого, стоит или не стоит варпаться поближе данным кораблем, чтобы подразнить их кучку деревянных корабликов от 900-1600 ХП кормовой пушкой за 2500 очков. Насчет роботов ... Все неплохи, хотя возможности Икари меня больше радовали в игре. Это единственный дамагер, который может 1/5  карты пролететь, кого-нибудь прирезать и с довольной миной вернуться обратно в окружение дружественных кораблей. Конечно, крупняк она убивать не в состоянии, но просто испоганить жизнь вражине и подленько так смыться она вполне может. А уж в комплекте с системой "Серафим" от персонажа Сола, то просто сидишь и говоришь вражине - "Давай, давай, что ты мне еще сделаешь!" 

     Графика в игре. Она слабовата. Но честно, в данной игре она меня устраивает вполне, ибо тут ведет сюжет, хороший тактический бой и яркие персонажи. Игра бесплатна, какие могут тут быть графические выверты? Любые возмущения, я считаю, должны идти лесом, такие люди могут создавать свою фирму и делать свою красочную игру, о которой мечтали.

     Персонажи. Часть людей говорит - опа, стандарные клише в характерах. Все как всегда, ничего нового. Я тоже с этим несогласен. Разработчики неплохо проработали общение между персонажами, разбавив их шутками в суровой повседневности. Я уж не говорю о том, что у каждый из них со своими заскоками, что добавляет яркость и свежесть к каждой персоне. Озвучки как таковой нету, только в бою. И английская, но отврата не чувствуется.

     Музыка. Для "любительской игры" - божественный уровень. Она отлично сочетается с действиями в игре. Выражаю свое уважение композиторам. Скачал из игры и слушаю время от времени.
 
     В игре есть глюки - скажем, есть такие моменты, когда ты прерываешь анимацию "загрузкой сохр." в игре, она считает, что анимация не прошла дальше и дает вылет в основное меню. Далее. В основной меню в строчке Bonus при 3 выборе игра выдает код. Неочень хорошо. 13199898.review:
Really disappointed with this one. I don't play a lot of them, but I'm a big fan of tactics games like Advance Wars and Fire Emblem. I obviously wasn't expecting such perfectly polished and balanced gameplay from a free visual novel but man... even my low expectations weren't met. The combat in the game is slow, frustrating and boring. Just look at the demo video on the store page. A single round of one (1) player turn and one (1) A.I. Enemy turn is 4 minutes. FOUR MINUTES! It's not four tatical minutes, four minutes of asking 'what's my next move...?', it's four minutes of animations! of boring, samey shooty laser animations. Since every battle happens in space the developers haven't created terrain elements so you fight on an open field, because fighting takes place on an open field the devs found it appropriate to make movement and attacking draw on the same action resource energy. Attacks don't have a fixed range like in a Fire Emblem game, but longer distances effect accuracy. So when, exactly, is it optimal for me to waste a third of a unit's energy to decrease its chance of being hit by 15%? Battles turn into stagnant ships firing lasers at each other turn after turn, missing then doing minimal damage then missing. The appeal of space battles is totally free movement and this game seems to miss this point all together. 

Why do I have to click to advance the screen after an attack completes? Why would a still image of ship stay on my screen when nothing is happening? Why doesn't this advance automatically? Why does the game let you end a turn without any warning while you still have energy left? This might not happen a lot, but since your end turn button it right next to all your attack and ability buttons, it will happen a few times at least. Also, mousing over certain corners of your action buttons, including the end turn button, causes the screen to scroll. You can't adjust the camera during attack 'animation' sequences and the camera doesn't auto focus on battle action so if you've accidentally scrolled away from the tiny part of the map where units actually are, get ready to have a fun enemy turn trying to get the camera centred! Alternatively, you could just mash left click until it's your turn again. You won't miss much.

As for the visual novel aspect of the game, I'm unimpressed. If a bunch of anime girls in tight clothing explaining the plot is what you look for in a game, more power to you. When you start with one of the most generic openings and hero motivations (a shady empire destroyed my home) and deliver it in the most predictable way imaginable (what a nice peaceful planet i hope nothing happens to it; alderan much, anybody? hyuk) its hard for me to get invested. When the dialogue isn't gripping because its riddled with anime clichés it's hard for me to get invested. When the game introduces a non-visual novel game mode that drags down the whole experience, I delete local content and move on.

13181759.review:
This game proved to be something completely unexpected. 

At first I seemed skeptical since it's a visual novel that isn't imported from Japan and was instead made as a kickstarter project that's free to play so quality control was a concern. I was deeply surpised at how well the game turned out. Sure some polish could be applied here and there especially with a bit of the dialogue but what is currently there ended up being really well done. 

And I wouldn't really call this a visual novel even though it is a visual novel at heart. It ended up being more of a turn-based tactical combat game with RPG elements that just happened to use visual novel elements for its story telling. And everything running on Katawa Shoujo's renpy engine no less. INCLUDING THE BATTLE SYSTEM. I CAN'T BELIEVE THEY SOMEHOW MADE IT WORK USING THE REN'PY ENGINE.

As for its combat system, I'm deeply impressed. I haven't invested this much time planning, plotting, and banking on percentage probabilities since XCOM and I ended up enjoying and being more frustrated with the combat scenes more than the visual novel scenes ever did. I would say that the game itself would not have made me feel the way it did without the combat in place. Winning against the enemy's flagship? Gripping if told in a visual novel format. Actually fighting it and planning your strategies so that you take the least amount of damage possible while finishing it off in the quickest way possible? Rewarding to the utmost high. 

In the end this is a game I would recommend to fans of space operas, strategy games, and visual novels. Since it takes all the best elements of those genres and blends them into a game that truly exceeds expectations and went well above and beyond what I expected from it and becomes something more than your average run-of-the-mill sci-fi visual novel.

13140677.review:
Так и должна быть сделана Визуальная новелла с элементами стратегии!
И хотелось бы заострить внимание на некоторых вещах. Рисовка может и не лучшая, но все сделано прекрасно. И я не знаю что ещё сказать про местную графику. Меня от неё не тошнило, коридоры довольно светлые и кораблик довольно уютненький. 
Боевая часть хромает у игра шкале сложности растёт очень быстро. Правда я не уверен, что это не у меня проблема, но всё же сложность битв от простой до очень сложной вырастает очень быстро. Не уверен есть существует ли Новая игра+ , но что-то мне подсказывает, что самый высокий уровень сложности будет пройти не возможно при первом прохождении (да и со средним проблемы возникают). Однако эта проблема не только данной игры. Многие коммерческие проекты имеют похожую проблему, но наличие НГ+ и небольшие хитрости со стороны играющих помогаю решить эту проблему.
Хорошо подобранно звуковое сопровождение и неплохо сделана озвучка персонажей. Жаль что озвучены они только в битве.
Если взять историю, то... Она неплохая, те кто делал модель цундере для Sakura Spirit должны стыдится своего творения, вот как должна вести себя боевая цундере! Но всё же это стандартный гарем: набор девушек разной степени привязанности, самые распространённые модели поведения... почти все (таки холодных "друзей детства" я ещё не встречал, да и с извра... вообщем заявка на победу) и самое главное ты должен делать выборы, которые привидет тебя к сближению с одной или другой героиней. Я ещё не завершил первый акт и потому не уверен насколько это заявление честное, но по крайней мере это мождет быть реализована в релизной версии. Единственное моё желание, чтобы игра выбралась из 17+ в 18+, маленький демон в моей голове хочет увидеть насколько далеко могут авторы завести линию с "докторшей".
По сравнению с многими инди проектами в которые я играл этот может стать очень успешным... или скатится к моменту релиза. Но суть не в этом. Если они смогут начать запустить свой собственный станок по производству ВН, то я буду в них играть. Только если они будут развиваться или хотя бы оставаться на данном уровне, но не очень долгое время.
И небольшой список вещей которые мне не понравились: непропускаемый опенинг; клише цундере; клише моэ; клише Рей (если нужно слово, то кудере); Rance в юбке (было такое впечатление, может и немного преувеличил); бесполезный "медик"; персонаж ориентированный на ближний бой воносится так же легко как и снайпер; со стороны врага нет ориентированных на ближний бой юнитов; почти невозможные для выполнения самоубийтсвенные миссии; невозможность попасть с 30% и менее; движок во время битв лагает и временами сильно лагает.
И повторюсь, игра мне понравилась.

13129199.review:
I played the first 2 (of 3) of the releases of this game.  (The 3rd has not been released, yet.)  This review will reflect my experience with the story as it has progressed thus far.  This game is composed of a Story (i.e. Visual Novel), and a series of many tactical Combat Sequences.  I will rate them individually.

Overall, I give this game a 2 out of 5 Stars.  That translated to a mild Thumbs Down, with some specific caveats.
* Story: 4/5
* Combat: 1/5

This game is a Free to Play (F2P) game, so I have no issues in terms of value vs. price.  However, I did notice many small issues in the dialogue where the phrasing didn't quite match the context.  I'm not sure if this is due to a translation issue, or whether it is consistant with some international style of anime I'm unaware of.  Either way, I found it mentally jarring and annoying.  ("North" in terms of galaxy star maps, space ships being "Sunk" instead of destroyed, etc.)  It was consistant, so once I was able to accept it, I could play on.

The story itself was fascinating to me.  Especially the forced choice situations with murky morality and ambigious contexts.  To me, this was the highlight of the game.  I rarely really have to *think* through decisions in an RPG; this game had me mentally biting my nails, wondering if I had chosen wisely.  

However, on the flip side, the combat was very frustrating.  The game, despite the tooltips, doesn't explain what is happening very clearly.  You often have to learn by obvervation, the hard way.  On top of that, it's "supposed to be hard", at least according to the developers.  Those combine easily into scenarios where you make poor decisions in upgrading your ships and suddenly end up with a fleet that is unable to beat an opposing force, two or three combats/story elements down the road.  (Even after you drop the game difficulty to the easiest level.)

I started this game on Captain difficulty.  I made some mistakes, in restrospect, in terms of upgrades.  Plus, the game acelerates the difficulty very sharply.  One minute you can complete a battle with almost no damage, the next battle suddenly your entire fleet is wiped, repeatedly.  To me, this is a sign of poorly designed mechanics and game design.  (I did an experiment with the highest difficulty setting - Space Whale, and discovered that I often got wiped out on the intro [easy] battle.)

However, it was fun enough that after I dropped it to the easiest difficulty, I went back and restarted the game.  (Thank goodness for the elaborite "fast forward" skipping options.  Maybe that is a hint of how often they expect players to need to restart.)  I tried it out on Ensign, and then restarted ... again.  By now I was quite frustrated, since I had now invested many hours into a game that kept putting me in dead end scenarios.

I looked up support forums, and found several of the things I had done wrong, and then tried again.  The reason I'm giving it 3 stars overall, is that I felt the game was good enough to restart instead of merely abandoning it.  However, I was very frustrated along the way.  

I finally "finished" the game [up to the end of the second part] on Visual Novel difficulty, and just "Auto Won" some of the battles I had played over and over again using the developers debug mode.  Once I caught up to where I had left the story previously, sometimes detouring through some of the choices not previously taken, I was able to enjoy the story again.

Overall, I enjoyed the story, but hated the combat.   I tend to like tactical games, but I'd rather play a combat game that took the time to impliment it in a reasonable way, instead.

At this point in time, I'm not sure whether or not I will play the 3rd chapter when it comes out.  I'm just glad to finally be finished being frustrated with this game for awhile.

13091625.review:
Come for tactical space battles - stay for the plot. And the uh, "plot".

To be more elaborate, this game did an excellent job of being just intriguing enough to pull me in - I'm a total foreigner to visual novels, so this is a game that wouldn't normally have crossed my radar. The combat is fun, difficult, and each battle almost has a puzzle-like quality to it. Once you finally figure out the winning strategy, you feel great. It IS difficult, though, and can be frustrating until you finally hit on that winning strategy. Of course, you could always surrender your pride, and lower the difficulty...

My impression of visual novels before this was probably like most people's - it's interactive pornography, right? And while that may be true for some - it certainly isn't true for Sunrider. The characters are well-developed, and they develop well. These aren't static characters - they're affected by your decisions, and it shows. It's a testament to the game's excellent writing and storytelling that the all-female cast doesn't come off as silly. 

My favorite part of the game so far has been the decisions forced upon you. Lots of games have branching storylines, and different outcomes based on your choices, but very rarely are those choices difficult to make. More often than not, there's a clear cut "good" path, and an equally obvious "evil" path. This game doesn't do that. You lead a ship in the middle of a brutal war, and the story reflects that. Rarely is a choice obvious, and even after making the call, you're likely to agonize over it afterwards. 

This game is difficult, it's dark, it's brutal, but it's also really really fun. The gameplay is fun, the story is exciting, the characters are interesting. And it's free. There really is no reason not to give Sunrider a shot. Fans of visual novels will likely love the game, and for everyone else, I say give it a shot. This is a game that will surprise you.

13087359.review:
Regardless of what I tell you below, I recommend that you TRY playing this game. Theres a million good reviews and I might be the only person having maddening problems with this game so chances are, you'll enjoy it.  However, not an hour into the game I began to feel like this game might just be unplayable without tearing my hair out from annoyance. These are the problems I have been dealing with..  

This game seems to have mostly good reviews and I'm not surprised. I am really enjoying the story so far and the gameplay is creative and fun in concept. OH and I LOVE the music in this game. ...But I am frustrated with my game being slow. There aren't really and graphics options and there really don't need to be. I don't have a custom built gamer-tank of a computer, but I doubt this game is meant to be demanding..

I don't know if I'm alone in this, but transitioning between shots in the battle scenes is hell. After whatever animation has occurred, I find myself constantly wondering if the game is waiting for me to click before it transitions (I'm still not sure). This wouldn't be so terrible if there wasn't a short cutscene initiated by each attack (this early in the game I'm using at least 5 attacks in the round. on top of that, you are often facing many enemies, which means many, many choppy cutscenes). 

The screenshots of this game show cool and unique icons representing each unit. I am not seeing that at all. I see the hexagons and numbers representing unit health, move distance, etc. In addition it takes at least five seconds after clicking a unit for its stats or options to pop up. Not to mention the occasional (Program Not Responding) issue upon selecting units.

Overall, I think this game is great in story and gameplay, but the slow interface has left me utterly exhausted and feeling like the extra three hours I expected to stay up playing this wouldn't get me very far at all. I'm just going to go to bed..

13059784.review:
Overall, if I had to choose one word to describe Sunrider, it would be "surprising." Going in, I didn't expect too much. It's a free indie game funded via kickstarter, and while it made several times the asking amount, fifty grand or so still isn't a lot of money to make a game with. Particularly a game that's basically two genres in one: A turn based strategy game and a visual novel all at once. You can tell its production values aren't as high as bigger titles; the artwork is sprite based, and it uses ren'py as its engine. It has none of the stunning 3d visuals big ticket titles boast.

But somehow everything fell into place, producing a game that's surprisingly deep and compelling and, most importantly, fun. 

The game basically has two types of gameplay - there's a strategy portion where you command space battleships and smaller attack mecha called "ryders" on a hex-based field, going by turns, and a visual novel portion where you interact with a cast of quirky characters and trade funds acquired by blowing up enemy ships in exchange for upgrades to your ships. 

The strategy segment reminds me of Master of Orion 2, or possibly some of the really old SSI goldbox titles; its basic mechanics are simple enough to figure out quickly, but mastering how it works takes longer. Each unit has 'energy', which can be used to move, shoot, or use abilities, similar to the concept of "time units" in the old XCOM games. Ships have a variety of weapons from missiles to lasers and gauss guns, all effective against different defense types, and oftentimes have special abilities to give them even more utility when it comes to potential strategies. There's a ton of potential tactical options here, and that's not even taking into account special strategic options, such as a giant cruiser-wrecking beam cannon or fleetwide boosts to damage or defense that you can also use.

One thing particularly notable about this half of the game is the sound design. The music gets you pumped, the guns feel meaty when they fire or hit something, and the character voiceovers when you attack or are attacked generally go a long way towards immersing you in the game. I felt excited whenever I heard Ava telling me that we'd just hit a distant target on an improbable shot, and I especially liked how reactions differ depending on the state of your units - the character VOs get progressively more panicked as their unit gets closer to destruction. 

As far as difficulty goes, the game is challenging even on easier difficulties in some battles, and there's a wide range of difficulty options ranging from easyish to "so hard the devs haven't verified that it's actually beatable." 

The art design for the units is low detail - it's all sprite based, but it's all very self-consistent and has a strong visual style; each faction's ships look like they belong in that faction, and you can usually tell what they are and what they do at a glance. 

The visual novel portion of the game is... Interesting. Unlike a lot of VNs, the main character - the one who gets the most development - is the player character. Indeed, I haven't even found any of the genre-staple routes. If they're there, they're very subtle. It really comes across as Captain Shields' story, more than the story of a particular heroine like most VNs. 

Especially since there's two basic philosophies in play that help shape the character - when decisions come up, they're typically either a matter of pragmatism or idealism. For example, early on there's a choice of whether to strike a vital enemy communications relay while its defense fleet is resupplying, or stop a fleet of pirates from trafficking slaves, and it is these types of choices that help establish the Captain's personality and behavior.

On my first playthrough I ended up mostly idealistic with a slight bit of pragmatism as the war got darker and more desperate, and so Captain Shields was palpably suffering and growing disillusioned from the contradictions involved. 

The overall plot is somewhat basic but servicable thus far - it has some themes in common with Muv-luv, especially when it comes to the impact of fighting on people, but it also echoed the disillusionment of the Iraq war in the second half. While I haven't read a VN with a story quite like this before, it doesn't have any huge unexpected plot twists until the very end. To be fair to the story, I didn't see that twist coming; I thought it would be something different based on the hints so far, and that's good writing since it caught me by surprise.  

Mechanically, the story has the right level of tension, and at all points you *feel* like you're outnumbered and outgunned and only winning battles through tactical genius. My only real complaint is that at one point the villains had the heroes dead to rights but didn't kill them. (Granted they'd just gotten what they wanted, but still.) 

I say thus far because the story isn't complete as of this review. The content available now ends on an abrupt cliffhanger with a "coming soon, episode 3!" taunting me. Still, what's there is meaty enough to sink my teeth into, and if the writing quality holds up to the end, it should end up being really interesting. Especially if some of the plot points foreshadowed early on come into play.   

That being said, there are some anime cliches present, seemingly for levity's sake. So if you have a low tolerance for such things (for instance, there's a "beach episode" in between major military campaigns), Sunrider might not be for you. I didn't mind it soo much because the cute cliches helped lighten the mood; without some light stuff, the story would have rapidly gotten too dark.

But any VN is carried by its characters more than its plot. Initially, Sunrider's characters read as stock archetypes more than characters (shy waif Chigara, cold Rei-type Sola, tsundere Icari, etc), with personalities dominated by a core trait. I wasn't impressed; at first I came back mainly for the tactical gameplay and resolved to ignore the VN half of the game. 

However, as they get more development over the course of the game, they grow into fully fledged characters in their own right. Sola isn't just a cardboard cutout with no personality, she has hopes and dreams that set her apart from the typical "cold asocial pale girl." Asaga in particular started off as my least favorite character and grew to become one of my favorites, simply because of how she developed over the course of the story.

Generally, all the characters grow beyond their stock type quickly enough for me to forgive their beginnings. 

Though not plot or character related per se, there's a surprisingly rich background setting here, one with a vaguely mythic/fantasy-esque quality. Learning why almost all the characters are women, for example, was surprisingly plausible and interesting, even if it was just a single throwaway line there to establish setting background. Still, I'm impressed that the writer thought of details like that. 

Overall, Sunrider is a surprisingly good game. It's not perfect. The character art is a bit too flat outside the CGs, and the background material that's there now leaves me wanting more. The art for the units, while strong stylistically, still doesn't have huge amounts of detail. It's not going to drop your jaw in the same way an AAA game's art might. Its plot is somewhat predictable up till the end, and its characters start as archetypes more than characters per se.

But it soon grows beyond those shortcomings. The characters grow into their own, the gameplay is fun, and the story is entertaining even if you can mostly see its general flow ahead of time. And the sound design is generally very strong.

For a free game, it's very good. So good that I wouldn't mind spending actual money on it. 

Do I recommend this game? Yes, definitely. I found it charming. The fact that it's free merely makes it even easier to like.

13034028.review:
Short version

Pros:
1. Good story and characters (with one possible exception).
2. Decent turn-based combat.
3. Very funny moments.

Cons:
1. A bit immature at times.
2. Combat gets frustrating and un-fun near the end of the game.
3. I'm suspiciously surrounded by attractive young women.

Long version:

    Let me start out by saying that I have not seen enough anime to recognize tropes. Because to me these characters appeared to be fully fleshed out and enjoyable individuals. Regardless of what the others say I found them to be likable and believable (with the exception of Claude who's only personality trait is that she's hopelessly infatuated with you). They have there own problems and strengths that they bring to the gameplay. Everyone of them is a capable warrior who contributes a great deal to the combat when used properly. 
   The story itself starts out pretty basic. Take revenge against the jerk who destroyed everything you hold dear. the game also gets amazingly deep at the same time. They allow the world that they have created to mirror our own to a large degree. Anyone with a passing understanding of history will notice that the main villains are Space Communists and that the urban warfare story arch is remniscent of our fights in the Middle East. In fact, the game takes a long, hard look at the horrors of war when you can't tell friend from foe and the consequences thereof. It really challenged me to reconsider how war should be conducted. It should be noted that it didn't change my mind but it forced me to accept that such conditions are simply horrible.
   Back to the characters. They all have a certain charm about them. There's not a one that I wish was not there. Even Claude (shallow as she is) brings a certain entertainment value with her. Most have a tragic backstory that elicited an emotional response from me (though it could be that I'm a sucker for a pretty face). 
   The combat seems hit-or-miss to me. On one hand it has several ways of doing damage. Each method has it use and optimal situation, but it always seemed better to get into a situation where one heavier damage types could be used. I always ended up grouping my units together for prtection and going from there. Flanking is not an option. Ever. It can also be rather frustrating later as hundreds of missiles get thrown at you until one or two of your units are down by the second round. Eventually I lowered the difficulty until I could just proceed with the story. This is largely because the story was by far the strongest element of the game. 
   Then there's the "fanservice." I know that it's my fault for not looking into the game enough (ooooh free stuff), but  I rather wish it wasn't there. I came to love the characters when they were fully dressed, I will continue to love them even if they remain so. There is really no need for such gimmicks. Especially since the writers have proven that they can craft a beautiful galaxy and narrative without such foolishness. Basically, developers, you're better than this by no small margin.

The game has a decent story & characters. Story & characters are likeable and the girls are drawn very decently.
Mechs look cool as well. Too bad I can't say the same about the males in this game - it does show the character drawer specialises in women. Men look like wusses, thankfully they don't show quite as commonly (perhaps that's why, who knows..). Visuals all around are nice!

As for music and voice acting - I like it very much. Sound FX are quite good in this game.

Now for the tactical gameplay - at the time I am writing this, this game suffers greatly from how imbalanced it is. I stared playing on "Captain" mode, which is what the game suggested at the beginning. Why not? I finished Sengoku Rance not once, but multiple times - I thought myself being more than prepared. Now, all was well until the battle of Far Port - I did beat it eventually, but dear lord was it hard!

Reading the forums I see people saying "Captain is easy, I don't have much trouble on Hard" - well, that is utter bollocks. The game arbitrarily scales down your hit/defend ration, and scales up the opponents. Now, this isn't bad in itself. But they did it in the style of XCom - E.Uknown. It's utterly unfair for the player. But hey, games should not be fair right? They should be challenging! I dig that, but now the game is sadistically hard, based mostly (from my experience) on luck. You can have the best strategy, try to tactically engage etc. - you will get crushed anyway unless the goddess of RNG smiles upon you. And yes - I am not new to strategy games and if you say it was easy for you - please PM me the video of how you did it, cause based on my experience and the people's on the forums - you're just a troll.

Maybe I will beat this game on the 'default' difficulty some day.. but the amount of frustration this brings isn't being overcamed by satisfaction when winning a mission.

Now for the adult part - so far I've seen Asaga's breasts once when she was under the shower.. Maybe I made some wrong choices or didn't focus on 1 character enough. But this really seems lacking.. I mean Katawa Shoujo made a much much better job at that.

Summary: Overall I like the game, what it wishes to be. I like the characters. I dig the battle system, but at this stage it's imbalanced and frustrating. Visuals and voice/sound/music are really nice. If only the battle system was better thought out - challenging, but not frustrating (on the default difficulty!). Lets hope the devs keep tweaking!
